name: Boston Badminton Westboro (MA)
description:
Please join us in doubles badminton!  Boston Badminton Westboro Meetup is about getting together to play an incredible sport. Intermediate and above players are welcome.  Please, no beginners or near beginners as we are a pretty solid group of intermediate players. You must know the rules of the game, and be familiar with all the basic shots including smashing, and know how to cover the court in doubles play. Thank you.
Sign up only if you are sure you can make it, and worse case, please cancel well in advance and no later than a couple of days before the Meetup.  Canceling the day of the Meetup itself does not leave people on the waitlist enough time to make it.  You will be banned if we notice a pattern of booking and canceling or not showing up.  "No shows" are a problem not just to people left on the waitlist who are prevented from coming, but also to the Badminton Club, who expects us to have 12 people there in return for giving us exclusive use of 2 courts for 2.5 hours. Please show up on time and bring you own equipment.  It is available for rent/purchase if you do not have everything you need.  As for shuttlecocks, you are expected to provide 3-4 new feather shuttles per Meetup.  White soled shoes only please.  Cost is $17 per Meetup but only $5 if you are a member of BBC. No use of 10 pack passes please.

name: CircleSinging Boston - Metro Area
description:
On August 22, 2024 the Christian Science Monitor, an acclaimed international newspaper, published an article about CircleSinging Boston. Here it is:
[https://www.csmonitor.com/The-Culture/Music/2024/0822/boston-bobby-mcferrin-circlesinging-acceptance](https://www.csmonitor.com/The-Culture/Music/2024/0822/boston-bobby-mcferrin-circlesinging-acceptance)

Beyond MeetUp, we can be reached at 
circlesingingboston@gmail.com

Our gatherings happen in Cambridge, Arlington, Jamaica Plain, and Somerville.

CircleSinging is a spontaneous, improvisational community-singing experience. In a circlesong, a leader starts by improvising a line of music and gives it / teaches it to one part of the circle. The leader then develops a second part that goes with the first and gives that part to another section of the circle. CircleSingers learn and repeat the exact part given to them. Soon we are singing a four part (at least) chorus that has never been sung before. This chorus can support individual solos.  
The effect: never-before-sung, wordless, fun songs, melodies, harmonies, and rhythms. The music may be glorious or goofy, complex or simple. Each circle is a unique experience, created by a spontaneously collaborating community.  
A leader improvises.  CircleSingers learn and follow their parts.  **Voila!** — a newly created choral piece.  It's easy to participate, you just repeat your part with other singers.  Anyone can volunteer to lead, but there is never any pressure, no one is put on the spot. Our sessions include other vocal games and improv formats.

This is a “mistake-free” zone, for all levels of singers — we sing for the sheer fun of it! Sing beautiful harmonies without sheet music. Witness a circle of people creating music together. Come sing with us! Participants find it a joyful, exhilarating (and many have said spiritual) experience. Improvising and music-making can give insight into other life issues. Many notice cooperation, teamwork, and community.

We take inspiration from methods developed by the unique and illustrious Bobby McFerrin and his collaborators, and from CircleSinging groups in cities around the US and the world.

Below find:
     -   A. More about CircleSinging - 9 video clips
     -   B. A world map of circlesinging locations
     -   C. An interview with David Worm about Circlesinging in general and Oakland's annual "Sing for Your Life Event" each December 30th.
\- D\. A description of CircleSinging by 3 of Bobby's close collaborators

A. More about circlesinging - 9 video clips: 
If you are new to circlesinging, you can hear and see examples in the videos below: 
1 - In this video you'll see a circlesong created with several parts.  (first, the leader does a little solo improvising).. click here   [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=a9C4O-ezpFU](http://meet.meetup.com/wf/click?upn=pEEcc35imY7Cq0tG1vyTtxGQuRNzBhUp5L0moh8u5X88q8IaGBv1w1SdD1rKxRKVrh3gItlDAGcrC1G6F7wurA-3D-3D_-2FQw1seqWrCQgd-2Fw6x2o5viUtxhPykoQggJ13MRc9L06cZISiGerig62cBOxzR-2BOpRLSpfak7phRWPTmSAM-2BAcikhJOwjyPExDJTn-2FP-2Fh-2BJ1Ag1sL1T19egXAP3kVDdEoLarkaWwdXXjoZCdncy5VajhBcXFEly32n93ifI9drwBGUuFRsPDwjyRvN2o51fc430OCREWRRaWHtHxXrFAKMEGh-2B34o5M16lKlO333UxRw-3D)­
2 -   In the following video, Bobby McFerrin creates a circlesong with audience members, then riffs on top of it. Start watching at minute 5:25 (through 9:30)[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=WznXAdYo8xc](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=WznXAdYo8xc)
3 -  Berklee faculty member Joey Blake leads students in circlesinging in this video starting at minute 1:28. You also see individuals improvising solos on top of what has been created so far. [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=GFHAf1vR9cE&list=P...](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=GFHAf1vR9cE&list=PLEY3ynEZmNayl_6OIM60wsDDvPMfYw4Al) 
4 -   In the following video, you come into a circlesong in progress; two sections are already singing their newly created parts as the video begins ….. [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=t6WL7NYrT9Q](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=t6WL7NYrT9Q) 
5 -  Starting at minute 2:00 in the following video, see Bobby McFerrin starting a circle (and see also his playfulness with audience members) [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=PWriGiWw6i4&spfrel...](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=PWriGiWw6i4&spfreload=1)
6 - Here's a fun one from the TV show “SingOff”  start at minute 1:00  the link is [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=TNlmU4nPySI&feature=youtu.be](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=TNlmU4nPySI&feature=youtu.be)
7\. \- Video of a large gathering of circlesingers\, led by Gael Aubrit in Lyon France\.  He organizes Chant Pour Tous which sponsors circlesinging around France and nearby countries\.  [https://youtu.be/q7zbIDlwKdE](https://youtu.be/q7zbIDlwKdE)
8\. \- Another video example; Bobby invited a 2011 music teachers' conference participant to try leading a circle\.\.\.  [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=t6WL7NYrT9Q&feature=youtu.be](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=t6WL7NYrT9Q&feature=youtu.be)
9\. Not a video\, but this blog posting by Sariyah Idan\, a singer\-songerwriter / producer based between Los Angeles and Berlin\, describes her "Week with Bobby McFerrin and my Mom" after she attended the annual CircleSongs Workshop at Omega Institute in Rhinebeck NY\, August 2018\.   Link to her blog is [http://sariyah-idan.com/news/](http://sariyah-idan.com/news/)

B. CircleSinging around the world !
Now there is a map that shows where to find CircleSinging around the world.  Take a look:
[https://www.google.com/maps/d/edit?fbclid=IwAR1VtCd6huBhBjgUzMljOcCdyvJD_N-5eGKd2hh9L-nGj_HtQS0xQcGwGtw&mid=1pspsAvGVZaZz9XTNMvjAfdgggu8GT4z8&ll=31.811726062462334%2C-14.581434556391173&z=4](https://www.google.com/maps/d/edit?fbclid=IwAR1VtCd6huBhBjgUzMljOcCdyvJD_N-5eGKd2hh9L-nGj_HtQS0xQcGwGtw&mid=1pspsAvGVZaZz9XTNMvjAfdgggu8GT4z8&ll=31.811726062462334%2C-14.581434556391173&z=4)

C. Link to interview with David Worm:
[https://www.sfcv.org/preview/one-voice-circlesingers/sing-for-your-life-transforms-lives-with-circlesinging](https://www.sfcv.org/preview/one-voice-circlesingers/sing-for-your-life-transforms-lives-with-circlesinging)

D. A description of CircleSinging by 3 of Bobby's closest collaborators:
This description of CircleSongs was written by a trio of improvisors, WeBe3, Rhiannon, Joey Blake and David Worm, fabulous individuals, musicians and improvisers, and also colleagues of Bobby McFerrin & faculty with him of the annual CircleSongs workshop each August.
"This bold experiment in music making is a participatory ritual, allowing a sharing of culture through the medium of music, the voice in all its forms and colors. Singers gather in a circle with a conductor in the center. Intention is declared.
Four improvised patterned parts are given to the Soprano/Alto/Tenor/Bass sections. These patterns are changed and shifted by the conductor so that the singing continues for long stretches, creating a rich, deep and joyful experience.
This form calls forth a wonderfully primal connectedness among the singers, strengthening relationships and developing leadership. Singers are invited to solo over this hearty vocal orchestra which requires both courage and musical focus.
Working this way stretches both individual and ensemble capability.
Because we sing in an invented language in this form, it is accessible across borders and cultures, making it possible to create this musical magic anywhere on the planet."

name: 3 Steps to Spanish Fluency: Online Workshops Boston
description:
This group is for people wishing to learn Spanish to a high level of competency, especially if they have had trouble progressing in the past and are looking for a new way to improve.

The group workshops are hosted by Francis Collier and are free and open to anyone interested.

More information on paid lessons is available at the end of the workshop for anyone looking to improve further.

The 3 Step Process:

Step 1: The 12 Sounds.

In Spanish there are 12 new sounds that do not exist in English.
The first step in the process to fluency is to learn ALL of these sounds CORRECTLY.
If you don't know what all of these sounds are please be advised Francis Collier will take everyone through them in the workshop.

Step 2: Native Phrases + GVC (Grammar, Vocabulary & Comprehension).

Very often Spanish learners when presented with a native level conversation find it sounds "too fast" and they can't keep up.

Commonly there are two things that are going wrong in this step.

Reason 1. The 12 new sounds in Spanish have not been learnt and therefore the fundamental building blocks required are not there.

Reason 2. The student cannot recognise the Native Phrases used as they do not know them and have not practised recognising them. This can often happen because the student is still translating in their head from English.

What are Native Phrases?

They are combinations of words that are used so commonly in a language that they are squeezed together and said very quickly.

Think of the way someone might say “What do you want?” to their friend if they are in a drive through. It’s more like “wadayawan?”

It’s exactly the same in Spanish, there are many native phrases that native speakers say every day and practising to recognise these at speed is crucial in order to understand real conversation.

Note: GVC (Grammar, vocabulary and listening comprehension) are also focused on in this step.

Step 3: Real Conversations at Native Speed.

The third step is to practise in a conversation at REAL Native Speed.

Imagine learning to play baseball by spending hours reading books on baseball, watching and analysing old games but never playing a real game at real speed.

How long do you think it would take to get good?

This being a bad idea seems very obvious in the example above but this is what so many students do with apps and books and movies when learning a language and many of them never reach fluency with this approach.

So if you are interested in coming along and learning more about the process to Spanish fluency and how to improve your Spanish then please sign up for one of our workshops.

To sign up for the workshop go to the event page and click the on "Attend" button for the workshop link.

Good luck and we hope to see you soon.

As per meetup.com policy: Attendees under the age of 18 must have a guardian with them.

name: Boston Solo Female Travel Group
description:
This group is for solo female travelers who don’t want to wait on their friends to finally say “yes” to travel. Life is too short and the world is too big!

The trips in this group are usually 90% (or more) solo female travelers but everyone is welcome, female/male, solo/couple/friends, straight/LGBTQIA+! So let’s travel together with fun, like-minded travelers! If you have an open mind and are kind to fellow travelers, you will fit in perfectly on these trips!

If you’d like to host a Meetup in your area (i.e. a brunch, happy hour, coffee, etc), feel free to let me know and I'll help you get it set up in the group!

**NOTE:** The people on these trips are from all over the States but you’ll always be connected with people from the same city on a trip so you can meet up face to face and get to know your future travel buddies prior to the trip. You’ll also be connected to the whole group via email prior to the trip so you can virtually get to know those that are from different areas. On average, the people on each trip are 90% solo female travelers, but there are sometimes the occasional couple or solo male traveler or couple. Please understand that it’s hard to predict the exact demographic for each trip.

Feel free to join the Facebook group to connect with past travelers on these trips, see pictures, ask questions, funny travel memes, travel-related articles, etc.: [https://www.facebook.com/groups/613025845523107](https://www.facebook.com/groups/613025845523107)

The trips in this group are put on by a female-owned and -run tour company called Globe Drifters and they focus on small group trips geared towards solo travelers with the mission of giving new meaning to travel by putting the human experience at the heart of their trips. The groups are small, usually with 12 people maximum per trip and about 90% of everyone on each trip are solo female travelers so you’re not stuck being the odd man out on trips with mostly couples. You’ll have the best of both worlds, solo travel with the security of a small group of other solo travelers for some company on your adventure! To contact Globe Drifters directly, you can email [info@globe-drifters.com](mailto:info@globe-drifters.com).

name: The Boston Python User Group
description:
Welcome! Boston Python is one of the largest local Python user groups in the world.  Meet other local Python developers, learners, employers, and enthusiasts of all kinds.  All skill levels are welcome: if you are interested in Python, we are interested in you!  We have a code of conduct to ensure that everyone stays happy and productive.

We have great regular events:

    Monthly presentation series: these are longish presentations (about an hour) about topics of interest to the community.  Often we also have lightning talks (5-15 minutes) also.  If you have something you'd like to share with everyone, drop a line to the organizers!

    Monthly informal project nights: these are a chance to sit down with other Python developers of all experience levels to push your project forward, get help with a particular trouble spot, share expertise, or do whatever else you like.

In addition to meeting face-to-face, we have a few other ways to stay connected:

• Slack: https://about.bostonpython.com/slack

• Twitter as @bostonpython


Job postings on the Meetup.com mailing list are OK, as long as they meet the Job Posting Requirements.

If you'd like to help financially, you can make a tax-deductible contribution at donate.bostonpython.com.

name: Cambridge & Boston Book Club
description:
This is a group for all those who miss the pleasure of digging into a new book with the knowledge that on the other side of the cover they will have the opportunity for engaging conversation! Prepare yourself for some mid-brow chatter, snacks, and reading. We're aiming for one book a month, democratic voting selection, and wide array of subject matters probably heavily leaning towards fiction. Did I mention the snacks?

Here are a few useful tips for joining our discussions:

- You're welcome to join even if you haven't finished the book!  Often people who haven't finished find the discussion a helpful motivator to finish things up.  The one caveat is, be prepared for spoilers.

- You're welcome to join even if you're on the wait list.  We certainly wouldn't want to turn anyone away.

- Newcomers are always welcome!  We enjoy hearing new points of view and fresh perspectives.

- Typically we meet at the Democracy Center (45 Mt Auburn St., Cambridge MA) in the Rosa Parks room.  The Rosa Parks room is on your right after you walk through the front door on Mt. Auburn St.  The Democracy Center is a free, non-profit space that is very generously offering us its space, but doesn't have any food service.  So you won't be able to order food or drinks, but feel free to bring your own!  We'll also pass the hat for donations to the Democracy Center at the end - so if you could chip in a few bucks, that would be lovely.

- The group is volunteer-run and we definitely encourage members to step up and help out.  If you are interested in leading a discussion, joining the organizers group, or organizing a one-off event (like a movie outing, trivia night, author event at a local bookstore, etc.) please get in touch!  The more the merrier.

name: Spiritual Arts Institute - Boston
description:
Hello, we're so glad to meet you! If you are exploring options to advance your spiritual growth to its highest possible potential for this life--all the way to enlightenment and beyond--you couldn't have discovered a better opportunity than that offered by studying with the Spiritual Arts Institute, a NON-PROFIT metaphysical education center.

As an authentic modern-day mystery school, the goal of the Spiritual Arts Institute is to help people from all walks of life accelerate their spiritual understanding and development.

Through live, state-of-the-art online and in-person courses on spiritual healing and the process of divine evolution, with a special emphasis on working directly with the aura and divine light in meditation, we teach you how to heal and transform yourself, every possible area of your life, and others.

THE THREE CORE PROGRAMS OFFERED AT SAI

The Seven Spiritual Arts Training Program ( http://spiritualarts.org/classes/seven-spiritual-arts-training-program/ )

The Direct Divine Light Healing Training Program ( http://spiritualarts.org/classes/direct-divine-light-healing-program/ )

The Kingdom of Light Teacher Training Program ( http://spiritualarts.org/classes/kingdom-of-light-teacher-program/ )

It is our aim to help reassign metaphysics to its proper place of honor in the study of life and human development and to help inspire confidence, love, self-sufficiency, charity, kindness, creativity, and inner knowing in all aspects of life.

SAI has students all over the world. The Spiritual Arts Institute Boston group is hosted by some of these long-time students of SAI, but you don't need to be an SAI student to discover you feel right at home here.

We strive to offer a relaxing space for regular metaphysical spiritual fellowship and practical continued study of the spiritual principles to help us all better live those principles as fellow mystics-in-the-making.

Our Meetups will focus on teaching and practicing meditating with Divine Light to help address all issues of life, as well as spiritual book study, healing nights, special holiday celebrations, and continuous LOCAL support classes for currently enrolled SAI students and Direct Divine Light healers-in-training.

M I S S I O N

Our mission statement is: To offer clear, accurate, and understandable instruction designed to assist the soul in its spiritual evolution.

N O N P R O F I T

Spiritual Arts Institute is a 501 (c)(3) tax-exempt educational corporation founded in 2005 by Barbara Y. Martin and Dimitri Moraitis. It was granted its tax-exempt status in 2006. As a non-profit, Spiritual Arts Institute offers courses, workshops, holiday celebrations, and other special events on healing and spiritual growth with a uniquely clear, comprehensive emphasis on the aura.

P U B L I C A T I O N S

• Four award-winning books on the aura, spiritual healing, communing with the divine, karma & reincarnation

• A children's book of metaphysical and nature-inspired poems illustrated by Disney's "The Little Mermaid" artist

• A guided meditation CD - your starter kit to meditating with Divine Light!

Books and CDs are available for purchase/download on Amazon ( http://bit.ly/allSAIbooksonAmazon ) and anywhere else books are sold

name: Boston New Technology (BNT)
description:
Boston New Technology is a not-for-profit **startup, technology, and business community of 28k professionals**, whose mission is to help startups and local businesses launch and grow! BNT's network extends to Austin, Texas, with over 50k members across 15 meetup groups!

BNT is an awesome network for entrepreneurs, investors, coders, designers, business developers, marketers, technology enthusiasts, and other professionals to connect at live events, be inspired and educated, share amazing opportunities, collaborate, launch and learn about new product ventures, form partnerships and grow businesses!

BNT helps early-stage startups and partner companies by providing significant publicity and support from the community through BNT's live events, marketing channels, and partner groups.

BNT helps startups engage the community to get buzz, feedback, and traction for their products and services, and find co-founders, employees, partners, and other support they need.

We connect startups with our partner companies and community organizations, which provide them with mentorship, exclusive opportunities & resources, and free or highly discounted services.

In BNT's 15-year history, we have collaborated with over 200 partner companies to produce and host/co-host over **200 free and not-for-profit events, including 117+ monthly startup showcases, with over 700 companies presenting!**

At our startup showcases, 6 startups present to 100-250 members, giving a brief overview of their technology product, demonstrating it live, and answering questions from attendees. The presentations are preceded by an hour of networking and followed by another half hour of networking.

About 2/3 of BNT's network are technical and 2/3 have a role with at least one startup. The 1/3 who are not part of a startup are supporters and those “aspiring” to become entrepreneurs, who come to network with startups and others in the startup and tech community.

Would you like to **engage BNT's 28k members to receive extensive publicity** for your company's products, services, job openings, and/or events?

**Tech Product Founders from New England always present for free**. Join us to exhibit and present your product live at a startup showcase with 100-250 attendees. Learn more and sign up: https://www.bostonnewtech.com

**Partner Companies can engage and support BNT's 50k network** by hosting relevant events, speaking and exhibiting at events, and/or being featured in BNT's marketing channels.

BNT's network is led by volunteer organizers and BNT's operations are managed by **[Prepare 4 VC](https://bit.ly/BNTpvc)**.

Join the **[Prepare 4 VC Startup Oasis](https://bit.ly/BNTpvcc)**, a living, breathing ecosystem - a circular economy of value created to help early-stage ventures navigate the most difficult period of their startup lifecycle... the beginning. https://bit.ly/BNTpvcc

**If you're interested in partnering with BNT or have any suggestions or questions, please contact the organizing team via email at: Organizers "at" BostonNewTechnology.com**

We also organize these awesome meetup groups in Boston: [Boston Software Engineers & App Developers](https://www.meetup.com/Boston-Software-Engineers-App-Developers), [Boston AI Network](https://www.meetup.com/Boston-AI-Network-Artificial-Intelligence-Group/), [Boston Blockchain Network](https://www.meetup.com/Boston-Blockchain-Network/), [Boston Cloud Computing and DevOps](https://www.meetup.com/Boston-Cloud-Computing-and-DevOps/) and [Boston Marketing Technology](https://www.meetup.com/Boston-Marketing-Technology-Meetup/)

BNT thanks these amazing companies for being our top partners/supporters: AWS (Amazon Web Services), AT&T, Autodesk, Blue Cross Blue Shield, Comcast, Constant Contact / Endurance International, Dassault Systemes, Draper, Fidelity Investments, First Republic Bank, Foley Hoag, General Assembly, IBM, Microsoft, O'Reilly Media, PTC, Salesforce, Schwab, The Boston Globe, UPS, Verizon, Wayfair and WeWork.

Boston New Technology is dedicated to providing a harassment-free and inclusive event experience for all members/participants. [Please review our policies here, for attending events and engaging fellow members online and in real life](https://bit.ly/BnTterms).

Check out free events, opportunities and resources[ on our website. ](https://www.bostonnewtech.com/)

We look forward to seeing you!

name: 7-Figure Entrepreneurs Boston
description:
Welcome to the 7-Figure Entrepreneurs Boston Meetup! This is a group of accomplished business owners and professionals who have earned a 7-figure lifestyle and provides opportunities for driven and ambitious entrepreneurs to realize the same success. Whether you're a seasoned entrepreneur or looking to take your business to the next level, this group is for you.
 
We hold regular events sharing strategies for growth to allow small businesses to scale affordably. Bringing expertise in sales, marketing, and business strategy, members share what’s working so that others can implement it to drive more revenue, run their business more effortlessly and ultimately earn the freedom we’re all striving for.
 
Some members join our meetup without ever having developed a marketing plan or implementing an online growth strategy, others have found some success growing their business digitally but still aren’t seeing the traction they hope to achieve. Countless members have gone on to 2-10X their business as a result of our meetups, which feature topics such as:
    •   End-to-end systems for selling online
    •   Content strategies for creating an audience of followers
    •   Growth hacks for generating high-quality leads
    •   Leveraging social media to attract clients
    •   Automating operations and using AI for scale
 
Join us every Tuesday for our next meetup! All online events are recorded and shared with anyone who registers, so members can watch them at their convenience.
 
As entrepreneurs, we believe in changing the world and making it a better place by bringing our passion projects to life. With a community of deep industry expertise, we empower each other to make our dreams a reality. Thank you for contributing to the community, and we hope to see you at an event soon :)

name: The Wicked Awesome Femmes of Boston
description:
Once upon a time, there was a group called the "Fab Femmes" for the girly LGBTQ women of Boston, but it sadly disappeared in early 2013. This group was created in an effort to revive the group! If you're a femme, love women, and live in or around the Boston area, this group is for you. Feel free to join us for a drink, hobby, or outdoor adventure. And, if you would like to suggest an activity, we welcome suggestions :)

Please note the following before submitting a request:

*Although we welcome all femme LGBTQ women, we do ask, for the safety of the group, that you provide a clear photo authenticating yourself - one that clearly shows your face, instead of body parts, cartoons, inanimate objects, landscapes, etc. If your photo does not meet these guidelines, your request may not be approved.

*This group is about creating and maintaining friendships between femme/feminine women (lesbian and/or bi-sexual) in the community. There aren't many of us, so this is one way to connect with the other femmes of Boston.

<br> <br>

<br> <br> <br> <br>

***Code of Conduct***
The Wicked Awesome Femmes (WAF) is dedicated to providing a harassment-free community for women of the LGBTQ community. Participants violating these rules may be sanctioned or expelled from the community at the discretion of the WAF organizers.

Harassment includes offensive verbal or written comments related to sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, disability, physical appearance, age, body size, race, nationality, or religious beliefs, deliberate intimidation, threats, stalking, following, harassing photography or recording, sustained disruption of talks or other events, inappropriate physical contact, and unwelcome sexual attention. Community members asked to stop any harassing behavior are expected to comply immediately. Sponsors and presenters are also subject to the anti-harassment policy.

If a community member engages in harassing behavior, the WAF organizers may take any action they deem appropriate, including warning the offender or expulsion from the WAF community. If you are being harassed, notice that someone else is being harassed, or have any other concerns, please contact a WAF organizer immediately.

If you have questions or feedback about this Code of Conduct please contact one of the organizers.

name: Quantified Self - Boston
description:
Quantified Self - Boston (@QSboston) is a regular show and tell for people who are tracking data about their body and conducting their own personal investigations and research into their bodies, minds, and selves. Anything is game -- from personal genetics to ways to digitize and track information, from how to self-diagnose to how to self-experiment with data and statistics.

Topics include, but are not limited to:

* Self Experimentation

* Personal genetics and genome sequencing

* Generating, capturing, and working with biometric

* Lifelogging, lifecaching, lifestreaming

* Chemical Body Load Counts

* Self Experimentation

* Risks/Legal Rights/Duties

* Behavior monitoring, tracking, and modification (including studying habit forming and breaking)

* Location tracking

* Non-invasive Probes

* Digitizing Body Info

* Sharing Health Records

* Psychological Self-Assessments

* Medical self-diagnostics and keeping track of one's own medical data

The Quantified Self blog: http://www.quantifiedself.org

description:
Are you a QA Engineer, software tester, in Software Quality Assurance, automation developer, or QA-curious in Boston? Join us and participate in our many monthly events! Not in Boston? Follow us on Twitter! https://twitter.com/Mot_Boston

The Greater Boston QA and Testing Group was founded as a software testing Meetup in November 2015 by Conrad Hollomon.  The group rebranded itself the Ministry of Testing - Boston Meetup, in January 2017m coming under the umbrella of the UK software testing group Ministry of Testing <http://www.ministryotesting.com/>.

Other Ministry of Testing groups based in the USA:

* Ministry of Testing - Atlanta
* Ministry of Testing - Philadelphia
* Ministry of Testing - Portland, Oregon

This is a group for anyone interested in discussing the latest issues in software development for quality assurance professionals. We believe the more we can get testers coming together then the better chance we have of advancing our industry in a good and positive direction. Let's share knowledge and best practices and elevate our craft across the industry! Whether interested in QA automation, engineering, testing, or simply wanting to learn more about the tech industry - all are welcome!

Please read and adhere to the Ministry of Testing Code of Conduct.

name: Boston Sprinting Club
description:
Boston Sprinting Club – Fun, Fast, and Exhilarating!

Rediscover the thrill of running as fast as you can, just for the sheer joy of it. In a world where most adult running groups focus on jogging or slow-paced / long-distance running, the Boston Sprinting Club is here to bring back the exhilaration of sprinting for fun like when you were a kid.

This group is all about the excitement of running fast—whether you're a seasoned sprinter or just curious to see how it feels to push your limits. We welcome all speeds, so whether you're lightning fast or just want an excuse to see if your legs can still run, you're in great company. The focus is on running as fast you want, having fun, and making friends.

We'll do some light stretching to warm up and help prevent injuries, ensuring everyone can have fun without any setbacks. Feel free to do more of your own stretching and set your own limits. We are not responsible for any injuries of course. You do you, and we want you to be safe. So, lace up your sneakers, and leave the office chair butt print behind. Join us to have some fun sprinting through Boston together!

Ready. Set. Go!

Members are welcome to post relevant activities and events. The site will be used to share information about events and activities connected to the Local Food movement within Greater Boston and New England, foodie events, and cultural food events. Every now and again, we will invite you to Local Foodies of Boston sponsored events and offer discounts to these events. We will also host at least one Local Foodies of Boston gathering per year to connect members together.

name: Boston's Social Nerds
description:
Meet up with other people interested in Sci-fi/Fantasy, Video games, Board games, Anime, Internet memes, and web comics. Our group enjoys social outings such Japanese Festivals, Conventions, Movie Releases, Checking out Local Bars, Book Signings, Hikes, Themed Holiday parties, and more! We also host Movie nights, Board Game nights, and Video Game meet ups.  21+ members only.

Code of Conduct

Boston Social Nerds is dedicated to providing a respectful, harassment-free community for everyone. We do not tolerate harassment or bullying of any community member in any form. 

Harassment includes offensive verbal/electronic comments related to personal characteristics or choices, sexual images or comments in public or online spaces, deliberate intimidation, bullying, stalking, following, harassing photography or recording, sustained disruption of talks, Meetup chats, electronic meetings, physical meetings or other events, inappropriate physical contact, or unwelcome sexual attention. Participants asked to stop any harassing or bullying behavior are expected to comply immediately.

If a participant engages in harassing behavior, representatives of the community may take reasonable action they deem appropriate, including warning the offender, expulsion from any BSN event, or expulsion from mailing lists, discussion boards and other electronic communications channels to resolve the issue. This may include expulsion from BSN Meetup group membership.

If you are being harassed, notice that someone else is being harassed, or have any other concerns, please act to intercede or ask for help from any organizer/representative of the BSN community.

This Code of Conduct has been adapted from the Plone Foundationand is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution-Share Alike 3.0 Unported license

SPONSOR MESSAGE  

Lyft is currently offering members of our Meetup free ride credit to try the service! Visit https://www.lyft.com/invited/NERDS to get your free credit.

name: The Boston Robotics Group
description:
Promoting technology innovation and marketing collaboration in Robotics. \



Robotics are at the intersection of a number of megatrends: Sensors & Networking, AI, Infinite Computing, 3D Printing, Energy Storage. Robots are being created to tackle every conceivable challenge and once they are connected to the internet it will enable the creation of new, potentially disruptive services.
Meet other local Robotics Enthusiasts, fellow entrepreneurs, business and government executives, investors, and technology researchers to discuss ideas and building techniques on robotics, drones, automation, autonomous systems, DIY, embedded vision, etc. and have fun! It doesn't matter if you have lots of Robot friends or are just in the dreaming phase, this is the place to find out what's going on in the robotics community.

name: Boston Fishing Enthusiasts
description:
Hi!
It's time for Boston to have a fishing group. New England has the best seafood on the East Coast, and there are SO many avid fishermen and fisherwomen (fisherpeople) in the area. We just don't know about each other!
Fishing enthusiasts have many reasons to band together and go in a group.
1. Share resources- if members go together, they can save on equipment, bait, boats, carpooling, lures, and more!

2. Share knowledge- What are "busting fish?" What are "slicks?" What is the correct lure for medium sized saltwater game? When are where can you find small mouthed bass in MA? NH? ME?RI?

3. Share dinner!!! What is better than grilling your freshly filleted catch with friends at the end of a long day of fishing?

Members are welcome/encouraged to become Event Planners by contacting (text or phone is best) the Organizer that currently oversees administrative functions (Peter). You may have your own boat/kayak/canoe or can beg/borrow/rent. Ideally, Event Planners should organize a Meetup at least every other month.

Anyone who is looking to make and meet new friends in and around the area is welcome to join. Activities are not limited and can vary, depending upon the members interests. This is your group and members are strongly encouraged to voice their ideas and opinions.

Please get involved today. You have been granted the power to suggest new events. Check with your friends to see who else may want to join in the fun. Thanks to Aspen for getting this going! Now, its yours to make what YOU want out of it.

To get get a new meetup on the calendar, suggest all you need is a Title/Headline, Place and date&time.  When 2 more people rsvp yes it's a meetup. Don't be discouraged if it takes a few tries. Its OK. Just put up what you were going to do anyway and see if someone else can join you.

name: Reinventing Work: Boston
description:
Work isn’t working for most people. 

How many times have you dragged through a business process you found pointless? Been told of a new direction having never been consulted? Sat in a meeting feeling you couldn’t share your real thoughts?

The next phase in organizational evolution goes by many names: New Ways of Working, Self-Management, Human-Centered Work, but at its essence is a belief that people have a fundamental need to create something meaningful through their work, move towards mastery, direct their own work lives, and progress on a journey of self-actualization.

Work is often unproductive and unengaging because companies don’t empower their people to take ownership and make real decisions. The few that have are joyful, healthy, human, and successful.

This group is about connecting those of us interested in the ideas above to share, inspire, workshop projects, socialize and really whatever else emerges - we’re excited to meet you!

name: Boston Blockchain Network
description:
The Boston Blockchain Network is a community of 1,800+ experts, founders, developers, and other business professionals interested in learning, discussing, and keeping updated about Blockchain, which will transform many industries over the coming years.

Our mission is to catalyze and foster networking, education, innovation, opportunity-sharing, and collaboration among members interested in Blockchain.

What is Blockchain Technology? “The blockchain is an incorruptible digital ledger of economic transactions that can be programmed to record not just financial transactions but virtually everything of value.” - Don & Alex Tapscott, authors Blockchain Revolution (2016)

Boston Blockchain Network will offer members opportunities to talk about and demonstrate their work live at events and get feedback & support from their peers and other community members.

We also send out monthly newsletters, with awesome events, news, resources, and opportunities related to Blockchain.

**BBN is organized by** [Boston New Technology](https://bostonnewtechnology.com/), a not-for-profit **startup, technology, and business community of 50k professionals**, whose mission is to help startups and local businesses launch and grow! BNT's network includes 16 meetup groups and extends to Austin, Texas!

Would you like to engage BNT's member network to receive extensive publicity for your company's products, services, job openings, and/or events?

If you're interested in partnering with BNT or have any suggestions or questions, please contact the organizing team via email at: Organizers "at" BostonNewTechnology.com

This group is dedicated to providing a harassment-free and inclusive event experience for all members/participants. [Please review our policies here](https://bostonnewtechnology.com/event-attendance-terms/), for attending events and engaging fellow members online and in real life.

We look forward to seeing you!

We enjoy talking about how to automate the purchase and sale of securities using statistics, machine learning, data mining, and algorithms.

name: Boston Fishing Enthusiasts
description:
Hi!
It's time for Boston to have a fishing group. New England has the best seafood on the East Coast, and there are SO many avid fishermen and fisherwomen (fisherpeople) in the area. We just don't know about each other!
Fishing enthusiasts have many reasons to band together and go in a group.
1. Share resources- if members go together, they can save on equipment, bait, boats, carpooling, lures, and more!

2. Share knowledge- What are "busting fish?" What are "slicks?" What is the correct lure for medium sized saltwater game? When are where can you find small mouthed bass in MA? NH? ME?RI?

3. Share dinner!!! What is better than grilling your freshly filleted catch with friends at the end of a long day of fishing?

Members are welcome/encouraged to become Event Planners by contacting (text or phone is best) the Organizer that currently oversees administrative functions (Peter). You may have your own boat/kayak/canoe or can beg/borrow/rent. Ideally, Event Planners should organize a Meetup at least every other month.

Anyone who is looking to make and meet new friends in and around the area is welcome to join. Activities are not limited and can vary, depending upon the members interests. This is your group and members are strongly encouraged to voice their ideas and opinions.

Please get involved today. You have been granted the power to suggest new events. Check with your friends to see who else may want to join in the fun. Thanks to Aspen for getting this going! Now, its yours to make what YOU want out of it.

To get get a new meetup on the calendar, suggest all you need is a Title/Headline, Place and date&time.  When 2 more people rsvp yes it's a meetup. Don't be discouraged if it takes a few tries. Its OK. Just put up what you were going to do anyway and see if someone else can join you.

name: Boston Functional Programming
description: Many programming meetups are language specific. This has some advantages, but leads to each community feeling isolated. Our goal is to bring all kinds of functional programmers together so that good ideas can quickly spread.

name: Boston Microbiome Meetup
description:
The Boston Microbiome Meetup is a networking Meetup group of local scientists interested in the microbiome field. The Boston/Cambridge area has a vibrant microbiome research community that spans academia, pharma, biotech, and other sectors. Our group aims to make it easier to navigate this wide-reaching community and provide opportunities to meet, share, and learn.

We are grateful to our past and present sponsors for providing the accommodations that make the events possible:
• MIT Microbiome Club
• Merck Exploratory Science Center (Cambridge)
• Northeastern University
• Boston - Nixon Peabody
• Illumina
• Center for Microbiome Informatics and Therapeutics
• Taconic
• Takeda Pharmaceuticals
• CosmosID
• Precision Medicine Consultants LLC

If you are interested in sponsoring an upcoming Meetup, please feel free to reach out to our organizers.

\* Our Boston Microbiome Meetup group is just a local meetup group, and we do not receive or provide funding of any kind. We therefore rely on our sponsors to manage their own compliance considerations as they host us. As a courtesy reminder, our sponsors generally wish to remind everyone that HCPs may not take part in any meals or beverages, unless otherwise noted. This helps in compliance with potentially relevant transparency laws.

We are interested in using cool tech to grow business and make the world a better place. Some of the technology topics that we care about are: cloud platforms, artificial intelligence, blockchain, analytics, automation, cloud services / APIs, data science, integration, application development, and governance.

name: Boston Presentation Design
description: Meet with others in the business world for tips and tricks on how to create PowerPoint presentations that support strong stories and compelling design. There is much more to creating a presentation than just using PowerPoint as a tool. A business story can be crafted by using creative thinking techniques and the outlining tools available in PowerPoint. Mix that with a little visual design skill and you have created a successful message.

name: Reinventing Work: Boston
description:
Work isn’t working for most people. 

How many times have you dragged through a business process you found pointless? Been told of a new direction having never been consulted? Sat in a meeting feeling you couldn’t share your real thoughts?

The next phase in organizational evolution goes by many names: New Ways of Working, Self-Management, Human-Centered Work, but at its essence is a belief that people have a fundamental need to create something meaningful through their work, move towards mastery, direct their own work lives, and progress on a journey of self-actualization.

Work is often unproductive and unengaging because companies don’t empower their people to take ownership and make real decisions. The few that have are joyful, healthy, human, and successful.

This group is about connecting those of us interested in the ideas above to share, inspire, workshop projects, socialize and really whatever else emerges - we’re excited to meet you!

name: Qlik Meetup - Boston
description:
Qlik Meetups are for Qlik users by Qlik users. At the core, Qlik Meetups are for Qlik technology end users to hone their skills and knowledge for personal and professional success – whether they run a small workgroup solving complex data problems or a global function within a large organization with thousands of Qlikers. A Qlik Meetup can take many forms - from just a few people getting together to talk about the latest Qlik Sense release, to large gatherings with demos and deep technology dives. Qlik Meetups are free from any selling or marketing – from Qlik or its partners. These are supportive networking spaces where Qlik users share challenges and successes in order to create value.

Join our WhatsApp group: [https://chat.whatsapp.com/KMn7bKco8KF0kiibTgUSwi](https://chat.whatsapp.com/KMn7bKco8KF0kiibTgUSwi)

name: Boston Sprinting Club
description:
Boston Sprinting Club – Fun, Fast, and Exhilarating!

Rediscover the thrill of running as fast as you can, just for the sheer joy of it. In a world where most adult running groups focus on jogging or slow-paced / long-distance running, the Boston Sprinting Club is here to bring back the exhilaration of sprinting for fun like when you were a kid.

This group is all about the excitement of running fast—whether you're a seasoned sprinter or just curious to see how it feels to push your limits. We welcome all speeds, so whether you're lightning fast or just want an excuse to see if your legs can still run, you're in great company. The focus is on running as fast you want, having fun, and making friends.

We'll do some light stretching to warm up and help prevent injuries, ensuring everyone can have fun without any setbacks. Feel free to do more of your own stretching and set your own limits. We are not responsible for any injuries of course. You do you, and we want you to be safe. So, lace up your sneakers, and leave the office chair butt print behind. Join us to have some fun sprinting through Boston together!

Ready. Set. Go!

description:
Welcome to our co-ed soccer meetup group! Whether you're a seasoned pro or a newbie to the game, we invite you to join us for some fun and friendly soccer action.

Our group is designed to accommodate players of all skill levels, so don't worry if you're just starting - we'll make sure to provide a supportive and inclusive environment for everyone.

Soccer is a great way to stay active, meet new people, and have fun. So whether you're looking to improve your game, or just looking for a fun and social way to get some exercise, come join us for our next meetup. We can't wait to see you on the field!

If you are interested in learning more about new robotics developments, join the vibrant and growing community of techies and non-techies who are changing the world one robot at a time!

Join our events to learn about the latest advances in hardware and software robotics, computer vision, AI, and exciting robotics applications. There will be presentations from the teams at the leading edge of robotics from research and industry. You'll see demos and robots in action and have a chance to meet a like-minded group of people who want to make Boston the place to be in the world of robotics!

We partner with MassRobotics and many startups as well as large companies.

Join us at the Boston Video Editors Meetup.com group for coffee and networking with local professionals in the creative industry.

Whether you're a videographer, film editor, or a freelance editor, this is the perfect place to expand your creative circle and create valuable connections for new career opportunities.

Discuss the latest trends in online video marketing, techniques in movie production, and share tips and tricks using Final Cut Pro, Avid, Premier Pro, and other editing software. Get inspired and even find your next job in video editing with us!

name: Men's Talking Group - Boston
description:
Hello Men,

Please join us for a bi-weekly virtual talking group where you can bring your whole self and share your life experiences with fellow men. **We meet on the 1st and 3rd Tuesday of every month at 7 PM.**

This group is all about fostering a community to provide a safe space for group members to engage in open and honest discussions with other men.

We focus on keeping it real with honest and vulnerable sharing, embodying our feelings, and actively listening to one another. This way, we can really connect on a deeper level and work on a healthier, more positive version of masculinity.

Please come and join us for some good vibes and great conversations!

If you haven't been to a talking group before or have any questions, please feel free to shoot me a text and I can give you a call back.

Zach B. Corby
718.710.6142

name: Long Now Boston
description:
The Long Now Boston Meetup Group is organizationally independent but philosophically aligned with The Long Now Foundation in San Francisco. Recently the Boston Meetup Group received permission to form an independent non-profit in the Boston/Cambridge area using The Long Now Foundation name. A first for Long Now. Stay tuned for developments over the next many months as Long Now Boston begins it new chapter. 
The Long Now Foundation was founded in San Francisco in 01996 (www.longnow.org). As stated on their website: Long Now was established "to develop the Clock and Library projects, as well as to become the seed of a very long-term cultural institution. The Long Now Foundation hopes to provide a counterpoint to today's accelerating culture and help make long-term thinking more common. We hope to foster responsibility in the framework of the next 10,000 years."
The Long Now Boston effort was founded by Bill Davison in 02015. We started the Long Now Boston Meetup Group in January 02016. We now have an active Steering Committee and Events Planning subgroups. Our program year typically extends from September through May with an occasional summer event.

Join us!

View our Code of Engagement [https://bit.ly/EngagementCode](https://bit.ly/EngagementCode)

name: Authentic Self (Boston)
description:
Looking to make positive, supportive friendships and creating more meaning, well-being and authenticity in every area of your life? Join at our next event!


What We’re About:

Authentic Self is a proven, evidence-based method to living your most desirable life. Our programs support the development of resilience and enable peak performance by cultivating meaning and purpose in our every day. Our method and coaches will support you in the important process of priority shifting, improved focus and cultivation of well-being. Learn more at https://www.authenticself.com/


Group Facilitator, William Jackson, PsyD:

William is a meditation teacher, clinical health psychologist, researcher, and Co-Founder of Authentic Self. William has spent the last 15 years teaching mindfulness-based meditation to groups and individuals and six of those years as a fully ordained Buddhist monk. In addition, William has trained in clinical applications of meditation and mindfulness practices including Mindfulness Based Cognitive Therapy (MBCT) and Mindfulness Based Stress Reduction (MBSR). To learn more about William visit: https://skillfulmeans.life/


During these regular meet-ups we will follow this general schedule:

1. Get Moving Warm Up  (7-15min)- Brief stretching and movement regimen

2. Streamline Your Mind Practice (15min)- Brief mindfulness based meditation exercise to connect and cultivate focus

3. Live with Intention Exercise (20 min)- Live with Intention Worksheet

4. Accountability Sharing  (15 min) - Pair with a partner to share values and top goals you will be planning and working on this week/month

5. Socialize (30 min) - Grab tea/coffee and get to know others in the group


Hope to see you there!

name: UiPath RPA Boston
description:
This group is dedicated to generating awareness around Intelligent Robotic Process Automation (RPA) and UiPath programs and platforms. RPA is a fast-growing capability that automates business processes through any combination of software robotics, cloud solutions, cognitive automation, and artificial intelligence.

Come for information, connection, and to get an insider's look at how you can get involved more with RPA technology. Share your experiences and hear from others what worked for them. See demonstrations of what is possible today and hear what will be possible in the future through integration with Artificial Intelligence (AI), Deep Learning, Machine Learning, etc. Just a few examples are shown below:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rE2WRUDiODI


https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=fpr8xW-YscA

We will be inviting organizations who are already working on UiPath RPA projects to share experiences on various topics around RPA, the business cases, the platforms, the strategy, the skills needed to be successful, governance, HR concerns, Digital Transformation, and the future scope of RPA technologies - i.e. the important things needed to get started and be successful.

We believe human work should be creative and inspiring and are happy to have you join on our journey. If you'd like to get started with RPA, please visit https://www.uipath.com and you can start automating right away.

The meetup group is for anyone excited about what the future of intelligent process automation holds. If you are interested in a presenting, contact us so we can schedule you at one of our upcoming Meetups.

We aim to meet ideally every two months. Food and drinks will be provided at all events.

node.title: WEBINAR : UiPath Live! - RPA Market Update w/ CEO Daniel Dines

name: MultiFamilyMasters - Boston, MA
description:
Welcome to our local #MultiFamilyMasters real estate meetup group where we connect and educate individuals on the benefits of multifamily apartment investing & passive income.

MultiFamilyMasters has 75+ meetups across the USA and our goal is to provide as much value as possible while hosting both local meetups and online Zoom events.

Please Join our large content-driven [FREE Facebook group](https://www.facebook.com/groups/mfmasters/) where we have close to 10,000 members and we are constantly providing industry news, tips, & tricks, and other valuable resources for investors who purchase or invest in commercial real estate.

We have also thrown real estate conferences with 350+ attendees and we offer a mastermind that teaches the ins & outs of apartment investing.

This group is only as great as its members, feel free to add value, ask questions, and as always, network! network!! network!!!

Visit [our website](www.MultifamilyMasters.com) to learn more about us.

And we would like to extend a special thank you to our official sponsor & sister company; [ investNOWcapital](www.investNOWcapital.com), where we teach the benefits of passive investing while also offering high-return real estate investments.

We are here to advance the augmented reality industry in Boston by connecting and empowering its community.

AWE Nite Boston is a place for developers, creators, investors, founders, corporate decision makers and curious folk to come together to celebrate the activity and devote conviction around building an augmented reality (AR) hub in Boston.

AWE Nite Boston is part of AWE, the world's #1 XR event series, which has a reach of over 250,000 professionals all dedicated to the adoption and growth of augmented reality as the next wave of computing. name: Women In Music Boston
description:
1. Women in Music is a 501(c)3 non-profit organization founded in 1985 in New York. WIM now encompasses chapters across the country and across the globe - from LA to India to our chapter here in Boston.

We are committed to educating, empowering and advancing women in the music industry. Women in Music believes that the conversation around equality is an inclusive one, where all voices are welcome. Collectively, we are working to make the music industry a more diverse, equitable and inclusive community for all.

2. Our members are a diverse group of women, men and non-binary individuals at all stages in their careers — from students to seasoned industry veterans. We are record label executives, artist managers, songwriters, musicians, attorneys, recording engineers, agents, publicists, studio owners, music publishers, online and traditional marketers, and more. Most of our events are welcome to both members and-non members. Join us!

3. Women in Music hosts educational, career development and networking events alongside broader programming initiatives to serve the needs of our diverse communities around the world. Our panels, seminars, webinars, workshops, performance showcases, achievement awards, leadership summits, and global initiatives serve to educate, empower, and celebrate female contributions to the music world, and strengthen community ties.

name: Boston Meet the VC
description:
These events are for entrepreneurs and businesses at all stages of development in the Boston startup community. As any successful entrepreneur can tell you, success depends on more than simply having a good product/service offering. The business issues are what will make or break you.

Our monthly meetups have been created to educate entrepreneurs and help them navigate the Startup gauntlet. We have a different VC partner each month that will speak about the Boston  Ecosystem along with answering questions. We also will have panels involving notable individuals within the ecosystem that deal with HR, Banking, Incubators, Accelerators, VC's, Real Estate, Law Firms and Finance.

name: Green Software – Boston
description:
The **Green Software – Boston** group is for anyone interested in green software. We look forward to seeing you at our next event!

The Green Software Foundation is a non-profit with the mission to create a trusted ecosystem of people, standards, tooling and best practices for green software. The Green Software Foundation aims to change the culture of building software across the tech industry, so sustainability becomes a core priority to software teams, just as important as performance, security, cost and accessibility. The Foundation's mission is to reduce the total change in global carbon emissions associated with software. Ensuring that all of our members and contributors feel that they can actively contribute will ensure that we create an environment that promotes belonging and will lead to better outcomes.

More info available at:
[https://greensoftware.foundation/](https://greensoftware.foundation/)

node.title: Green Software Foundation Global Summit Boston hosted by BCG
Join the Race to Build Sustainable Software!

name: Moms Around Boston
description:
Are you a mom in or around Boston, MA looking to make friends with other moms? Then you’ve come to the right place!

Hi, I’m Louise (37) and I moved to Boston from the UK with my husband and baby (son) in Aug '22. I moved here not knowing a soul and struggled to find inclusive groups where I could make new friends with other likeminded moms and meet up with/without our children on a regular basis - this is why I started this group!

Raising children, whether new to an area or not, can be isolating. I’d love to create a friendly and supportive community where us moms can meet up (with or without our children - your choice) and explore Boston & surrounding areas together whilst going on coffee dates, brunches, walks, play dates, family-friendly excursions and maybe even the odd yoga class?

I would also like to run events which include partners and husbands, because sometimes it’s hard to get a sitter and sometimes we’d just like to socialise as a family… :)

They say “it takes a village to raise a child” let's build our own Mom Tribe in Boston together 💕

\- \- \-
Follow us on Instagram: [@momsaroundboston](Www.Instagram.com/momsaroundboston)

T&C:
Children attending any of our meetups & events must have a parent/guardian supervising them at all times; we are not responsible.

name: Psychedelic Integration of Boston
description:
The Psychedelic Renascence is here and Mother Earth’s Sacred medicines and psychedelics are making there way into our homes, boardrooms, healing spaces, and mainstream conversations.

Welcome! We are gathering to share wisdom, knowledge, practices, rituals, and support and to create space for open, interesting, deep, healing and trippy conversations.

Sometimes it is hard to make sense of a journey, and they can alter our sense of self, other and the world, sometimes they can even reveal hidden traumas…One thing is for sure… these medicines are powerful, transformational, beautiful and challenging and it is essential to connect and integrate and feel part of a community.

Come join us, share your heart, wisdom, medicine and journeys.

name: Boston Software Engineers
description:
**These are not your typical software engineering events.**

Boston Software Engineers is a unique community dedicated to creating groundbreaking events for software engineers. Our focus includes emerging technologies like Artificial Intelligence (AI), Machine Learning, Large Language Models (LLM), Robotics, 3D Printing, Computer Vision, Wearable Devices, and more from a software engineering perspective.

Our events feature expert speakers on various technical topics, welcoming both seasoned coders and enthusiasts. Coding ability is encouraged but not required to attend our events. We cover app development in various languages including Python, Ruby on Rails, C, Swift, Ruby, SQL, JavaScript, Java, and PHP.

Join Boston Software Engineers for unparalleled networking opportunities and connect with innovators building the future.

Code The Future.

name: Boston Social Sailing
description:
Boston Social Sailing was organized to help people interested in sailing meet up, sail together, and have fun.

Boston Social Sailing invites everyone interested in sailing come sail with us. Everybody is welcome, from experts to novices and to those who have never sailed before.

Group’s Charter:

• All sailing events are free. 

• To make sure everyone gets to sail, new members will be given a priority in booking sailing adventures.

• We will have special sailing adventures in summer.

• Sailing adventures will be recreational for the most part with an average duration of 4-8 hours.

Please note that members with 3 "No Shows” to a sailing event will be removed from the group. Please remember to update your RSVP in-time to give others opportunity to take your seat on the boat. If you can’t make it, please try to give us at least a 24-hour notice. Of course, a more advanced notice would be appreciated.




Boating is an inherently dangerous activity. Members assume all risk associated with their activities, while sailing in a boat and during any event. Member hereby acknowledges that serious accidents may occur during boating or other activities and that mortal or serious personal injuries and/or property damage or other loss may result from participation in the sailing events. Members knowingly assume all risks of participation in the events, including all risk of personal injury and loss of or damage to the Member or their property, including further injury sustained as the result of the efforts of persons who come to the aid of Member(s) if injured as a result of participation in the sailing events, and hereby release all other persons and entities mentioned above who might otherwise be liable to Member.

name: API Craft Boston
description:
About the Boston Members

API Craft Boston is a vibrant community of individual API practitioners who see building APIs as a craft. Our goal is to drive leadership and open discussion in the API development space as we move toward a more connected world. Also, check out API Craft on Google Groups to collaborate with other API craftspeople around the world.

Our standards are simple - we are a community of individual API practitioners who see building APIs as a craft.

We represent our own opinions, and not that of employers or anyone else.

This meetup is open to thoughtful posts from prospective employers who want great API thinkers and doers.

This meetup is not open to posts from vendors who are promoting their products or spamming recruiters.

Come collaborate in an open space to get tips, ask questions you may have about APIs, and then feel free to hop into the conversations.

API- Craft Conference from Joe Monzo on Vimeo.

description:
Boston Growth Hackers is a community of practitioners and strategists alike who all share the goal of growing their companies through sustainable and scalable customer acquisition. 

While growth hacking has become synonymous with marketing - and sure, we'll cover that - our events will encompass everything from data analysis to user psychology, product development to hiring a high-performing growth team. 

We sponsor a little of everything - formally organized panel events, fireside chats with some of Boston's best and brightest, and informal meetups to get us all talking and networking. 

---------------

Want to weigh in on the kinds of topics you want more of? Have an idea for an event, or want to volunteer your time, workspace, or expertise for our next gathering? 

Contact us below - we'd love to chat.

name: The Boston Asian Professionals Meetup Group
description:
Fun, active, diverse events which include lunch, dinners, day trips, indoor & outdoor activities, cultural events and mixers. We've been very active this year and the fun events continue. The best part is many of our members have posted ideas for events themselves. And a number of these ideas have become official events. We hope you will join our group.

This Meetup group is created for local Asian and Asian Americans (professionals & college students) to interact and network in a fun, relaxing environment. We gather to share a unique perspective that belongs to people of Asian descent and to celebrate our diversity as well. Our members come from near and far (Boston to California to Asia).

Check out our calendar and photos to get an idea of what we are about. It's a great way to meet new people and have fun.

If you join our group - please:

1) include a current photo of yourself to help identify you at events.

2) include your actual first name in your profile (last name is not required)

3) fill out profile info (do not leave it blank)

4) please be considerate of the organizer(s) and other members by keeping your RSVPs up to date and attending events when you have RSVP'd. A little courtesy and consideration go a long way, so please update your RSVP if your plans change. (see no-show rules below)

5) Inappropriate and/or rude behavior will not be tolerated. Members will be subject to removal for these actions. And do not spam other members.

No show policy: No Shows are cause for removal.

    1 no-show = warning.

    Multiple no shows - subject to removal. 


    Unfortunately we have had to remove some members because they ignored these rules. Please be respectful to the organizers, event host and other members.

     We hope to see you soon.

     Steve
     Organizer

name: Boston Classical Meetup
description:
Boston Classical Meetup was created in August 2011 to provide a general classical meetup group for veterans and rookies alike. We attend all types of classical performances: symphonies, operas, chamber works, etc. in all kinds of venues - even house parties! (think Schubertiade...) The [Boston Opera Meetup](http://www.meetup.com/BostonOpera/) works in tandem with the Boston Classical Meetup for opera events.

We will usually be meeting after performances, sometimes before, and occasionally during. Pre- and post-performance activities (lectures, receptions, parties, etc) are usually part of the meetup itself, so be sure to check the details! 
Check out [The Boston Musical Intelligencer calendar page](http://classical-scene.com/calendar) and feel free to suggest a meetup. Please note that you would likely be responsible for coordinating the event.

**Update - October 31st, 2022** \- As of November 1st\, Meetup will no longer support group pages\. The "[About Boston Classical Meetup](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1AqD9nncV2xSgU_VXR7a75zdZ9jh93JtF_HXKahB0Zuo/edit)" page by Mike Stoughton has been preserved for posterity in this [Google Sheets workbook](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1AqD9nncV2xSgU_VXR7a75zdZ9jh93JtF_HXKahB0Zuo/edit). Screenshots are in this [Google Docs file](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1QlCT-VSlWJDJDYrgu70dQH6RDgwSnUuXVNl4Jswjr5M/edit).

name: Hedera Hashgraph - Boston
description:
Hedera Hashgraph is a public ledger that takes advantage of the hashgraph consensus algorithm for you to build fast, fair, and secure decentralized applications. On Hedera, developers can use APIs to build the future of peer-to-peer payments, tokenized assets, digital identity, and more.

Join us to learn best practices, how to use Hedera network services, how hashgraph works, and hear from the teams building an entirely new class of applications on Hedera. Our meetups offer a great opportunity for community members to connect in-person, have fun, and gain knowledge on how to be a part of the shift to our decentralized future.

Resources:

• Company Website - https://www.hedera.com/

• Community site - https://hashgraph.org (https://hashgraph.org/)

name: Machine Learning Boston
description:
This is an application focused look into machine learning theory, implementation tools, and related topics. We are interested in exploring how to leverage machine learning and similar techniques to positively impact real people. This means our topics will not stop at the creation of machine learning based tools but will also include the deployment and shipping possibilities as well. name: Boston Game Crew
description:
Ready for a wild time? We're pretty rambunctious!
If you are, then this is the right crew for you.

We have a couple of rules, and hope that you can oblige.

Here's the usual schedule:
Thursdays - Cards Against Humanity
Saturdays - Jackbox Games
(yup, that's it)

Here and there, we change things up and play on a Tuesday or a Sunday, or we'll play Codenames, Gartic Phone, etc - if we're in a silly, goofy mood.

It's not every week; we do what we like. We hope that you do too, just you know - in life.

Here are the rules.

#1 No abusive, harassing or intolerant language - specifically slurs and discriminatory terms

#2 This isn’t a dating meetup - unwelcome, unsavory advances will not be tolerated

#3 Zoom etiquette - be sure to mute yourself if you’re having a in-person conversation to allow zoom conversations to happen
\* If you're muted, don’t take it personally - we’re just trying to be a good host to the others

We do have a no-show policy with the classic three strikes. Womp womp.

Let's do our best to be excellent towards each other! We're here to foster a fun environment, so we hope to see you be a part of that !!

name: Boston Thelema Discussion
description:
Do what thou wilt shall be the whole of the Law

Thelema is the philosophical and religious system started by Aleister Crowley in 1904 with the publication of Liber AL vel Legis, also known as The Book of the Law. Thelema focuses on individual liberty and practices such as ritual magick, mediation, and yoga to get more in touch with your true self.

This group is to discuss the concepts in Thelema and the work of Crowley and other relevant authors, and how they relate to the modern world. We aim to meet bi-monthly for discussion groups around the Boston area. Everyone is welcome, whether you've been a Thelemite for years or are just hearing about it for the first time and curious what all this stuff means.

Anyone interested in other New Age spiritual practices like Wicca, Shamanism, Hermetic Qabalah, or Satanism may find something interesting here.

Love is the law, love under will

- In 2017, 1090 decentralized applications (DApps) and more than 700 tokens were deployed on the Ethereum network.

- An average of 100,000 new users join the Ethereum ecosystem every day. 

- The Ethereum network processes one million transactions daily.

name: Boston Paranormal Investigators
description:
We are not currently accepting new members but that is a temporary situation.

Boston Paranormal Investigators was formed in March, 2006 to promote research into all aspects of the paranormal; hauntings, UFOs, parapsychology, and other topics that fit under this umbrella. Members enjoy the following benefits:

\* Structured field investigations
\* Monthly meetings for planning and reporting
\* Assistance in conducting individual investigations
\* Examination/peer reviewing of evidence
\* Online repository for written reports and collected evidence

We also focus on educating the general public by lecturing, contributing to films, podcasts, or books, and participating in local conventions and fundraising events. 

We take a scientific approach and try to find natural explanations for reported phenomena, while keeping an open mind. Additionally, we attempt to capture verifiable evidence using such tools as Infrared camcorders, EMF meters, Ambient Temperature Sensors, REM Pods, Static Field Meters, Digital Recorders, Thermal Imaging Cameras, Spirit Box/Frequency Sweepers, Motion Sensors, Digital Cameras, and similar technologies. In addition, we recognize the complementary value of psychics, sensitives, mediums, and others, and welcome their assistance. Our members have been featured on SyFy's *Ghost Hunters* and on the Biography Channel.

Active members must reside within the metropolitan Boston area and are expected to contribute $5 monthly dues. Dues are necessary in order to purchase equipment and supply deposits for fee-based investigations. 

No previous experience required, just a serious interest in the paranormal and a commitment to attend monthly meetings and investigations. If you want to ask a question, arrange for a speaker or presentation, or request help with a haunting, please message Laura or Barry directly on Meetup.

name: Trillium Awakening Boston
description:
The Trillium path, which is an off-shoot of Waking Down in Mutuality, supports an integrated awakening to consciousness, embodiment (our lives and bodies), and mutuality (conscious relatedness).

In this work you will find awakened presence and transmission, deep listening to one another, and compassionate acceptance of experience, all of which aids your integrated awakening process.

Awakening and transformation happens readily and organically as we relax into Being here. With the awakening comes a feeling of okay-ness and wellbeing that is persistent and permeates one’s life.

We begin to realize ourselves as the unknowable Mystery that delights in Being everything. With this comes a trust and a felt-sense realization of not being separate from “other” or anything outside of our local identity. We realize “I” and “we” are the Beloved, the Source, we have been longing for. We realize we are simultaneously unity and uniqueness, and we not only honor each other and our differences but also lean into a unique relatedness in service of conscious evolution and global transformation.

What are our Meetups like?

Our gatherings, called sittings, are led by Trillium Awakening™ teachers Gena Netten and Allan Morelock (who are from New Jersey). The sittings include silent meditation, mutual gazing meditation, and conscious exploration of your awakening process in a setting that facilitates profound trust.

Join us and give yourself the chance to steep in a sacred space dedicated entirely to the deepening recognition of all that we are, as a platform for individual and collective evolution.

You may have an extensive spiritual history, or little, or none. We welcome you to join this collaborative exploration of integrated awakening!

(Please note: This group is not a substitute for psychotherapy.)


FIND OUT MORE...

We encourage you to read a little about this work before attending one of our gatherings so you have some context and can optimize your experience. In particular, we recommend these resources:

1) Explore these recommended resources

http://www.trilliumawakening.org/getting-started/

http://www.trilliumawakening.org/about-embodied-awakening/

http://www.trilliumawakening.org/exploring-our-services-and-offerings/

http://www.trilliumawakening.org/introduction-to-trillium-awakening-sittings/

2) Set up a free exploratory conversation with Gena Netten and decide whether this work resonates for you.We can meet by phone or Skype. I can be reached at gena@genanetten.com.


TRILLIUM AWAKENING TEACHERS SERVING BOSTON AREA

Gena Netten - http://teachers.trilliumawakening.org/GenaNetten/

Allan Morelock -http://teachers.trilliumawakening.org/AllanMorelock/; http://batgap.com/allan-morelock/
