name: The Boston Wine Meetup Group
description:
***Welcome to Boston Wine Meetup Group***!
This group is dedicated to all that is wine. Welcome. Whether you are just learning how to hold your glass, are a casual wine drinker, or a passionate expert, we are happy to have you on board.

Our events range from informal tastings at Boston-area restaurants and wine stores, to large formal events, movies, socials, food and wine pairings, dessert wines, reds, whites, rosés, Old World vs. New World wines, wine terroir vs. varietals, the language of the label, wine-related travel, lectures, history, cooking with wine...

BostonWine is a "big-tent" group, so we welcome anyone and everyone who enjoys the pleasures of table. Come and share a bottle with us.
the organizers
\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-
**BostonWine Group Policies and Disclaimer**
You must agree to ALL of our policies to be a member of our group and attend our events.

LEGAL DRINKING AGE REQUIRED
You must be of legal drinking age to be a member of our group. By requesting and continuing membership, you swear and affirm that you are over the age of 21. Further, any guests you bring to our events must be 21+ as well. If you intentionally or unintentionally misrepresent your age, or the age of a guest in order to provide alcohol to a person under the age of 21, the organizers will ban you from the group and possibly notify the proper authorities. Please have a photo ID handy when you come to one of our events.

DRUNKENNESS NOT TOLERATED
Drinking alcohol is a normal activity of this group, but getting drunk is NOT! We expect our members and their guests to know their limits and be responsible wine drinkers. Those who over-indulge to the extent that it disrupts an event, raises safety concerns about the member or others at an event, or potentially presents a liability to the group, will be banned from the group.

By being a member of BostonWine, you agree that you and your guests will follow the guidance of the organizers if told to stop drinking, need to leave, take a cab or ride from a fellow member, etc. Further, at the discretion of the organizers, the proper venue or legal authorities may be notified in cases of extreme safety concerns.

AUTHORTY OF ORGANIZERS
The organizers of BostonWine work hard to create and run great events. In some cases the organizers enter into financial understandings with a venue, supplier, or other third party as part of an event. By requesting membership with BostonWine you acknowledge and accept that the organizers are the only persons with the authority to speak for the group, decide who may or may not be a member of our group, decide what events to plan and how to run them. In particular, you agree that the organizer of an event has final authority on how the event is to proceed, what adjustments might have to be made during the event to ensure it is a success, what constitutes proper behavior and generally how to maintain order.

PROPER BEHAVOR
BostonWine events generally are casual, educational and fun. We expect all members to behave as responsible adults and show respect for other members, their opinions, similarities as well as their differences. If an issue arises with another member, staff at a meetup venue, or on the group's web site, you agree to notify the organizers and let him/her handle the situation. Further, you agree under no circumstance to argue or otherwise get into a dispute with another person during an event.

The consumption of alcoholic beverages may impair one's judgments or actions to act responsibly. If a member participates in any action that the organizer deems is harmful or threatening to themselves, another person, animal or property, or whose behavior reflects poorly on BostonWine, that member will be banned from the group.

Our discussion boards, event comments, etc. are not forums for airing personal disputes, and doing will result in your removal from the group. Using our web site to distribute email virus or other malware is a crime and will be reported to proper legal authorities.

FINANCIAL RESPONSIBILITY
Members are responsible for paying their own way and settling their tab before leaving a meetup in a restaurant or other venue where a group tab was open.

GOVERNMENT WARNING ON HEALTH CONSEQUENCES of CONSUMING ALCOHOL
The organizers and our members believe that moderate consumption of wine with food is part of a healthly lifestyle. However, alcohol consumption is ill advised for certain people in certain circumstances. By joining BostonWine, you acknowledge that there is a government warning concerning the health effects of consuming alcoholic beverages: (1) According to the Surgeon General, women should not drink alcoholic beverages during pregnancy because of the risk of birth defects. (2) Consumption of alcoholic beverages impairs your ability to drive a car or operate machinery, and may cause health problems.

MUST HAVE A PROFILE PHOTO
To join or remain in this group ALL Members are required to have a representative main profile photo at all times. A head shot is best, but not required. You will not be able to join without a photo and will be removed for lack thereof. We do this to ensure the safety of our members, but also to simplify the lives of the organizers.

PUBLIC IMAGES
From time to time, members take photographic, digital or video images of event participants and post these images to our web site. You hereby agree to allow the BostonWine group to display those images without expectation of privacy or remuneration. Members are free to request, however, that a particular image of themselves be removed by contacting one of the organizers; final determination of whether the image should be removed however is at the discretion of the organizer.

NO_SHOW POLICY
Most of our events have wait lists due to their popularity. Not showing up to an event that you have RSVP'd to is disrespectful to your fellow members, makes it difficult for the organizer to plan events and may incur financial penalties. As a result, after 3 "no-shows," the organizer may decide to remove you from the group.

DISCLAIMER
By being a member of the BostonWine group you hereby agree to assume all risks and liability related to or resulting from any and all group events, interactions with our meetup web site and other members. You agree that neither you nor any third party will hold any of the group's organizers, members, companies, officers, or representatives liable for any injury, loss, or damage to yourself, your guests or any members of your family, friends, acquaintances, children, pets, or property, arising directly or as a consequence from a group activity.

During all events, everyone is responsible for themselves. The organizers are not responsible for the safety of the participants. We will try our best to prevent accidents, but are not responsible or liable if something happens to you. Be aware of your limits and respect your fellow group members; DON'T DRINK AND DRIVE.

By joining the BostonWine meetup group and remaining a member, you acknowledge and accept these points.

Thanks,
the organizers

name: Boston Vegan Meetup Group
description:
* Stay hydrated
* Stay safe
* Stay healthy
* Stay vegan!
* Continue working on SOMETHING worthwhile.  When it's safe, we will resume some in-person activity

A vegan meetup is where vegans (whatever their PHILOSOPHY about being vegan) and vegan-oriented persons (NOT "tire-kickers" who come "to gawk at the vegans") with similar interests get together and hang out.  If you TWEET, we instantly become a TWEETUP.

DUES is $12/year, but you can give the organizer $10 in person - and all is cool.  But you can coast for 6 months for no cost, and if you volunteer for Fair Foods twice (4 hours total) or for any VEGETARIAN or ANIMAL RIGHTS CHARITY or nonprofit (including BVS, MARC, PETA, Laura Ray, etc.) - 4 hours total (and you report it), you get your annual membership free.   Also, if you attend any THREE (3) in-person events POSTED on this meetup, you get your your annual membership free, and that counts for the other two sister meetups - if you're enrolled in either or both of them.

Because of our array of motives, some focus more on diet alone, while others are concerned with an integrated world-and-life view.  We're a diverse lot, so we'll meet LOTS of folks whose interests are somewhat different from our own, but who share the vegetarian and vegan interests with usm but we may NOT agree with everyone on how important each of the elements in another's vegan worldview and personality is.

We used to have >6000 members; they were mostly lurkers, and only a subset of those >6000 members would attend any particular event.   But now we have about 600 members, and the same dynamic is seen.

Further, by networking with BVS, GBBCC, MARC, BVA, NEAVS, other veg groups, and other meetups, we get to know one another.

Grasshopper, My Thai, Veggie Planet, Veggie Galaxy, Clover Food Lab, True Bistro, Red Lentil, Organic Natural, Life Alive, and others vegan hangouts are our favorite meeting sites.

We're always "BECOMING a vegan group"; BRING SOMETHING VEGAN-ORIENTED TO SHARE (newspaper clipping, book or DVD, photos, etc.) with other attendees as a way for them to get to know you and you to know them. Sharing IS "becoming" for veg*ans.

What and how we share? A news article, a story with a vegan interest, some information (old or new) with a vegan slant, a memento of traveling as a vegan, info on a great vegan website or resource or event, etc.  Be creative.  Pleasantly surprise us.

While a monthly dining out group is hosted by Rick Williams, a monthly vegan meetup also is held on the 1st Saturday of each month - 11:30 am to 2 pm - at the Clover Food Lab at either: 
* Harvard Square, Dunster Street? of Mass Avenue, Downstairs, Cambridge, MA 02138
or 
*Clover Food Lab or elsewhere (watch the announcements)

Clover Food Lab is the BVS default location

Vegetarian Happy Hours [Happy Hour with Vegetarians] or monthly dining out group
Join Vegetarians-Of-Boston Meetups for regular Vegetarian Happy Hours - or monthly dining out group
http://Vegetarian.Meetup.com/27/ (site varies)
3rd Sunday of the Month with BVS - 4:00 pm-6:30 pm - Grasshopper - www.BostonVeg.org

Other events are at all-vegetarian restaurants, often by following the events of local vegetarian and animal rights groups.

We tag along with BVS (BostonVeg.org), BVA (BostonVegan.org), Vegan Meetup events, and MARC.

Vegans - If you're here (in ANY one of the designations below), you belong in THIS GROUP

Former Vegetarian, Now Vegan
Fruitarian Vegan
Long-term Vegan

The Cannabis Marketing Association (https://thecannabismarketingassociation.com/) is a membership based organization that supports professional and creative growth by providing career resources, education-based events and networking opportunities. A team is only as great as its members. Join the Cannabis Marketing Association (https://thecannabismarketingassociation.com/membership/) and be counted amongst the legal marijuana industry’s top marketing, communications and public relations professionals.

The mission of the Cannabis Marketing Association is to bring a positive perception to, and authentic understanding of, cannabis and its consumers around the world. CMA does this by supporting the professional growth of cannabis communications professionals by providing industry education, cultivating community, and establishing best practices.

Although this group is dedicated to the Boston area, CMA events are entirely virtual as a result of COVID-19. Meet, learn from, and collaborate with cannabis communications professionals within the CMA network — we meet online on a weekly basis to network with and educate one another. Industry leaders speak about specialized topics and answer audience Q&A at our virtual meetings. Welcome!

*Being a member of this Meetup group is not indicative of CMA membership. If you are unsure of your membership status, please email info@maketingcannabis.org.*

Join today, here. (https://thecannabismarketingassociation.com/membership/)

name: Boston Writers of Color (BWOC)
description:
The Boston Writers of Color (BWOC) group, is a network that consists of over 2,000+ members through Facebook Group, Meetup, and our mailing list. As part of GrubStreet’s BWOC program, writers of color and community members share resources, network, and mutual support. The group aims to provide writers of color with a safe and welcoming space to commune, share their good news or writing struggles, and find their people. Literary opportunities and events in the Facebook Group are posted daily, Meetup is used solely for events, and our newsletter is sent out once a month. Opportunities include writing contests, publications, pitch calls, writing conferences, residencies and retreats, free and paid writing classes, and more.

To join our writing community, and have access to writing events and opportunities, join our [Facebook Group](https://www.facebook.com/groups/550348355148320/) and our monthly newsletter: [https://grubstreet.org/get-involved/join-th...](https://grubstreet.org/get-involved/join-the-mailing-list/)

name: Blood on the Clocktower - Boston MA
description:
Blood on the Clocktower is a new hidden identity and social bluffing game. It's the next level of Resistance/Werewolf-style social deduction games and is extremely addictive! Boston recently received a pre-release copy, and we are running regular game nights for those who delight in deduction and deception.

Each game lasts about an hour and many games are played in a single session, so feel free to drop by for one, some, or all games in a night. Try out your best tricks and charms as you make new friends — and then accuse them of murder.

BOTC differs from existing social bluffing games. Every player has an individual role that is powerful, knows something, or comes with a unique challenge, and those abilities may malfunction unexpectedly! No two players or games are ever alike. The game also has a moderator who runs the game, disseminates information (and misinformation!), and ensures that every game is different, interesting, and filled with nail-biting tension. Players stay on as influential ghosts even if they die, and may even enter a game after it starts as powerful "Travellers".

You can find out more about the game at bloodontheclocktower.com. New events and other announcements are made on our various social media outlets, which can be found on botc-boston.com.

We started this free support group in NYC and are expanding to Boston. We aim to help individuals dealing with grief. If you are struggling with grief, we hope to meet you at a future meeting!

If you're a book reader, intending to to read more, or just like good conversation over good food, I invite you to join us.

name: Boston Grief Support Group
description:
We started this free support group in NYC and are expanding to Boston. We aim to help individuals dealing with grief. Our main focus is loss (death of a loved one, divorce, breakup and so forth) but we welcome anyone dealing with any issue resulting in grief. Unlike other programs, our meetings are all drop-in. If you are struggling with grief, we hope to meet you at a future meeting!

Note: This is a peer facilitated support group, please see a professional if you need expert assistance.

Visit our website for more resources: https://griefx.com

name: Boston Foodies Cookbook Club
description:
Do you love to cook, try new foods, and make friends over a glass of wine and a shared plate?

If so, then you’re in the right place!

Welcome to the Can’t Get Enough Cookbook Club, where we always have room for more food, more friends, and more opportunities to share a good meal in community. Boston foodies and home chefs, you’ve found your spot!

Here’s how it works: each month, everyone will bring a favorite or experimental dish to a potluck dinner to share. Details on the dinner party location will be provided upon your RSVP.

We can’t wait to dine with you!

name: Learning, Let's Go Boston
description:
**Our Purpose:**
Each of us have talents to share. So let's share what we were given to allow us to all experience this abundance in life. Here, we intend to be focused on learning and being a supportive group to learn / have lessons on various topics casually: dancing, music, photography, technical/job searching, sports, cooking, etc.

**You:**
A person who is ready with a learning mindset with a respectful attitude to others in the group, willing to help out as needed.

**What to Expect:**
There will be a series of different topics, starting with the things organizers have interest in or have done. We can have members teach others activities and for some series.

* Safety: Events will target visible areas and/or areas with likely public cameras for safety of all participants.
* Tracking Progress: We will have a spreadsheet to track progress.
* Media: Events may be recorded for learning purposes and/or fun, promotional videos.

**Dues/Funding**:
Some activities may have costs associated with them to pay for the meetup fees, enable learning other activities, or to cover costs for some people who just can't afford to do things. However, we will try to keep them cheap / low as we know the current environment is getting harder for us all to manage.

**Affiliations**:
This group currently does not have any affiliations with businesses or organisations.

name: Greater Boston Loneliness Support
description:
Response to the GBLS group has been minimal, and the technical procedures for linking to Zoom for virtual meetups need resolving. As a result, I have to discontinue the group. Should sufficient interest appear in the future, I will consider reviving it. And feel free to message me until then.
Best, Eric.

Here is my original Group description:

Life circumstances can leave adults isolated, without a support network, and even overwhelmed in Greater Boston. Ageing, illness, trauma, estrangement, extremes of introversion and shyness are some of those happenstances. A Zoom video chat forum provides an obvious opportunity for remedy. Rather than the casual, unfocused and random chat groups online, this one is a chance to address those circumstances in a serious way, to tell of the conditions that left us isolated, and through a gathering of persons focused on the vital connections and support network that good friends afford us, to attain a quality of life enjoyed by those less socially compromised.
 
Meeting frequency will be based on demand and keeping the number of attendees manageable, and will be conducted in English. Group privacy will be private, and members will cover only the minimal cost of any Meetup's Group/Zoom charges.
 
Again, I imagine a place where those more urgently, not casually, in need of support specific to loneliness and isolation have an opportunity to once again enjoy the relief, healing and growth among friendly people that all persons deserve.

name: Boston Cloud Computing and DevOps
description:
Boston Cloud Computing and DevOps is for developers, architects, product managers and other IT leaders interested in: Cloud technologies and services, DevOps (Development Operations), Product Delivery, SaaS (Software as a Service), IaaS (Infrastructure as a Service) & PaaS (Platform as a Service) solutions, Software Development, Big Data and High-Scalability Computing.

Join us and learn about new cloud computing technologies and best practices!

**BCCD is organized by** [Boston New Technology](https://bostonnewtechnology.com/), a not-for-profit **startup, technology, and business community of 50k professionals**, whose mission is to help startups and local businesses launch and grow! BNT's network includes 16 meetup groups and extends to Austin, Texas!

Would you like to engage BNT's member network to receive extensive publicity for your company's products, services, job openings, and/or events?

If you're interested in partnering with BNT or have any suggestions or questions, please contact the organizing team via email at: Organizers "at" BostonNewTechnology.com

This group is dedicated to providing a harassment-free and inclusive event experience for all members/participants. [Please review our policies here](https://bostonnewtechnology.com/event-attendance-terms/), for attending events and engaging fellow members online and in real life.

We look forward to seeing you!

name: Boston Imaging and Vision (BIV)
description:
The Boston Imaging and Vision (BIV)  meetup provides an opportunity for the image processing/computer vision community to network, socialize and learn. It covers the basics as well as advanced subjects, and the hottest and latest developments in areas such as biomedical and mobile applications. The meetup organizes regular events. both for folks around Cambridge/Boston, and around the i95 loop. The goal is to provide:

    Presentations from passionate speakers (contact us if you would like to talk or invite a speaker);

    Occasional workshops,  tutorials, and networking events;

    A marketplace for consultants and companies needing image processing/computer vision.

name: Elastic Boston User Group
description:
We’re delighted to have you join the Elastic global community!


This group is for anyone interested in making data usable in real-time and at scale for use cases like security, observability, enterprise search, and many more, using our Elasticsearch, Kibana, Logstash, and Beats products (https://www.elastic.co/products/).

Speak at a meetup:


The Community wants to hear from you! Present about your Elastic Stack stories, be it a 5-15 minute lightning talk or a detailed 25-45 minute technical presentation with Q&A. Our Speaker Guide is full of tips on giving a stellar presentation. If you’re interested, visit the elastic/call-for-meetups repo or send us an email at meetups@elastic.co.

Elastic Community Youtube Channel 


All meetups are recorded and uploaded to YouTube within a few days of the event. Subscribe here to stay up to date! 

Local community organizers wanted!


We’re always on the lookout for committed local organizers who will help the group thrive. If this sounds interesting to you, the Community Team at Elastic is here to support you! Email us at meetups@elastic.co.

We know that people enjoy giving back to the communities they care about, so we’ve created an Organizer guide to help you get started on your path to leading an Elastic user group.

Learn more about Elastic


Elastic Contributor Program: https://www.elastic.co/community/contributor

Elastic Community: https://www.elastic.co/community

Community Newsletter: https://www.elastic.co/community/newsletter

Discussion Forums: https://discuss.elastic.co/

Elastic Cloud Free Trial: https://www.elastic.co/cloud/elasticsearch-service/signup

Code of Conduct


This Meetup community adheres to the Elastic Community Code of Conduct. Attendance to events run as part of this Meetup group means you agree to be an awesome human and engage by these rules.

node.title: Learn about Information Retrieval, chat informally, Q&A

name: Art Lovers Therapy Boston Meetup Group
description:
**Are you looking for a creative way to cope with life's challenges?**

Join our *Art Therapy Support Group*, where we turn art into a pathway for healing. Whether you're an art enthusiast or a total beginner, this group is designed for anyone who believes in the power of creativity as a form of therapy.
Together, we’ll meet multiple times a week with skilled art therapists and a supportive group of peers, creating a safe space to explore, learn, and heal through the expressive power of art. There’s no need to be an experienced artist—just bring an open mind, your thoughts, and something as simple as pen and paper.
Each session is just $5 to cover costs, making it one of the most affordable ways to access group mental health support. If we could offer it for less, we would—because we believe everyone deserves accessible healing options.

**Important note**: This group is a complementary space to professional one-on-one therapy, not a replacement. If you are in crisis, please reach out to the appropriate resources, such as calling 988.
We’re excited to meet you and start creating meaningful, expressive art together!

**Check out our upcoming sessions and sign up here**: [Classes List | Hobi](gethobi.com)

Be kind to yourself, and don't hesitate to reach out for more information.

Meetup for 21+ yr old people in Boston and Cambridge, looking to hang out and mingle.  The group (formerly The Cambridge and Boston Singles Meetup) is now open to everyone (not just singles).

This is for people who are new to town, suddenly single, or just looking to meet new people and make new friends.

Members are encouraged to suggest activities or recommend places for group meet ups.  Ideal events are group activities where attendees can meet new people.

See you all soon......

The emphasis will be on affordable, good quality shows at local community theaters with an occasional high-end show. Each event will include a play and an optional dinner before the show, or after the show for matinees.

I am also going to host some live-music shows, and perhaps the occasional comedy show. Because these events require venue and restaurant reservations and advance ticket purchases, tickets are purchased from the organizer thru Meetup using PayPal, and events are only open to members who have reserved on Meetup.

name: Boston Generative AI Meetup
description:
**Welcome to the Boston Generative AI Meetup!**

Join us for an evening filled with engaging discussions, knowledge-sharing, and networking as we dive into the fascinating world of generative artificial intelligence.

This meetup aims to bring together AI business professionals & executives, creators, researchers & academics, entrepreneurs, designers & artists, from around the Greater Boston area to explore cutting-edge topics and applications of generative AI models, such as OpenAI GPT-4, Microsoft Copilot, Azure OpenAI Service, Claude by Anthropic, Mistral, DALL-E, Midjourney, ChatGPT, Hugging Face Transformers, Chatspot.ai, and more. Discover how innovative AI technologies and your peers in Boston are shaping the future of business, creativity, and operations transforming B2B and B2C industries across various and diverse fields.

While each meetup is different. Here is what to expect:

1. Expert Talks: Listen to inspiring presentations from leading researchers, tech industry professionals, entrepreneurs, and investors who will share their insights on the latest advancements in generative AI, practical applications, and potential business opportunities.
2. Cross-Disciplinary Panels: Participate in an interactive panel discussions featuring experts from diverse backgrounds to discuss the impact of generative AI on creativity, collaboration, and the future of business and innovation.
3. Hands-on Workshops: Dive into a hands-on workshops, where we will all learn how to use new generative AI tools and platforms. Bring your laptop!
4. Networking & Collaboration: Connect with fellow local attendees. Share your experiences, discuss ideas, and form valuable connections, new companies, and partners within the Boston AI community.

**Who Should Attend:**
This meetup is ideal for people interested in Generative AI including any creators, business professionals & executives, researchers & academics, entrepreneurs, designers & artists, interested in learning and talking about generative AI technologies. Whether you are a experienced with AI or just starting your journey in AI, this meetup offers a unique opportunity to participate and contribute to the growth of an exciting Boston community.

**RSVP:**
Reserve your spot today by clicking the 'RSVP' button. Space is limited, and we expect this event to fill up quickly. Don't miss this opportunity to learn, share, and connect with like-minded individuals passionate about generative AI!

We look forward to seeing you at the Boston Generative AI Meetup!

node.title: Boston Generative AI Meetup: Kickoff Event & Panel Discussion

Boston Generative AI Meetup - August Summer Edition

name: Boston queer adventures LGBTQ+
description:
This group is all about spontaneous queer events. I know social anxiety is real and want to make this group as inclusive as possible. We all dream of having our "squad" and here's where that can develop. If you're worried that you don't know anyone in the group, just keep in mind that you're not the only one. Sometimes we go to bigger events that make you feel lost or nervous. Call or text my cell if you feel lost 617-939-6509.
People come and go and there's always new people at every event. Sometimes no one RSVPs and 10 people show up. Sometimes 10 people RSVP and no one shows up. Just come hang out when you feel like it, and if you get overstimulated and have to walk away that's perfectly ok. No one will judge.

IoT Nation's mission is to inspire, engage, and connect entrepreneurs, investors, professionals, & enthusiasts worldwide who are active in the Internet of Things (IoT).

We look forward to seeing you at a future event!

name: Boston Mindfulness and Insight Meditation
description: Meditation is beautiful, but it isn’t always pretty. It’s not about glowing sunsets and bowls of kale. Mindfulness is a living, breathing practice that can change anyone’s life the way it changed mine and countless others: by developing skillful living from clear seeing and self-knowing. This group is not for the chosen few with limber bodies, quiet minds, and serene faces. We are open to everyone, regardless of background, previous experience, or ability to squeeze into seated lotus ... because enlightenment doesn't care if you're wearing yoga pants.

name: XRP Ledger Boston Community
description:
The XRP Ledger (XRPL) is a decentralized, public blockchain led by a global developer community. It’s fast, energy-efficient, and reliable. With ease of development, low transaction costs, and a knowledgeable community, it provides developers with a strong open-source foundation for executing on the most demanding projects—without hurting the environment.

The purpose of this group is to bring Boston-based members of the XRPL community together at local meetups and workshops. If you're interested in developing on the XRPL, want to learn more about ways to contribute to the community or just want to learn more, please join us!

name: InvestHER Community - Boston, Massachusetts
description:
Welcome to the Boston, MA InvestHER Chapter! This group has been created to help women real estate investors local to Boston meet, connect, and learn together and from one another!

MEET THE INVESTHER LEADERS
Host: Gertrude Mageza
Co - founder Real Estate Investor Majestic Properties, Boston MA
Draws on a lifetime of experience in international business. With a strong sales and marketing background she has used her business insight to help grow a multi-million-dollar family real estate investment company that grew from 2 units to 72 units in 12 months.
She believes that networking, support, training, and encouragement are important factors to success. She is on a mission to make real estate for women not just a possibility but a reality in the 21st Century.
Before real estate became her new passion, her passion was in the travel industry having worked at British Airways as a Sales and Marketing manager for 3 countries. She loves to travel and wants to have the financial freedom and flexibility to continue to follow her travel passion through her new passion for real estate.
Contact Information: Tel 617 849 0005 Email: majesticpropertyinvestmentsllc@gmail.com

INVESTHER COMMUNITY

The Real Estate InvestHER® is more than a community - it is a movement. Our mission is to empower women in real estate to live a financially free and balanced life. We are dedicated to creating empowering online and in-person communities where women have a non-intimidating environment to receive the support, knowledge, and accountability to live life on their own terms.

How To Join the InvestHER Movement

1\. The Real Estate InvestHER Membership
This one-of-a-kind membership offers women investors a supportive community and a step-by-step roadmap to create a steady recurring income to live life on their own terms. Members receive custom content that specifically helps them wherever they are on the path to financial freedom, on-demand and live events that fits into their busy schedules, and mentorship and accountability to propel them to take their business to the next level while taking care of themselves in the process. Learn More Here. ([https://www.therealestateinvesther.com/membership](https://www.therealestateinvesther.com/membership))

2\. The Real Estate InvestHER Podcast
The weekly show that has been downloaded hundreds of thousands of times across the globe details the journey of the most amazing women real estate investors, who open up their lives and share practical and strategic tools for building wealth, becoming financially free, and the mindset to balance it all.

Subscribe via Itunes ([https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/the-real-estate-investher-show/id1346815972](https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/the-real-estate-investher-show/id1346815972))

Subscribe via Android ([http://subscribeonandroid.com/therealestateinvesther.com/feed/podcast/](http://subscribeonandroid.com/therealestateinvesther.com/feed/podcast/))

Subscribe via Stitcher ([https://www.stitcher.com/podcast/andresa-guidelli/the-real-estate-investher-show?refid=stpr](https://www.stitcher.com/podcast/andresa-guidelli/the-real-estate-investher-show?refid=stpr))

3\. InvestHER Community on Facebook
We have thousands of experienced and newer community members in our free Facebook InvestHER Community group. This is a safe place for women to ask real estate investing questions and gain the support they need to achieve their goals! Join here. ([https://www.facebook.com/groups/therealestateinvesther/](https://www.facebook.com/groups/therealestateinvesther/))

4\. Amazon Bestseller: The Only Woman in the Room by Ashley Wilson
Twenty incredible women share how they were able to achieve financial freedom in a world historically dominated by men. From residential to commercial, this book is packed full of knowledge and inspiration on all facets regardless of where one is in their real estate investing journey. Our passion behind this book is to help women secure a financially strong future especially during these unprecedented and uncertain times.

“Throughout my career there were multiple occasions where I have stood as the only woman in the room. This powerful book is a must read and I only wish it had been available early on in my career!”

-Barbara Corcoran (Founder of The Corcoran Group)

Click here and get your copy TODAY!

Follow us on:
Facebook: @therealestateinvesther
Instagram: @therealestateinvesther

**COVID GUIDELINES**

COVID guidelines for indoor meetings should always follow the recommendations outlined by the CDC. Please follow your respective state guidelines for indoor gatherings.  Please note these guidelines are as of May 1, 2022 and are subject to change.

name: Boston Black Veterans Community
description:
Transitioning from the Military to civilian life was a change I never expected. Not only was it difficult to imagine another way of life completely, but how would I get there? Between how to manage the GI Bill, Post 9/11, Disability Benefits, Chapter 115, VA Hospital and more…

This group is designed to share resources, ask questions, meet up and support each other.

We will have monthly meetups where we will discuss what supports are needed. Whether that’s just chatting, helping to find and complete forms and applications, need a support person for moral support for court, housing, benefits or any other matters??

All suggestions are welcome for monthly events.

name: Metro Boston Profs and Pints
description:
[Profs and Pints](https://www.profsandpints.com/) brings professors and other college instructors into bars, cafes, and other venues to give fascinating talks or to conduct instructive workshops. They cover a wide range of subjects, including history, politics, popular culture, horticulture, literature, creative writing, and personal finance. Anyone interested in learning and in meeting people with similar interests should join. Lectures are structured to allow at least a half hour for questions and an additional hour for audience members to meet each other. **Admission to Profs and Pints events requires the purchase of tickets, either in advance (through the link provided in event descriptions) or at the door to the venue. Many events sell out in advance.**

Although Profs and Pints has a social mission--expanding access to higher learning while offering college instructors a new income source--it is NOT a 501c3. It was established as a for-profit company in hopes that, by developing a profitable business model, it would be able to spread to other communities much more quickly than a nonprofit dependent on philanthropic support. That said, it is welcoming partners and collaborators as it seeks to build up audiences and spread to new cities. For more information email profsandpints@hotmail.com .
Thank you for your interest in Profs and Pints.
Regards,
Peter Schmidt, Founder, Profs and Pints

name: Boston Escape Room Meetup
description:
Looking to join a group to play some escape games in Greater Boston and beyond? Lock yourself in here with us, then!

Never played an escape room before? Never fear! We welcome both the experienced and first timers in our group! It takes all kinds of mindsets for escape rooms, and often new players bring something to the table as much as the experienced do. It's also a great way to meet people and make friends!

For the uninitiated: Escape rooms, or escape games, are exciting hour-long adventure games that take place in rooms full of puzzles and mysteries. You and a squad of people work together to find clues and solve said puzzles, to try and escape before time runs out!

We meet up, have some food and drinks before or after, and have a great time cracking these rooms. Whether you're new or old to escape rooms, try one of our meetups this month!

Our mission is to:

\-\- Support local escape room businesses
\-\- Help others find people to play escape rooms with
\-\- Bring the community together and create friendships

Our group is sponsored by Morty, an app dedicated to tracking, searching and booking escape rooms! Built by enthusiasts for all who love escape rooms! You can join the app right now with this link: [https://link.morty.app/meetup](https://link.morty.app/meetup)

Check out our discord and join in on the discussion here: [https://discord.gg/f4gze5pRWN](https://discord.gg/f4gze5pRWN)

**REFUND POLICY**
We will try to accommodate refunds, but it's up to the escape room venue. Generally speaking, more than a few days in advance we can handle a refund and within 24 hours it's not possible. To see the exact refund policy for an experience please check the venue's website!

**PAYMENT POLICY**
Payments are due two weeks before the event starts. We'll send reminders out as the date comes closer. If no payment is made at the two-week mark, you will be removed from the RSVP list to allow room for others to join due to the limited number of spots available.

**RULES FOR A SUCCESSFUL ESCAPE ROOM**
**See Something, Say Something**
Communication is absolutely vital for solving an escape room. Most rooms are designed so that everyone can be working on something or discovering something new all at the same time, so if you don’t communicate, you might not catch some missing pieces! Nothing is worse than someone who finds something and just keeps it in their pockets. That slows us down and makes others frustrated.

**Don’t Take Over the Room**
Leadership is so important, but there’s nothing worse than someone who totally takes over. Not only is this no fun for everyone playing, it’s also going to cause you to make mistakes and slow down your team. If you are the natural leader in your team, that’s great! Just make sure you remember that you need your WHOLE team to succeed.

**Pass the Baton**
If you’ve been staring at a puzzle for too long and can’t figure out the solution, enlist a fellow team member to help or take over on the puzzle. This helps make sure that puzzles don’t get forgotten, and that there are enough eyes on each unsolved puzzle. This can continue until a few people can’t figure it out – that’s usually a sign that you don’t have all of the information yet (or that you need a hint!).

**Be a Contributor, not a Spectator**
It’s too easy to be a spectator when interesting progress is being made on a puzzle, but people are more effective when they’re spread out and working on what needs to be done! If there’s only one puzzle open however, by all means let the whole team brainstorm. On the contrary point – if someone is intently focusing on accomplishing a single task (e.g. entering a combo into a school-style combination lock), resist the urge to chime in, or yell over others that are giving the answer to a puzzle.

**Silence is Golden (Sometimes)**
Sometimes, it’s important to stay quiet when listening for hints, clues, or when narration during the escape room occurs. When this is happening, keep your voice and whatever puzzles you may be trying to solve at a minimum.

For more tips and tricks check out the [Morty Blog](https://morty.app/blog)

\*Please follow these rules in order for us to have fun at each escape room. Members who repeatedly break these rules will be restricted as to how many rooms they are allowed to attend and/or asked to leave the group

We were formerly known as The JP Women's Group. Founded 1/26/07 by Chris (formerly Hansen) Juliani.

As you prepare to join this group please...

**PLAN TO BE AN ACTIVE MEMBER!** Here's the deal...You can either show up to events and have an AWESOME time with great women, or you can never show up and never get to do what you came here to do...HANG OUT WITH AWESOME WOMEN! So please check our Meetup page regularly and come to Meetups when you can. We host stuff just about every weekend and many times during the week.

A new policy for posting meetups has been implemented as of January 2016. All group members will now be able to post their meetup ideas by using the "SUGGEST A MEETUP" link on the group's main page. name: Boston AI for Work and Beyond
description:
**Welcome to AI for Work & Beyond!**

Are you passionate about the transformative power of artificial intelligence and its potential to revolutionize the workplace? Do you envision a future where AI-driven solutions streamline productivity, enhance team collaboration, and create smarter workflows? If so, this group is for you!

AI for Work & Beyond is a community dedicated to exploring and advancing the integration of artificial intelligence in various professional settings. Our mission is to bring together AI enthusiasts, software engineers, business leaders, and innovators who are keen on leveraging AI technologies to redefine work environments and drive organizational success.

**What We Offer:**

Engaging Meetups: Regular events featuring expert speakers, panel discussions, and hands-on workshops on the latest trends and innovations in AI.
Networking Opportunities: Connect with like-minded professionals, share experiences, and collaborate on projects that push the boundaries of AI applications.
Knowledge Sharing: Deep dive into AI-driven solutions for workforce productivity, AI assistants, automation tools, and more. Learn best practices and new approaches to implement AI in your projects.

Collaborative Projects: Work together on real-world problems, hackathons, and collaborative initiatives that showcase the potential of AI in transforming work and beyond.

Industry Insights: Stay updated with the latest advancements in AI, industry news, and emerging technologies that can impact the future of work.

**Who Should Join:**
Software Engineers & Developers: Interested in developing AI solutions and integrating them into existing workflows.
Business Leaders & Managers: Looking to understand how AI can optimize operations and enhance team performance.
AI Researchers & Enthusiasts: Eager to explore new frontiers in AI technology and its practical applications.
Tech Innovators & Entrepreneurs: Aspiring to create AI-driven products and services that can revolutionize the workplace.
Anyone Curious About AI: Whether you are a novice or an expert, if you have an interest in AI and its impact on work, you are welcome here!

Our group gathers for weekend, weekday, and evening adventures, social networking, and brainstorming sessions. We focus on understanding ourselves, self-empowerment, and taking action. Join us for live music and art shows, good food, breakfast meetups, women solopreneur discussions, black women's issues, wine tastings, and professional networking opportunities. Come connect with other black girls and enjoy ladies brunches with like-minded individuals. Let's support each other in our journey to success!

We currently have chapters in Houston TX and Chicago IL! So if your in one of the three cities come out and vibe with the family :)

name: WE Startup Network Boston
description:
Welcome to WE Startup Network,
where "WE" stands for Women Entrepreneurs!
We are more than just a networking group; we are a vibrant community of women-owned businesses and aspiring women entrepreneurs passionate about the journey of Entrepreneurship.
🚀About Us:
WE Startup Network is the go-to space for women who are just getting started or
have dreams of entrepreneurship.
Our mission is simple: to empower, educate, and inspire women on their entrepreneurial path.
If you're in the ideation phase you are welcome here.
If you are still working at a job while trying to work your business, you are welcome here.
If you're juggling family life while dreaming up your next big venture, you are welcome here.
Whether you're bootstrapping your startup from the ground up or seeking your first round of investment, you are welcome here.
If you are pivoting from a traditional career path to forge your own entrepreneurial trail, you are welcome here.
Whether you've got a side hustle you're hoping to turn into a full-time passion or you're scaling a startup to new heights, you are welcome here.
If you're a student entrepreneur balancing coursework with business plans, or a seasoned professional stepping into the startup world, you are welcome here.
🌐 Monthly Virtual Gathering Highlights:
Join us for our WE Startup Network Monthly Gathering on the 2nd Thursday of every month at 6:00 PM EST. Here's what you can expect:
🎤 Topic Focus:
Entrepreneurship
Marketing
Business Credit
Technology
Artificial Intelligence (AI)
Funnels
Mindset
How to get funding for your small business
Acquiring New Clients
Social Media Strategy
E-commerce Trends
Sustainable Business Practices
Productivity Techniques
Product Development and Innovation
Remote Team Management
Branding and Storytelling
And so much more.....
🤝 Networking: Connect with like-minded women, share experiences, and build valuable relationships.
🧠 Learning: Gain insights from field experts and expand your knowledge base.
📅 Monthly Meetings: Join the network to receive the virtual meeting information and be part of our empowering sessions.
The WE Startup Network is not for those who:
Are looking for a get-rich-quick scheme or overnight success without putting in the work.
Prefer to uphold the status quo rather than embrace innovation and change.
Are not interested in a community-centric approach to business growth and support.
Do not value diversity, inclusivity, or the collective empowerment of women entrepreneurs.

name: Jews For Entrepreneurship Network Boston
description:
JFE (Jews For Entrepreneurship) Network is the leading and largest organization and platform for connecting entrepreneurs and investors, and accelerating innovation in the Jewish community nationwide.

We launched in San Francisco and Silicon Valley in November 2009. We opened a chapter in New York City in 2012 and are now bringing the Silicon Valley spirit of entrepreneurship to Boston and other U.S. locations.

Over the past 3 years we have hosted numerous pitch events, seminars, speaker panels, and networking mixers. We have witnessed numerous success stories from our participants who received venture funding or sold their companies. We look forward to connect you with each other and with the community of investors in Silicon Valley and San Francisco.

In March 2013 we are launching JFE Accelerator with the goal to help the most talented and creative Jewish entrepreneurs realize the most pioneering ideas and help their companies skyrocket in the competitive and challenging market.

An outstanding team of the most successful entrepreneurs and investors who are pioneers and visionaries in their own field will help these startups to transform their companies in a very speedy and transformative way.

Please read about us on our our website: http://jfenetwork.com

Our Facebook page: https://www.facebook.com/JFEnetwork

And join our Facebook group at: https://www.facebook.com/groups/143307866703/

name: Greater Boston Cube Cartel
description:
WHO ARE WE?


We started off as a dissident band of renegades from the Boston Social Strategy Gamers group (OK, many of us are members of that group, too -- but still) who were in search of fellow fans of gamer's games -- broadly speaking, stuff with more complexity and/or a nastier streak than you get from Settlers of Catan or Ticket to Ride. Since then, we've grown dramatically (close to 200 members at the time of this writing) and we have Meetup events to play all sorts of stuff. We're open to anyone with a good attitude and an interest in strategic tabletop gaming -- though being the sort of person not scared off by rulebooks with more than eight pages doesn't hurt.


WHAT DO WE DO?


In addition to an event almost every Wednesday in Porter Square, Cambridge, we periodically host get-togethers to play games we're interested in at various places -- time and availability permitting. All of our events are free and open to anyone who's interested unless otherwise noted. Newcomers are always welcome at our events; you don't need to be an expert in the games we play. A good attitude and a willingness to learn is all that is necessary.


We have a once-per-month session of 18XX games, and a kinda-sorta-once-per-month session of multi-player wargames. Apart from the longer time commitment, these events are like the others; everyone is welcome, including newcomers willing to learn the ropes.


We also have running online competitions for the games Brass and Through The Ages. Newcomers are welcome to be a part of these as well, and you can play them from the convenience of your own homes.


WHERE DO WE MEET?


We're a pretty urban lot, so the vast majority of our events are in the Boston/Cambridge/Somerville/Watertown/Brookline/Newton area. If this area is inconvenient for you, you are welcome to suggest an event for a venue more convenient for you; we just can't guarantee you'll get a big turnout.


WHAT IS A "CUBE CARTEL GAME?"


Basically, it's what you make of it.


We started out as a group to get together and play "heavier" examples of "Euro" (or "German-style") board games (think Agricola or Age of Steam) and that is still probably the majority of what we play. But, as mentioned, we also play some 18xx (complex, nasty "business" games with a railroad theme, like 1830: Railroads and Robber Barons) and some wargames (especially GMT's card-based wargames, like Twilight Struggle and Virgin Queen).


What we don't play much of: classic strategy games (like Chess, Go or Mancala), super-popular mass-market games (like Monopoly, Risk or Clue), traditional card games (like Poker, Scopa or Bridge), role-playing games (like Dungeons and Dragons) and collectible card games (like Magic: The Gathering). There are people in our group that like these sorts of games, and no one's going to give you a noogie if you suggest playing them, but they're not the focus of the group and are thus unlikely to make it to the table. There are some excellent local Meetups if you're interested in any of these.


In the end, we're less interested in drawing a bright-line distinction between what is and what is not a Cube Cartel Game than we are in playing what we like. The real purpose of this group is to be a sort of "safe space" where no one's going to look at you like an uberdork for pulling out your copy of Le Havre or Chicago Express.


Thanks for checking us out. We hope you'll join us soon.

name: Data, Cloud and AI in Boston
description:
To see all meetups in this group: https://www.meetup.com/pro/ibm-community/

This is an IBM sponsored Meetup group geared towards developers, data scientists, data engineers, and ALL Big Data, Cloud and AI enthusiasts. Our meetups provide an opportunity to work hands on with the solutions and tools in our Big Data portfolio and to interact and share knowledge with experts at IBM and in our extended community.

Our Meetups typically include a 45-60 minute presentation that serves as an introduction and overview for a specific Data or Cognitive topic, as well as other topics that the community is interested in. It is followed by a possible demonstration or networking with fellow developers to collaborate on applying your data skills. Depending upon the location, we can provide a cloud environment with the technologies needed, that you can use from your laptop at NO cost to you. Our meetups are FREE.

Meetup topics include (but are not limited to):

- Cognitive Solutions
- Artificial Intelligence
- Data Science
- Machine Learning
- Cloud Technologies
- Internet of Things (IoT)
- Data Visualization
- Java development
- Open Source Technologies: Apache Spark, Apache Hadoop, Python, R and others
- Data-centric Application Development
- Open Source Hadoop, SQL on Hadoop, R on Hadoop, Integration, Governance, ...
- Real Time Analytics & Stream Computing
- Text Analytics
- Relational and NOSQL Databases
- Predictive/Prescriptive Analytics
- Deep dives into the technologies that makes big data processing possible

Join us today to learn more about what is possible with software development and topics important to your community.

This group is about learning and sharing skills and techniques to thrive and build resilience through the challenges presented by climate change, peak oil, environmental degradation and cultural shifts.

Gather with likeminded folks for fun, sharing, and learning. There is a place for you here to respond positively to these challenges through edible landscapes, gardening, food forests, farming, renewable energy, green building, local currency, rainwater harvesting, composting, soil regeneration, mushroom cultivation, local food, herbalism, simple living, food preservation, time exchanges, conservation, community-building, relocalization transition towns, and so on.

Greater Boston Permaculture Guild is a MeetUp hosted and maintained by the Boston Food Forest Coalition (BFFC). We hope you will stay in touch with us and Sign Up for our newsletter and updates:

name: Boston-area Women in Bioinformatics
description:
About Us

We aim to facilitate a community-driven approach to empowering and encouraging all women++ bioinformaticians through regular meetings, networking events and workshops. We seek to give a platform to women++ professionals, including those members of other underrepresented groups in science, such as BIPOC, the LGBTQIA+ community, and people with disabilities.


Mission

The Women in Bioinformatics Group’s mission is to advance and support women++ in the fields of bioinformatics, computational biology, biostatistics, data science and informatics.


Vision

In order to accomplish our mission, we are focusing on three pillars of support: professional development, scientific communication, and community.


Professional Development: To provide opportunities and an environment conducive to the development of professional skills, empowerment, and networking within and outside of our community. 


Scientific Communication: To exchange ideas and knowledge with others and provide a forum for speakers of all experience levels.


Community: To offer a supportive community that promotes equality, works towards reducing discrimination, and welcomes all.


Code of Conduct

This meetup group is dedicated to providing a harassment-free experience for everyone, regardless of gender, gender identity and expression, age, sexual orientation, disability, physical appearance, body size, race, ethnicity, religion (or lack thereof), or technology choices. We do not tolerate harassment in any form. Anyone violating these rules may be sanctioned or banned from attending at the discretion of the conference organizers. Please contact the organizers through here if you feel someone has broken the code of conduct.

Original source and credit:

http://2012.jsconf.us/#/about

name: Inayati Order of Greater Boston
description:
The Inayati Order International of Greater Boston ( formerly known as the Sufi Order of Greater Boston ) is devoted to meditation instruction, spiritual growth, and the teachings of Hazrat Inayat Khan, Pir Vilayat Inayat Khan, and Pir Zia Inayat Khan. It sponsors classes and events occurring around southeastern New England at a number of locations: a constellation of lights. It is a branch of the Sufi Order International, an interfaith international organization.

"Thus the ultimate purpose for which the soul is seeking every moment of our life, is our spiritual purpose. And you may ask how to attain to that purpose. The answer is that what you are seeking for is within yourself. Instead of looking outside, you must look within. The way to proceed to accomplish this is for some moments to suspend all your senses such as sight, hearing, smell, touch, in order to put a screen before the outside life; and by concentration and by developing that meditative quality you will sooner or later get in touch with the inner self which is more communicative, which speaks more loudly than all the noises of this world; and this gives joy, creates peace, and produces in you a self-sufficient spirit, a spirit of independence, of true liberty." -- Hazrat Inayat Khan

name: ODSC Boston Meetup - Women in Technology
description:
ODSC brings together the open source and data science communities with the goal of helping its members learn, connect and grow.
The focus of this Meetup group is to allow ODSC to work with Meetup groups, non-profits, and other organizations to present informative lectures, workshops, code sprints and networking events to help grow the use of open source languages and tools within the data science and data-centric community. As such, our specific goals are:

1\. Build a collaborative group to work with other Meetup groups\, non\-profits\, and other organizations\.

2\. Promote the use of open source languages and tools amongst data scientists and others\.

3\. Host educational workshops\.

4\. Spread awareness of new open source languages and tools that can be used in data science\.

5\. Contribute back to the open source community\.

Who is this meetup for?

• Data engineers, analysts, scientists, and other practitioners

• R, Python and other software engineers who work with data or want to learn

• Data visualization developers and designers

• Non-technical team leads, executives, and other decision makers from data centric startups and large companies looking to utilize open source tools

name: Boston VR Sim Racers
description:
VR is a game changer for Sim Racing and Boston VR Sim Racers is a group for people interested in learning about and experiencing the thrill of VR Sim Racing. 

We typically schedule a meetup at least once a quarter with an open house at our VR Motion Labs offices in Plymouth, MA. This is where our motion and static racing simulators are designed and custom built.

At our quarterly meetup you will have a chance to meet some interesting people, some with real race experience in the likes of Porsche's, BMW's, Ferrari's, Spec Racers, etc. and you'll have the opportunity to run some laps (with instruction) in a high performance VR racing simulator with synchronized 3DOF motion (pitch, roll, traction loss). It's an amazing experience. 

If you love cars, racing, technology and VR and you want to stay on top of the latest developments in VR Sim Racing then this is the group for you.

MINT (Mathematics, Information sciences, Natural sciences, and Technology), STEMM (Science, Technology, Engineering, Mathematics, and Medicine), or STEEMM (Science, Technology, Engineering, Entrepreneurship, Mathematics, and Medicine) are similar acronyms for STEM. Biology, Chemistry, Physics, Computer Science, Robotics, Electronics, Bioinformatics, Genetics, Molecular Biology, Genomics enthusiasts: You are welcome to join our group.

Grants4Apps is an Open Innovation initiative from Bayer AG. Grants4Apps allocates grants or offers financial support to innovative healthcare startups and developer teams working in particular fields. It currently includes an accelerator program. Please visit http://www.grants4apps.com for more information. Grants4Apps supports this meetup group.

name: Boston Augmented/Mixed Reality
description:
Augmented Reality is a description used for technology that looks to enhance a user's understanding, pleasure, and engagement with real-world environment they are in. It could take the form of augmented reality glasses, it could be an app on a phone or tablet, or it could even be ear buds that actively filter the sound around you and change your perception of reality. There are many ways to enhance a person's sensory experience of the world around them, and all of these ways fall under the "augmented reality" umbrella.


At first glance it is similar to Virtual Reality, but actually quite different. VR looks to immerse the user in a completely separate environment from the one they are in, whereas AR, as just described, wants the user to more firmly be rooted in their world. As the technologies mature, it makes sense to have a meetup dedicated solely to augmented/mixed reality technologies and conversations. Our goal is not to cannibalize the community, but rather to provide another opportunity for enthusiasts to engage with each other, and for tinkerers and startups to show off their demos for feedback.


This meetup group is open to ANYONE who is interested in Augmented Reality. You don't have to be a developer to join. In fact, we actively encourage all members of the community to participate, from artists to developers to business-minded people to gamers to students to those who just want to learn more.

name: Boston Innovation Technology (BIT)
description:
**Introduction:** Welcome to Boston New Technology (BIT), a dedicated sub-group of Boston New Technology (BNT) focusing on the pivotal role of innovation in New England’s business and society. From past triumphs to present advancements, BIT is your gateway to understanding and participating in the rich legacy of innovation that has shaped and continues to drive our region forward.
**Our Mission:** BIT’s mission is threefold: to honor the past, engage the present, and inspire the future. We shine a light on the groundbreaking achievements that have defined New England’s innovative spirit, provide immersive learning experiences for those eager to delve deeper, and foster partnerships that amplify innovation across industries and communities.
**Illuminating the Past:** BIT is a beacon, illuminating the remarkable milestones and pioneering figures that have contributed to New England’s storied history of innovation. Through curated events, comprehensive retrospectives, and engaging content, we celebrate the inventors, entrepreneurs, and visionaries whose contributions have left an indelible mark on our society.
**Engaging the Present:** For those eager to immerse themselves in the world of innovation, BIT offers a plethora of resources and opportunities. Our workshops, seminars, and collaborative projects are designed to provide hands-on learning and real-world applications. Whether you’re a student, professional, or enthusiast, BIT is your hub for gaining knowledge, skills, and connections in the ever-evolving landscape of innovation.
**Inspiring the Future:** BIT serves as an ideal innovation partner for individuals and organizations aiming to build upon and amplify the innovative spirit of New England. We facilitate collaborations, provide mentorship, and offer a platform for showcasing cutting-edge ideas and technologies. By connecting innovators with the resources and networks they need, BIT helps turn visions into reality, driving progress and growth throughout the region.
**Join Us:** Step into the world of BIT and become part of a vibrant community dedicated to honoring our innovative heritage, fostering present-day creativity, and shaping the future of New England’s innovation landscape. Whether you seek to learn, contribute, or collaborate, BIT welcomes you to embark on this exciting journey with us.
**Contact Us:** To learn more about BIT and how you can get involved, visit our website at [BNT website](http://bostonnewtech.com) or reach out to us at bostonnewtech@prepare4vc.com. Together, let’s illuminate the path of innovation and continue to make New England a beacon of progress and ingenuity.

name: TypeDB Developer Community in Boston
description:
**Welcome to the TypeDB Developer Community!**

[TypeDB](https://typedb.com) is a [polymorphic](https://typedb.com/features#polymorphic-queries) database with a [conceptual](https://typedb.com/features#conceptual-modeling) data model, a strong [subtyping](https://typedb.com/features#strong-type-system) system, a symbolic [reasoning](https://typedb.com/features#symbolic-reasoning) engine, and a beautiful and elegant [type-theoretic](https://typedb.com/features#modern-language) language TypeQL.

**Background**

Over the last decade, we have seen modern programming languages have evolved by introducing powerful abstractions and constructs to express more complex logic — JavaScript is being succeeded by TypeScript, Python by Julia, Java by Kotlin, C/C++ by Rust, and Haskell emerged as the leader of functional languages. Modern languages all have stronger and more powerful abstractions, as they leverage a breadth of powerful concepts in modern mathematics: type theory -- the study of type systems and how they formally govern complex and logical systems.

However, when we look at the evolution of database technologies since relational algebra and SQL, even though there has been incredible progress in performance and operational capabilities in the past 40 years, databases have yet to provide more powerful abstractions to express more advanced logic. Database models have failed to keep up with the rapid evolution of programming languages and their abstractions, and modern applications must use complex, layered architectures to manage their data. Relational databases lack the expressivity to model polymorphism, and eliminating the schema in NoSQL databases prevents declarative data retrieval.

Inspired by the advancement of modern programming languages, we ask ourselves: with modern type-theoretic mathematics at our disposal, how would we re-think and re-design the foundations of modern databases in the best possible way?

Answering the question above allowed us to build the world's first truly polymorphic database, powered by a strong type system and a native reasoning engine. For the first time, TypeDB brings to the database the power of polymorphic abstractions, the simplicity of a composable language, and the intelligence of symbolic reasoning to infer data.

**About this community**

In this developer community, we will discuss new and modern paradigms in database engineering: conceptual data modeling, strong subtyping systems, symbolic reasoning, polymorphic queries, and truly declarative, modern, and type-theoretic query language. We will discuss how TypeDB allows software engineers to build more advanced database applications with an elegant and robust database language.

**Developer resources**

TypeDB Learning Center: [typedb.com/learn](https://typedb.com/learn)
TypeDB Discord Server: [typedb.com/discord](https://typedb.com/discord)
TypeDB GitHub: [github.com/typedb](https://github.com/vaticle/typedb)
TypeDB YouTube: [youtube.com/@typedb](https://youtube.com/@typedb)

name: Boston Informal Hiking Meetup
description:
I wanted to start a more informal meetup group for people of all hiking experiences. I tried joining a few other meetups, but there's always strict rules of gear that are required, or paid hikes, attendance checking, etc. I used to belong to a hiking group in Boston before Meetups, where members would just post a hike that they're planning, and some info about the hike, its difficulty level, what's expected on the hike, etc. And others could join the hike responsibly, taking care of packing their gear appropriately, arrange carpools with other members and split the cost for gas, etc. I moved away from Boston for 12 years, and now I'm back and wanted to meet people for hikes again.

So, this group is for anyone who is interested in hiking in the New England area based in Boston... mostly I'll arrange hikes to NH and VT... but anyone who is a member can arrange a hike. Just PM or email me with the hike info and I will post. Members who are going to the hike should make arrangements for carpool, etc among themselves.

The only requirement is that you should be responsible hikers and respectful of other members. This does not mean that it's free for all; go without any gear or safety concerns.  This means you should have common sense on what to pack and make sure you only attend hikes that are within your fitness level... and if you're not sure, reach out to the person arranging the hike to clarify, etc.  Members who do not show respect to others will be dismissed from the group.

name: AMC Boston Ski & Ride
description:
We are a group of diverse skiers and riders active in cross country, telemark, alpine, and/or snowboarding based out of Boston area. Our leaders run both backcountry and resort trips in White and Green mountains. We are organized under the Appalachia Mountain Club (AMC), which is a large collection of small groups like ours. AMC offers a structure for leadership training, peer-approved leaders, and workshops taught by volunteer instructors to help others improve their skills and participate at a higher level. Our trips are open to everyone based on ability, although participants in backcountry trips are usually screened to insure they don’t end up somewhere they don’t belong. (New England backcountry can be variable). We are NOT a young singles group, retirees on skis, or Men on a Mission. We are diverse in the style and ability of our trips and the ethnicity and age of our members. We are serious about skiing with competent leadership, but loose enough to have fun on the way. So be adventurous! Check us out and be part of our fun.

It is very important to read the full trip descriptions first, not just the trip titles, before RSVPing.  Thank you.

https://www.meetup.com/BostonLegalHackers

Legal Hackers is a global movement of lawyers, policymakers, technologists, and academics who explore and develop creative solutions to some of the most pressing issues at the intersection of law and technology. Through local meetups, hackathons, and workshops, Legal Hackers spot issues and opportunities where technology can improve and inform the practice of law and where law, legal practice, and policy can adapt to rapidly changing technology. name: Access Silicon Valley (Boston)
description:
Access Silicon Valley is the “virtual bridge” to Silicon Valley, where startup entrepreneurs and serial entrepreneurs in real time, get access to and interact with, angels, VCs and great entrepreneurs that they otherwise wouldn’t get the opportunity to see, hear or possibly connect with. In addition we have put together valuable workshops to prepare startup entrepreneurs for the roller coaster ride of the startup world!! We encourage you to join us. Access Silicon Valley is an extension of the overall global vision to build “virtual bridges” between those cities that have great startup communities and Silicon Valley. 

Access Silicon Valley began with a vision to provide startup founders access--access to educational and other information that every first time founder should know or be exposed to. This includes access to high caliber angels, VCs and “been there done that” successful, serial entrepreneurs. The Silicon Valley ecosystem is unique, which is why ASV extends beyond the geographical borders of Silicon Valley! 

This community is much more than just a Meetup group…it’s the opportunity to become part of the Silicon Valley ecosystem or “mindshare” as we like to think of it. Stay tuned for an exciting journey as we deliver events and workshops that you won’t want to miss!! 

For more information on many of our past events (and videos of these events), please visit our Access Silicon Valley website.


Please take a moment to join the ASV Facebook community: https://www.facebook.com/AccessSiliconValley

We also invite you to join us on Twitter: https://twitter.com/AccessSv

Whether you are new to Boston or a longtime resident, join us for fun and engaging meetups where you can make new connections and expand your network. name: Boston Astral Codex Ten Meetup
description:
We read Astral Codex Ten, a blog that spans across rationality, science, psychiatry, medicine, ethics, genetics, AI, economics, and politics. [https://astralcodexten.substack.com/about](https://astralcodexten.substack.com/about)

You should join if you're interested in any of these topics and want to nerd out with other nerds! You don't have to read the blog to come to our events. Everyone is welcome - please feel free come even if you feel like you're "not the type of person who normally would fit in at such events".

We mostly have very informal meetups, sometimes including dinner, games, or hiking. Occasionally we have more structured lectures or mini-workshops.

Astral Codex Ten was formerly called Slate Star Codex. The author, Scott Alexander, has written over 1,500 posts. Don't worry, you're not expected to have read all of them!

If you're not sure where to start, check out this compilation of some his greatest works here from one of our meetup members:
https://jasoncrawford.org/guide-to-scott-alexander-and-slate-star-codex

Another compilation can be found here
https://guzey.com/favorite/slate-star-codex/

See also Scott Alexander's greatest from Slate Star Codex:
https://slatestarcodex.com/top-posts/

description:
This group is operated by **Boston Young Black Professionals** 05/28/2024.

Feel like you're out there, but there is no designated place of congregation?

Right now, there are young professional groups and black professional groups but nothing for our unique demographic. If you feel like you fit the description of young, black and striving to achieve success then this is the Meetup for you. I look forward to us working towards our goals together.
This group belongs to every member so I encourage everyone to suggest events (but please read the guidelines listed in the discussion board first: [http://www.meetup.com/BostonYBP/messages/bo...](http://www.meetup.com/BostonYBP/messages/boards/thread/30664622))
If you want to post an event that you are not willing to host, please post it into our Facebook group ([https://www.facebook.com/groups/946326295396364/](https://www.facebook.com/groups/946326295396364/)) , who knows, maybe someone else will host it.

description:
This women-only, 50+ group will be a mixture of social gatherings, dining out, biking, hiking, kayaking along with crafting, book clubs, games, short trips and whatever else the group organically develops into over time. Note - We will occasional make an exception to all women when an event is opened up to guests or when necessary.

FOR SECURITY, ALL PROFILE PICTURES SHOULD BE A CLOSEUP OF YOUR FACE WITHOUT SUNGLASSES OR HATS, ETC. THE PICTURE SHOULD ONLY BE OF YOU. IF YOU SUBMIT A REQUEST WITH ANY OF THE ABOVE, YOUR REQUEST WILL BE DECLINED. THANK YOU.

It's ok if you are under 50 because we welcome all women but please understand that the activities are less strenuous than you might want. Also, please note that we require your profile picture to be an up-to-date photo of your face without sunglasses or a hat.

If you have experience running events, we welcome organizers. Please send me a request.

As a member of this group you agree for this group to be a bully-free zone and to be accepting of people's differences and beliefs.

Also, we request that you be respectful of everyone's time and show up to event on time and if you need to cancel an event that you do so at least 24 hours in advance. Two no shows without cancelling will remove you from the group.

Finally, we ask that if you are not feeling well, have a cold or have been exposed to someone with Covid or other infectious illness to not attend an event. There's a lot of respiratory sickness out this season.

\*\*Liability Release - AS A CONDITION OF ATTENDING THIS MEETUP, YOU AGREE TO hold harmless, and indemnify the organizer and her heirs, and all members and participants of this Meetup group from any and all claims for injury, illness, death, and/or property damage including those caused by negligence, ignorance, inexperience and other reasons. You also agree to assume all mental, physical, financial, and/or other risk associated with this meetup. All meetup activities pose inherent risks and dangers. Participation in these activities is voluntary and dependent upon your own personal judgment.
