name: Stress Free High Achievers Boston
description:
We are committed to creating a supportive environment and community of high-achieving professionals and entrepreneurs who are committed to optimizing our personal and professional lives.

We are committed to achieving higher levels of success while maintaining our health, well-being, and happy relationships. We are high performers, optimizing our habits so that we can achieve a healthy balance in our lives.

We want to help you achieve the freedom to focus on what’s important to you without sacrificing what matters most.

With our commitment to creating safe, supportive, and inclusive environments, we do live, online interactive events so that you will have a customized experience for your goals.
What you will gain from this group:

1. Habits to reach long term success while maintaining your wellbeing and relationships.
2. Energy to feel fully engaged, joyous, and confident in all areas of your life.
3. Clarity on what priorities to focus on daily, weekly, and monthly.
4. The mental, emotional, and physical vibrancy to be on your “A” game in every area of your life.
5. Courage to take more bold action to move the needle forward in your dreams and goals.
6. Beat procrastination and improve your level of focus and productivity each day.

You will learn what habits, practices, and principles will keep you performing your best so that you can have the time, energy, and clarity needed to lead a fulfilling personal and professional life. You can achieve success, without sacrificing what’s important to you!

Please join our group so that you can have professional success along with personal fulfillment.

Welcome to the community! See you soon!

Eva Medilek, Organizer

name: Blacks United In Leading Technology - Boston Chapter
description:
Blacks United in Leading Technology International, BUiLT is a global professional association for Black professionals in technology and our allies. We are "Building Tech Equity" by providing value to our community in the form of networking, education, and mentorship opportunities. We provide resources, guidance and challenge members to establish new standards of innovation through collaboration.

BUiLT Boston, the official local chapter of BUiLT National, is a professional platform for People of Color in technology in the Greater Boston area. BUiLT serves to increase the visibility and participation of PoC in tech through community, media, mentorship, and stewardship.

Our events are held in-person and virtually, with a winning mix of top tech presentations, entrepreneurial series, networking events, social justice messaging, collaborations with other aligned groups, career advancement seminars, and Member’s Only, Reserved and Private Events.

We educate people and seek to increase the representation of Black women and men in technology. It’s proven, enterprises that embrace diversity yield the most innovative solutions. We’re talking to the entire tech community including founders, software developers, scientists, digital media specialists, system engineers, webmasters, technicians, QA folks, social media strategists, cyber-security analysts, online marketing experts, UI/UX artists, recruiters, bloggers, operations staff, project managers – and many, many more technology professionals, students and educators.

This group is perfect for individuals interested in IT certifications, industry best practices, study groups, and anything IT related. Although we are a group for Black IT Professionals, we do not discriminate against anyone, instead we want to uplift and encourage all races and ethnicities. Non-technologist supporters are welcome to join our community too!

Join us. Exchange knowledge. Provide your viewpoints. Let’s explore together the many ways technology is changing the world. Let’s stomp the divide, and help ensure technology is inclusive for all.

name: Network After Work - Boston Networking Events
description:
Network After Work is a professional community consisting of Entrepreneurs, Professionals, Executives and thought leaders who understand the importance of building meaningful connections. Built on the idea that professionals in every industry across the world all share a common goal, to develop strong relationships that help grow their businesses and careers. Through meeting in-person and virtually, Network After Work provides a platform that makes connecting easy. Hosting live events in 87 US locations with plans to add additional US cities and international locations, growing your business and relationships has never been easier.

For 10 years, we have been at the forefront of face-to-face business connections. As social media and virtual relationships have been all the rage over the past decade, we have found that live interactions are still the best way to build solid connections. Shaking hands and looking someone in the eye is an invaluable skill and builds the strongest foundation for long lasting connection.

Though meeting in-person is our foundation, meeting virtually is a great accompaniment to our signature live events. With our goal to make your business connections long lasting and sustainable, our mission is to do everything for you, all you need is the desire to seize new opportunities and the willingness to help others.


Visit us on the web at (https://www.networkafterwork.com/find/MA-Boston) for additional information.



We hope to see you at future event!

name: Wander and wonder society: Boston Museum Club
description:
Description:

Welcome to the Wander and Wonder Society, Boston’s most eclectic crew of history buffs, science geeks, culture enthusiasts, and art aficionados! We’re here to explore the wonders of Boston’s museums with a side of humor, curiosity, and a whole lot of fun.

Whether you’re decoding ancient artifacts, marveling at cutting-edge science, soaking up culture, or critiquing avant-garde art, you’ll find your place with us. Our motto? “No plaque left unread, no fossil unexamined, no masterpiece unappreciated!”

Each meetup, we’ll dive into a different museum or gallery, snapping a group selfie with the most bizarre exhibit we encounter, and debrief over coffee and snacks. Expect plenty of laughs, spontaneous debates, and more “Aha!” moments than you can count.

**Disclaimer:** We’re not responsible for any newfound obsessions with history, science experiments, cultural explorations, or avant-garde installations. Join the us—because museums are way more fun when you mix history, science, culture, and art with a good dose of humor.

BostonSWUG is operated completely by volunteers with the aim of promoting the sharing of skills and information related to the use of SOLIDWORKS and to create a forum for networking within the design and engineering community.

The group is free and open to anyone with an interest in expanding their knowledge of SOLIDWORKS and related technologies utilized in design & engineering fields.

name: Boston Mindfulness Parties Calm all the Way Up
description:
Hey! This group is for millennials looking to cultivate inner peace in a fun, high-energy way. We have no boring events like the snoozefest meditations with guides who won’t shut up about your elbow's position.

Every thoughtful, restorative, mindful good time involves something high-energy you’d actually want to do [such as pirate yoga nights, 80s nights, disco nights, country western nights, Hawaiian hot tub meditations, board games, cooking parties, ski trips, dinner parties, friendly competitions, exploring new places, ranking the best hot tubs in the city, and more!]

Show up with no yoga/meditation experience needed - our events are designed for all levels. Join us for memorable and enjoyable yoga and mindfulness experiences! Events are hosted at my place in Somerville, local fitness studios/gyms, and unique venues like distilleries or zoos.

I started this group because I was looking for an easy, fun way to chill out more without it feeling like work, and I felt overwhelmed by the meditative wellness groups where things felt overly serious or religious. As a new professional yoga/meditation instructor, I've loved meeting people and helping them find inner peace through silly and relaxed methods. My goal is to create a community where you'd want to hang out even outside of Meetups.

Come hang out with me and some like-minded new friends, and let’s find ways to get our peace on, together.

\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-
This Meetup group is brought to you by Peace Out Ski + Wellness Club, a high-energy mindfulness and skiing club for millennials aiming to unwind and feel alive. I host unique yoga nights & meditation parties year-round in the Boston area, with cool themes like Pirates and Hawaiian Luaus, plus winter ski & meditation retreats all over New England. Have fun finding mindfulness in chill cozy settings that feel like hanging out at your best friend's apartment. Meet new people and calm the f\*ck up with us!

\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-
**Still reading? Here’s a fun mindfulness prompt for you:**

“The person who says it can't be done is generally interrupted by someone doing it.” What puts you in creative flow, where time blurs?

\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-

**FB group: Looking for ways to stay connected w/fun people in their 30s and 40s who value mindfulness and being active?**

I just made a brand new private Peace Out 30s and 40s mindfulness Facebook group - where you can connect with like-minded new friends! I'll be posting motivational quotes, fun themed costumes and mindfulness stuff, plus our upcoming yoga/meditation classes there :) Check it out here - [https://www.facebook.com/groups/1045183780505725](http://clicks.meetup.com/ls/click?upn=u001.NY3oBFzZ5LJDG7YcnfSAKu-2FXfTGw-2FvPXD7PPRLlSXtchIrY2eHTenBALLFxscd1-2FMAMGwI-2BGI8xvsNw7UlHQRg-3D-3D5uSm_xdUTvUhIjWlSJgufBblll4-2FcuaVca123SZLk5EUYKf9BYU9plMczE-2BisCz8YQYpOJfQ9riIO9e56TijOxQDg04vfiYN9xUOc7g0etBs7ii-2FyMU9mf4D6uu3MnBu-2FsLkXEmGB75xZFUznmlRSCzU1InogPiejiCkIePSLzKZBzY0TBzeocrMrb9faqUaJ2rhWxk9fNjYSurbC-2FK0vjKcQ0Oox3yKpezEyG-2FyC0T9c5C-2F-2FMU861IHbFinNIJ5ioLwp9VA0R-2Bt81FY5glQ1QXNZFxwYqnvCDlI1JP5-2BT3lMjcU0PmY3JvqU-2Fa5aa8wIFDNVRJZ6Z8QOVkZ1xT3ytAFyVw7TbHMZWWkq3oahT36oJhptFzAudXrURipAe0x7EoPFlfsiCV6UOX3GiZe2CyZkuwkYTNH4HcgAc-2BzQ4azNRcd9y0E7kXgzwbH-2Bf9iPZQFcab-2FsUzVlrROzoyc9-2BA0zBE23KKRqRCUFxlDAl9AtkjwLk4JJGeWWlTMP-2BQMOOgvuGs5sRtpcbaucq9RNKflwNwxOyt7WL-2BATlEW64z2iZP8tg033AeyOV1-2Bw0SQB21oXjskAx-2F9Ee1clOtCCO1gJV6JFdmD6hvGlozTO2nYcYTd1lMEVPU3kRGLZFbe-2BDwanimXlUfEgUgf2w69kciDXynwoXXu4TCNz5DU-2B8yDB0o4SdmTzKxNbh-2FzGnqfj6hfa)

name: Boston Chapter - American Singles Golf Association-ASGA
description:
**What We’re About**

We’re the Boston Chapter of the American Singles Golf Association (ASGA), a national organization made up of many chapters and thousands of people around the country. If you’re single, enjoying a game of golf and socializing with a welcoming group of people is certainly a great place to be. We schedule golf events around Eastern Massachusetts every weekend as well as many social-only get togethers in the off season.
 
ASGA Boston is a non-competitive, 45+, social group, but some prior experience in playing the game and some level of golfing etiquette is expected. We’re trying to keep the pace of play at around 4-1/2 hours.  Ready golf!!  Single golfers from all player levels, experienced beginner to expert, are welcome to join us!

*Meet Up* is a tool we use to announce Chapter events and to let singles know more about us. You’re  welcome to join one of our events as we’re about promoting the game and engaging people who share a common interest.
 
*Please Note*: Non-ASGA Chapter members who sign up for a posted event will have to pay a surcharge of $10 for event participation. To forego this cost, go to our website to join as an official member.
 
**Membership**
The Boston Chapter membership is growing. To join ASGA, please visit our national website at **[www.singlesgolf.com](http://www.singlesgolf.com)** . The current annual dues are $99.00. Sign up for the Boston Chapter to begin to take advantage of all ASGA has to offer. *FUN, FELLOWSHIP, AND FAIRWAYS* await! Not only can you form lifelong friendships, but it could lead to a lifelong relationship!
 
**Travel**
After you become an ASGA member, we’re sure you’ll want to take part in the many benefits that membership provides.  You can sign up for multi-chapter and nationally scheduled events. Regional travel events have visited all the New England states and New York. description:
ODSC brings together the open source and data science communities with the goal of helping its members learn, connect and grow.
The focus of this Meetup group is to allow ODSC to work with Meetup groups, non-profits, and other organizations to present informative lectures, workshops, code sprints and networking events to help grow the use of open source languages and tools within the data science and data-centric community. As such, our specific goals are:

1\. Build a collaborative group to work with other Meetup groups\, non\-profits\, and other organizations\.

2\. Promote the use of open source languages and tools amongst data scientists and others\.

name: Boston Applied Data Engineering Community Meetup
description:
**Data engineering is taking the world of data science by storm.** More and more organizations are looking to keep the entire data pipeline in-house, starting with ETL and ending with a usable, final product - [https://odsc.com/](https://odsc.com/)

At ODSC, we aim to bring together the open source and data science communities with the goal of helping our members learn, connect, and grow. With this group, we aim to solely focus on everything data engineering, as opposed to the greater data science and AI industry.

These meetups are designed to bring together the people that work on various parts of the data engineering workflow, ranging from those who work on extracting and cleaning data, to those at the end whose goal it is to sell a product, and everything in between. We will work with meetup groups, non-profits, and other organizations to present informative lectures, workshops, code sprints, and networking events to help grow the use of data engineering workflows, tools, processes, and products.

**As such, our specific goals are:**

1\. Build a collaborative group to work with other Meetup groups\, non\-profits\, and other organizations\.
2\. Promote the use of open\-source languages and tools amongst data engineers and their teams\.
3\. Host educational workshops\.
4\. Spread awareness of new open source languages and tools that can be used in data science\.
5\. Contribute back to the open source community\.

**Who is this meetup for?**

• Data engineers, machine learning engineers, and even decision makers looking to implement data engineering tools.
• R, Python and other software engineers who work with data or want to learn
• Data visualization developers and designers
• Non-technical team leads, executives, and other decision makers from data centric startups and large companies looking to utilize open source tools

description:
This group is to meetup for Sauna and steam baths in Boston area for health benefits and socializing. We explore different sauna and steam rooms in Boston and get an opportunity to meet new people with similar interest in wellness and health.

Sauna and steam bath has great benefits to the body. Sweating by heat of a sauna dilates blood vessels, increasing blood circulation and reduces muscle tension. Sweating in a sauna removes toxins, dead skin, and other byproducts from your body. Saunas may reduce the risk of high blood pressure, stroke, and other cardiovascular diseases. Saunas hemp you relive body pain and can help you relax physically and mentally, which can help you fall and stay asleep. This can help reduce stress and improve quality of life.

The group originally ran with two branches: Cambridge and Brookline, and our goal is to provide similar groupings in and around the Boston area. Organization has changed hands over the past two years, but the result has always been a source of good conversation, new acquaintances, and exposure to books and genres that provide both comfort and exploration.

So, if you're into reading, talking, and often eating (yay, eating!), you are even remotely close to the Boston area, and are the ages of 20-30ish, this is the group for you.

description:
This is a group for artists in the Boston metro area to hang out while working on art, and to share resources and inspiration. We are geared toward digital art (game art, illustration, concept art, industrial design, animation, 3D graphics, etc.), but place importance on practicing foundation skills (perspective, anatomy, composition, line quality, color theory, etc.).


IF YOU DO NOT RESPOND TO THE QUESTIONS WHEN SENDING A REQUEST TO JOIN THE GROUP, YOUR REQUEST WILL NOT BE ACCEPTED. Responses that are one word or half-sentences will be ignored. You don't have to be good at or experienced in art in order to join this group, but you do have to be serious about wanting to practice and improve.


Join our Discord server:

https://discord.gg/VpuJJbe

During the COVID-19 pandemic, all meetups are online-only via Discord.


We also have a facebook group at https://www.facebook.com/groups/BostonDrawingAndDigitalArt


We are open to working professionals as well less experienced artists looking to learn. What we have in common regardless of experience is - we are all dedicated to improvement, receptive to critiques, willing to give insightful and valuable feedback, and disciplined about practice. And of course respectful toward each other and each other's art. We want meetups to be fun and social but also involve sharing our knowledge to help us become better artists. This group started August 2014.

name: Boston Young Writers Critique Group
description:
This group is intended for creative writers of **prose fiction** 18-35 who are dedicated to improving their craft and supporting their fellow writers. This is a workshop group that meets every 2-3 weeks to critique 2-3 submissions from fellow group members. The fee is $2/meeting, strictly to offset the cost of hosting the group on Meetup.com.

All genres of prose fiction are welcome! Short stories? Awesome! Novel excerpts? Excellent! Meetings are online on Discord.

If you would like to join, please fill out the questions on the membership request. **Note that we do not critique poetry or nonfiction pieces.** This is an inclusive and LGBTQ+ friendly group and we welcome people from all backgrounds and skill levels!

Please read through our group rules:
1\. Submissions should be double\-spaced and \~25 pages\. Please include page numbers and preface your piece explaining what it is \(a completed story? an excerpt?\) and what you would like us to focus on in our critique\.

2\. Our critique format is the following: First everyone but the author will discuss the piece for about \~15 minutes\. The author should remain quiet unless we ask them a question or something important needs to be clarified\. Afterwards everyone will be free to address the author\, give direct feedback\, ask the author questions\, etc\. for another \~15 minutes\.

3\. Please attend at least one meeting before submitting a piece\. It's good for new folks to get a sense of what the group is about and to contribute to the community\.

4\. We really value the community we've built with this group\, and we put a lot of time and effort into helping each other grow as writers\. To that end\, please don't **only** show up to meetings when your piece is being critiqued. Be willing to put as much time and effort into other people's work as we put into yours!

5\. To allow more people to get a chance to have their work critiqued\, please do not sign up for critique more than two meetings in a row\. \(The exception to this is if we're really in a squeeze for submitters\-\-if you're not sure\, ask\!\)

6\. Please do not call dibs on submitting before the next meeting is announced\. If you sign up but then have to back out unexpectedly\, please let the group know as soon as possible\.

7\. Sorry\, no one under 18\!

8\. Please RSVP and shoot a message through the site or Discord if you're running late\. 

9\. We don't have any set limits on sensitive content/gore/language\, but use good judgment and be cognizant that your fellow writers come from all backgrounds\. I reserve the right to decline a writer's submission if necessary \(for example\, if a submission is just blatant hate speech\)\, but so far it's never happened\.

10\. Not sure why you'd want a critique on something you didn't write\, but for the record: no AI\-generated content\.

11\. Stay cool and keep writing\! 😎

name: Desi (Indian) Single Parents of Boston
description:
**Summary:** This is a group for Desi single parents from around the Greater Boston area to help each other move on in a positive direction in life. As individuals and as parents lets use this group as a forum to meet and connect with new people who are in similar circumstances, help one another and share our moments of joy. 
**Formal Team Charter (Mission):**
· **Team Purpose:** Be a fun social support group for single parents from Indian background and their dependents. We are not a dating site.
· **Team Member**:

> · All members are empowered to create and manage events.

> · RSVPs to events is expected.

> · Members are expected to be respectful and considerate towards other members and dependents. (Refer to group buddy below).

> · Members are expected to be inclusive.

> · All interactions should be neutral to religious, political or cultural views.

> · Members are expected to attend minimum one DSP events in a year.

> · DSP events generally cover a wide range of activities, every member is responsible for themselves and their dependents. For more details, please refer to the DSP generic waiver.

> · By RSVP-ing or attending any DSP event, the member and their dependents agree to the DSP generic waiver. Formal signed documents might/might not be collected.

> · When a new member is added we typically try not to add the second parent. If accidentally both parents are part of the group one will be removed based on who is most active at the current time.

· **Events:**

> · DSP Events are defined by events put on the Meetup site. Events not on the Meetup, are non-DSP events. These are social events between friends.

· **Team Volunteer Opportunities:**

> · Event creators always welcome – We love our fun-loving adventurous folks.

> · Group buddy - A volunteer to help a new member navigate the group. We are all here to help, but the one person would be the new member’s go to person in case they need help**\***.

**\* Please be aware that many members might be navigating multiple life challenges. Apart from being friendly, helpful and inclusive, we can’t offer legal advice. Instead direct them to the correct resources.**

Data Science is a broad, fast-moving field; peer-to-peer learning is critical to a successful data science career! Unlike other data science Meetup groups that focus on presenting data science content, this group focuses on optimizing your professional development. Members of this Meetup group will get and give personalized career advice, learn content and receive content recommendations from peers, and intelligently grow their professional network. The most successful practitioners have many mentors and even more mentees. Join us - your career depends on it!

When you join our group - please take the data scientist survey to fully participate!

name: Boston Business Networking Meetup Group
description:
Networking events can be an invaluable resource for professionals and entrepreneurs looking to grow their businesses. These events offer opportunities to meet like-minded individuals, exchange ideas, and establish new connections. In this blog post, we will explore how attending professional and entrepreneurial group networking events can help grow your business.

Expand Your Network
One of the most significant benefits of attending networking events is the opportunity to expand your network. These events attract individuals from a wide range of industries and backgrounds, offering a valuable opportunity to make new connections. By meeting new people, you can open doors to potential partnerships, collaborations, and new business opportunities.

Build Your Reputation
Networking events can also help you build your reputation within your industry. By attending these events, you can showcase your expertise and knowledge, establish yourself as an authority in your field, and increase your visibility. This can help attract new clients and business opportunities, and ultimately, help grow your business.

Learn From Others
Networking events are also an excellent opportunity to learn from others. These events often feature keynote speakers, panel discussions, and other educational opportunities that can provide valuable insights and knowledge. By attending these events, you can stay up-to-date on industry trends and best practices, which can help you make informed decisions for your business.

Find Potential Partnerships
Networking events can also be a great way to find potential partnerships. By meeting other professionals and entrepreneurs, you may find individuals or businesses that complement your own, offering new partnership opportunities. Whether it's a joint venture, collaboration, or referral partnership, these relationships can help grow your business and expand your reach.

Gain Confidence
Attending networking events can also help build your confidence as a business owner or professional. By putting yourself out there, meeting new people, and engaging in meaningful conversations, you can build your self-assurance and improve your communication skills. This can ultimately help you grow your business by allowing you to communicate more effectively with clients, partners, and other stakeholders.

In conclusion, attending professional and entrepreneurial group networking events can be an effective way to grow your business. By expanding your network, building your reputation, learning from others, finding potential partnerships, and gaining confidence, you can open doors to new business opportunities and ultimately, take your business to the next level. So, the next time you hear about a networking event in your industry, be sure to attend – you never know where it may lead!

name: Boston Data Lineage Meetup Group
description:
Data engineers and pipeline managers know that producing data lineage – end-to-end pipeline metadata instrumented at runtime or parsed at design time – is a heavy lift without a shared standard for lineage metadata. It requires duplication of effort across pipeline tooling, and deployment of new tools can break existing lineage workflows. Getting useful lineage can seem like a sisyphean task.

Enter OpenLineage, an increasingly adopted open standard for lineage metadata collection. It defines a generic model of run, job, and dataset entities identified using consistent naming strategies. The core lineage model is extensible by defining specific facets to enrich those entities.

name: Desi (Indian) Single Parents of Boston
description:
**Summary:** This is a group for Desi single parents from around the Greater Boston area to help each other move on in a positive direction in life. As individuals and as parents lets use this group as a forum to meet and connect with new people who are in similar circumstances, help one another and share our moments of joy. 
**Formal Team Charter (Mission):**
· **Team Purpose:** Be a fun social support group for single parents from Indian background and their dependents. We are not a dating site.
· **Team Member**:

> · All members are empowered to create and manage events.

> · RSVPs to events is expected.

> · Members are expected to be respectful and considerate towards other members and dependents. (Refer to group buddy below).

> · Members are expected to be inclusive.

> · All interactions should be neutral to religious, political or cultural views.

> · Members are expected to attend minimum one DSP events in a year.

> · DSP events generally cover a wide range of activities, every member is responsible for themselves and their dependents. For more details, please refer to the DSP generic waiver.

> · By RSVP-ing or attending any DSP event, the member and their dependents agree to the DSP generic waiver. Formal signed documents might/might not be collected.

> · When a new member is added we typically try not to add the second parent. If accidentally both parents are part of the group one will be removed based on who is most active at the current time.

· **Events:**

> · DSP Events are defined by events put on the Meetup site. Events not on the Meetup, are non-DSP events. These are social events between friends.

· **Team Volunteer Opportunities:**

> · Event creators always welcome – We love our fun-loving adventurous folks.

> · Group buddy - A volunteer to help a new member navigate the group. We are all here to help, but the one person would be the new member’s go to person in case they need help**\***.

**\* Please be aware that many members might be navigating multiple life challenges. Apart from being friendly, helpful and inclusive, we can’t offer legal advice. Instead direct them to the correct resources.**

We serve the international healthcare cloud community from our Boston location by providing industry experts a community to share on healthcare technology topics. Meetings are on the **last Wednesday** of every month.

MISSION
Building a global community with a shared interest in implementing technology to improve the patient, provider, member, and researcher experience in healthcare unites the diverse membership of BOSHUG.

Topics include, but not limited to: #healthcare #HIT #AI #medtech #IndustryCloud #PatientExperience #PatientCare #healthtech #healthit #WomenInHIT #EHR #EMR #FHIR #medtech #PatientExperience #healthcloud #HLS #FHIR #hybridcare #healthequity #acutecare

Get notified of new events:
http://www.boshug.com

Interested in speaking at or sponsoring an upcoming meeting?
https://sessionize.com/boston-healthcare-technology-community-cfs/

Are you interested in launching a local chapter of the Healthcare Cloud Technology Community? Email boshug@outlook.com

Join the Discord:
https://discord.gg/healthcare

Please email hi@realactivity.com or pswider@realctivity.com with media or sponsorship questions.

description:
Whether you have enough friends or would like to have more, The Authentic Friendships group is the perfect place for you to learn more about how to open up to more friendships or deepen the bonds you already have. We are so excited to provide this space for all of us to connect and grow our Friendships...Authentically!

We have multiple virtual events for this group including a monthly Tea Tuesday on the second Tuesday of each month at 8am PT and Happy Hour on the fourth Thursday of each month at 4pm PT.

On occasion we also have FREE webinars and informational calls about building Authentic Friendships, as well as many workshop opportunities to go deeper with your Friendships and connect with others as you grow!

name: Boston - Community of Real Estate Investors
description:
We are a group of beginner, intermediate, and full-time real estate investors that meet several times a week to network and do deals.
We leverage each other's capital, time, resources, and experience to get more deals done.
We have people in our group that do over 1,000 deals a year all the way down to people that have never invested in real estate before.
We have people that invest in fix and flips, rental properties, short sales, foreclosures, private notes, wholesaling, multi-family, commercial, tax liens/deeds, subject-to, lease options, and more.
We are looking for like-minded people that are hungry and have great attitudes to add to our team.
Come meet our team of investors and learn how we are doing deals.
You will have an opportunity to meet local investors who are doing local deals.
You will also have an opportunity to join our weekly masterminds where team members are doing actual deals.
Surrounding yourself with people that are doing deals is a great way to get started.
We also have full-time people that are taking their business to the next level in our group.
If you want to learn how to invest in real estate or take your business to the next level this is the place to be!
For VIP, please RSVP here: https://communityofrealestateinvestors.com
DISCLAIMER
The Community of Real Estate Investors does not guarantee any level of money, success, or lifestyle from being a member of our meetup. All testimonials and presentations are unique to that specific member that shared their results. Your results will be different and will vary depending on several factors, including your starting point, effort, and resources.

name: Boston Queer Electronic/Experimental Producers
description:
Looking to find other queer electronic/experimental/ambient music lovers, enthusiasts, and experimentalists in the Boston area and beyond!! This includes anyone from total beginners looking to experiment to classically trained musicians: synthesizer geeks (software or hardware!), hardware experimentalists, gear fetishists, IDM enthusiasts, noise and drone heads, techno/EDM lovers, and everything in between! Would love to talk to other similarly-minded queer folk about software, gear, effect pedals, plug-ins, favorite artists, production techniques, and so on. We could even plan cool shows to go to and even collaborate on music together. I am personally not a classically trained musician and just mess with audio samples on Ableton to make weird ambient/experimental stuff, but I'm always looking to branch out.

If you have ANY interest in the following music, please reach out: Actress, Akira Rabelais, Arca, Burial, The Caretaker, Chino Amobi, Anthony Naples, Holly Herndon, Patrick Cowley, Tim Hecker, Jon Hopkins, Bernard Parmegiani, SOPHIE (RIP), Ulla, Vessel, Yves Tumor, Autechre, Octo Octa, Mika Vainio, Foodman, Dedekind Cut, Coil, Aphex Twin, Blawan, Bjork, Traumprinz, Brian Eno, Oneohtrix Point Never, Huerco S, The Knife, Klein, HTRK, Andy Stott, Peverelist, Jake Muir, Merzbow, Lussuria, Vladislav Delay, Perila, Felicia Atkinson, Pontiac Streator, Ryuichi Sakamoto, Alva Noto, Biosphere, Hieroglyphic Being, Shygirl, Sunn 0))), Mica Levi, The Field, Eliane Radigue, Kevin Drumm, Stars of the Lid, William Basinski, Lyra Pramuk, Jlin, Baauer, Deathprod, Colin Stetson, C Spencer Yeh, Hiroshi Yoshimura, Coil, Factory Floor, Elysia Crampton, LA Timpa, Karenn, Kali Malone......

...just to name a few, and the list could go on and on and ON !!!!

Looking to meet in person over casual drinks at first, and then go from there!

description:

From workshops to casual get togethers, and from office hours to happy hours, NGINX Community Groups host events across the U.S. and globally, in person and virtually for all expertise levels. If you’re interested in giving a talk to the group, please email h.neil at f5 dot com. We’d love to hear talks on NGINX and related technologies, about microservices, APIs, and more.

Learn more about NGINX at [https://www.nginx.com](https://www.nginx.com/) or get started at [nginx.org](http://nginx.org/)

name: The Boston Area Libertarian Meetup Group
description:
Welcome to the Boston Area Libertarian Meetup Group! This group is meant as a vehicle for libertarians in the greater Boston area to meet and socialize. Join us and share your opinions on today's political climate and issues. If you're a Bostonian who is unsure who libertarians are, this is the place to come to find out. Everyone interested in libertarianism is welcome!

Also, if you want to contribute politically, this Meetup group works with the Boston area chapter of the LPMA. Details will be available at the meetings for the activist bent. In the meantime, you can visit us online at http://www.lpmass.org.

The Boston Area Libertarian Meetup Group is funded by the Libertarian Association of Massachusetts, and does not endorse any candidate for the United States Presidential nomination.

name: Boston Young Creatives (20s & 30s)
description:
**Join our discord:** (more info below)
[https://discord.gg/kdkJsTtnRd](https://discord.gg/kdkJsTtnRd)
**A short message from the founder, Corey:**
Hey all,
I started this group over 10 years ago now. It meant a lot to me. But I'm no longer in Boston & though I haven't had the funds, I've been supporting it anyway. I'd like to keep the group alive and start events again, but I'd need your help, I need people to help do that. If you're interested in keeping this group alive, or just want to chat with other members, join the discord where we can have open conversations about the future of the group, and I'd love to see you there. 
If you don't have Discord, you can email me at *byc@zev.ninja* with your thoughts. But Discord is definitely the best place to find me.
Thank you so much for still supporting this group.
Corey

**Original group description:** 
Whether or not you just graduated school or are new to Boston, we all
know how difficult it can be your first few years as a professional. Let's
use this group to bridge that knowledge gap, the experience gap, and
the networking gap.
I'm talking ALLLLLLLL kinds of creatives: writers, artists, bloggers,
designers, developers, programmers, entrepreneurs, builders, doers,
movers, shakers.
Use this group to create meetups where we: network, create new
companies, develop old companies & products, have fun, drink beer,
share knowledge, introduce new cool things, and just plain ol' make
new friends!
The more experienced folk are here to support the younger folk, so
everyone chat and get to know each other. Let's try to meet up every
other week or so for different reasons, and make the most of being young
in this great city.
 
[![](http://photos4.meetupstatic.com/photos/event/4/d/6/e/event_139219822.jpeg)](https://www.facebook.com/BostonYoungCreatives)
 
\-\-\-\-\-\-\-
*We are also looking for corporate sponsors of any kind. Creative companies in the Boston area. Marketing, manufacturing, production, etc.*
*Contact Corey for more information.*

name: 20s & 30s Boston Introverted Explorers
description:
If the name of this group appealed to you then I doubt you need paragraph after paragraph describing what an introvert is. You know what the general perception of you is and that it tends to be far from the truth. Exhibit A: the first Google search result for "definition of introvert": noun: 1. a shy, reticent, and typically self-centered person. Really, Google?! You were doing OK until you described us as "self-centered"...

If you're on this site it's because you're looking to meet new people, and for introverts that can be a scary endeavor. I'll admit up front that I joined this site more than two years ago and I haven't attended an event yet. If this sounds like you let's change that together. My hope is that by clearly defining our age range and the types of activities we will be partaking in we will attract like-minded individuals who have common interests and passions, which will lead to meaningful connections. I also plan on mixing things up in an effort to not let the group get monotonous. Boston is a fun city which merits exploration in lieu of hanging out at the same coffee shop, bar, or bowling alley. A sampling of potential events:

• Restaurant meetups, with an emphasis on culinary offerings (I am a foodie) in a comfortable setting. Perhaps do them in a variety of series? (international, adventurous, seasonal, restaurant week, brunch, tapas, dessert)

• Bar/coffee shop meetups in small groups (4-6 people) in a laid back environment that is conducive to conversation

• Wine tastings, brewery/distillery tours

• Movie meetups - more cerebral movies instead of blockbusters (indie/foreign/art house), with the occasional must-see 3D movie (Boston Common, Coolidge Corner, Kendall Square, Harvard Film Archive, Brattle Theatre, Somerville Theater)

• Concerts - more intimate venues/jazz clubs (MFA, The Sinclair, Paradise Rock Club, Brighton Music Hall, The Middle East, Cafe 939, Orpheum Theatre, Club Passim, Regattabar, Symphony Hall, Berklee Performance Center) instead of large, loud, crowded venues

• Lectures (Harvard, MFA)

• Comedy shows (Wilbur Theatre, Laugh Boston)

• Sporty activities (snow tubing, ice skating, bowling, hiking)

• Sporting events (Red Sox, Celtics)

• Museum/aquarium outings

• you get the idea...

Please Note: this group is meant for those between the ages of 20-39. Membership will be limited to those that fall within this age range. For those who fall outside that range I appreciate your interest but hope you will join and participate in other groups that are targeted at your demographics and interests. If you feel none exist I would suggest you create one.

Code of Conduct: I ask that you please be respectful to me, our other members, and the businesses/vendors we interact with (e.g. servers, business owners, etc.). Rudeness or behavior that makes other members uncomfortable will not be tolerated and you will be removed from the group. If you encounter such behavior please let me know as my goal is to preserve a comfortable and friendly environment.

New Members: if you submit an incomplete profile or have a profile picture that isn't of you (nature, animal, etc) then your membership request will be declined

name: Jewish Singles 55+  of Greater Boston
description:
Come Join Us for Fun & Friendship!


The Greater Boston Jewish Singles Meetup is a social group of outgoing, friendly, singles, (55+) who meet for coffee, conversation and friendship….oh yes, and laughter!

We promise that you’ll find a very warm welcome when you join us at one of our monthly (or more) events.

Be sure to check the website to see what we have planned and PLEASE, rsvp so we'll be sure to have a seat for you! 

Some of us are divorced, others widowed and some single...and we all have the same desire to expand our social life...meet new people, make new friends, and be busy with all that life has to offer us here in Greater Boston. That's why we've grown so much in just a few years and made incredible friendships!

Whether religious, observant, or not observant at all, we also share a common heritage that brings us close. Being 55+ means we have lots of shared experiences and special memories too.

Keep in mind that we are not a ‘dating site’, but if you do meet someone special (and several of our members have) we’ll celebrate right along with you!

We are a dues paying group - $12.00 annually every January, or prorated to $6 if you join after June. Once your membership is approved , we ask that you come to an event within the next 30 days to meet us and determine if you wish to become a dues paying member. If we do not see or hear from you in 30 days we'll assume you've decided otherwise.

We hope to see you very soon!

description:

We are an inclusive community of astrologers, open to people of all levels, from beginners to professionals. We are supported by the Boston Chapter of the National Council for Geocosmic Research (NCGR), an international astrological organization.

Our purpose is to host educational events, through which we build community. A range of offerings will be listed in Meetup:

-Forum discussions: typically hosted in July and/or August, and are free to all to attend.

-Speaker Series lectures: offered September through May or June (currently online at least through January 2022). These are free to NCGR Boston Chapter members. All others pay $20 per webinar and must register to attend at: https://www.ncgrbostonastrology.org/speaker-series

-The New England Astrology Conference (NEAC), to be held February 12-13, 2022. The Meetup group will be notified when registration opens. There is discounted pricing for NCGR Boston Chapter members.

To learn more about the NCGR Boston Chapter, and find information on becoming a member, visit: https://www.ncgrbostonastrology.org

Please message me with any questions. We look forward to seeing you soon!

Leyza Toste, Group Organizer

name: Boston Brand Marketers + Agency Professionals
description:
Calling all brand managers, agency professionals, marketing managers, and hard-charging entrepreneurs!

The Boston Brand Marketers + Agency Professionals meetup helps connect like-minded individuals and provides engaging events to help you get more marketing results fast. TARGET MEMBERS: Maybe you're a big brand that needs a faster way to hit your ambitious growth KPIs. Maybe you're a startup that needs a scrappy and high-impact marketing approach. Perhaps you've achieved some mass awareness but not sales... or vice versa?

With hundreds of live and virtual events already under our belt, we know what you need — simple, surprising, and significant insights and tips from seasoned professionals and entrepreneurs that are useful, relevant, and actionable.

This meetup group is led by Ben Kaplan — the founder + CEO of PR Hacker, the world's fastest growing viral marketing firm. In under 4 years, PR Hacker has revolutionized the PR industry with its data-driven, viral-optimized, and growth-focused approach for brands like Budweiser, Mercedes-Benz, Citi, Smuckers, and Milk-Bone. Kaplan is the bestselling author of 12 books and investor pitch trainer to startups from more than 50 countries. Please take a moment to join the Boston Brand Marketers + Agency Professionals Facebook community: http://bit.ly/PRH-FB

Connect with us on Twitter: http://bit.ly/PRH-Twitter

Want to Volunteer?

We are always looking for event volunteers to assist with event staffing, photography, filming, promoting and marketing of our events. Volunteers can attend our events for free and can often bring guests. Please introduce yourself to us at the next event or send us a note at globalevents@prhacker.com with how you want to help out and why you are a good fit. Some event staffing services we may need depending on the event include: Greeters, Photographers, Videographers, Brand Ambassadors, Brand Advocates, Social Media Influencers, Bloggers, Marketing Managers, Promotional Models, Catering Servers, VIP Party Hosts, Field Managers, Product Specialists and Trade Show Staffing. Contact us at globalevents@prhacker.com to learn more and to determine if there is a good fit.

name: Boston Connected & Intelligent Device Meetup
description:
Hardware is dead. Long live hardware!

There is no question that hardware has been white-hot these past few years. Exits such as Nest and Oculus Rift are just some of the more recent data points in why hardware is hot.

There is plenty that we know about hardware. We know for instance that hardware is hard. We know that mass manufacturing is fraught with difficulty. We know that the proliferation of Adruinos and Raspberry Pis have lowered the barrier to hardware entry.

We also know that not all hardware is the same. Certainly something like the Nest Thermostat is intrinsically different from something like the hoverboard, even though both are fundamentally made up of the same components, such as a processing unit, PCB board & assembly, sensors, casing, etc.

What is it about the Nest Thermostat, or even the Autonomous Car that sets it apart from the "onesy" pieces of hardware such as the hoverboards or "dumb" cars?

The answer, IMHO, is the Connectivity and Intelligence that is built into one set of devices versus the other. A Connected and Intelligent device is more than just a piece of hardware -- it has the capacity to learn from its peer-device, change its behavior over time, and become integrated into- rather than just be added onto- a consumer's life. 

Connected & Intelligent devices have requirements that extend those which we traditionally think of as being "merely" hardware. On top of everything from the traditional component selection, prototyping, manufacturing, etc., each of these devices now also has to contend with issues such as privacy, security, networking, authentication, etc.

This difference, again IMHO, is what sets apart the Hardware 2.0 era of Smart Home, Smart City, and Smart AllSortsOfThings from their predecessors. The Boston Connected & Intelligent Device Meetup is intended to be a platform for discussion, design, growth, and promotion of such devices.

Whether you just learned to say "spanakopita", or you are a fluent speaker who would like to polish up your skills, we would love for you to join us. The only requirement is a passion for the Greek language, and a willingness to learn. <br>

We plan on meeting monthly (at least) for coffee and conversation downtown. It will be just like an afternoon at the kafenio back in Greece (almost). If the hours or location don't work for you, we are open to suggestions. <br>

Ta leme!

name: Boston Deep Learning by Lightning AI
description:
We’re excited to bring you the latest happenings in deep learning!

Whether you're a deep learning / AI expert or just getting started, our goal is to virtually connect and discuss trending topics in the world of deep learning.

What is Lightning AI (Formerly PyTorch Lightning)?
PyTorch Lightning is a lightweight PyTorch wrapper for high-performance AI research. After releasing Lightning in March of 2019 and making it public in July, it quickly became obvious that a single person couldn’t support the appetite for new features from the hyper-engaged Lightning community. We started this meetup to engage not only with the Lightning community but to extend to others in the space using other deep learning frameworks.

Interested to learn more about Lightning? Visit: [https://www.lightning.ai](https://www.pytorchlightning.ai/)
Interested in learning how you can train hundreds of models in the cloud from your laptop? Sign up for access to Lightning AI Cloud. [https://lightning.ai/sign-up](https://lightning.ai/sign-up)

If you’d like to speak. collaborate at future meetups or become a co-organizer of the group, please reach out to [naiyarah@lightning.ai](mailto:naiyarah@lightning.ai)

name: The Boston Coffee Shop Meetup Group
description:
Do you like coffee? Do you like spending hours in coffee shops? Do you like discussing life with people? This group is for you!

We will meet up at various coffee shops for conversation and good coffee. Please suggest your favorite shop!

We are people who like intelligent conversation, witty banter, coffee, and the coffee shop atmosphere.

This is not some large "mix and mingle" group. We meet in small venues with limited seating, so we place low caps on RSVPs. For this reason, we enforce our RVSP policy. If you RSVP, you are expected to attend. Again, an RSVP of yes does not mean "maybe" or "that looks cool." It means "I will attend." Please observe our policy and only RSVP if you certainly will attend. Also please do not "crash" events if you did not make the list. If you repeatedly no-show or show up uninvited, you will be removed from the group, as inaccurate RSVP counts create hassles for our hosts and organizers.

Why do we ask for a profile photo? Because we like to know who you are to help keep that "lost Meetup look" down to a minimum when you first show up. 

And yes, tea drinkers are kindly welcome to join the group.

name: Boston Computational Biology and Bioinformatics Meetup
description: The Boston Computational Biology and Bioinformatics (BCBB) Meetup is a networking group for computational biologists in the Boston/Cambridge area. Thanks to the confluence of top universities, hospitals, research institutes, large pharmaceutical companies, and a vibrant biotech startup community, Boston has arguably the strongest CBB community in the nation. However, for practitioners of computational biology in Boston the landscape can appear siloed and unapproachable, perhaps due in part to the lack of a centralized networking group. The Boston CBB Meetup hopes to fill this void and act as a regular venue for computational biologists in the Boston area to meet, network, share information, and learn.

name: Boston Robotics Interest Group (BosRIG)
description:
We hope to bring together a diverse audience, from the beginner interested in learning to the expert seeking a collaborator to the entrepreneur looking for a technical co-founder. Whether you want to learn something new, demo your new robot, or simply chat with other roboticists, the RIG is the place to be! We aim to be a one-stop shop for all things robotics.
Come to our next meetup and check us out!

name: The Boston Green Business Networking Group
description: The Boston Green Business Networking Group realizes that not only do like minded businesses naturally tend help promote each other but we also have the potential to help the entire industry grow and spread here in the US and abroad. Boston historically has been the hub of innovation, growth and networking. Boston is, and always has been, a leader in the conventions and industry trade show industries that bring like minded people together for the sharing and growth of new ideas, technologies and businesses. Steeped in this tradition we set our goals. Please join us on this journey to the future!

name: The Boston Ex-Midwesterners Meetup Group
description:
This group is dedicated to fun, friendly Midwesterners who now live in New England. Come and meet local ex-Midwesterners and relive great memories about the wholesome charm of middle America. This group is open to anyone who is from/or has lived in Illinois, Indiana, Iowa, Kansas, Michigan, Minnesota, Missouri, Ohio, Nebraska, North Dakota, South Dakota and Wisconsin.

My other home states included Colorado, Alabama and Washington DC. You are welcome as well.

Also expatriates are welcome since I lived outside the U.S. several times. 

Also - I just started a group for Westerners .... please tell your friends and colleagues.
http://www.meetup.com/Westerners/

Bottom line - this group is for friendly people who want to meet other friendly people. It's primary purpose in social, having fun, and meeting other like-minded folks.

If you end up getting a business lead, job, date, whatever, that's fine. Just appreciate this is relaxed and easy going group. 

If you're from Boston but attended university in the Midwest, you are more than welcome!

My motto is:  Conversations first, business cards later!

Look forward to seeing you soon!

Best, Diane Darling

name: Boston Ladies' Fantasy Book Club
description:
Calling all ladies who want to talk to other ladies about ladies in fantasy! Let's face it, men kind of dominate the scifi/fantasy scene - meetups are often male-oriented, and most of the most highly recommended books have male protagonists. I started this group to give us an opportunity to meet up with other women who love fantasy novels and female protagonists. Every month, we'll pick a new book and meet up to chat about it! 

$5 annual dues (after a 90 day trial period) help cover the Meetup fees for running this group - any additional money will turn into tasty treats for meetings :D 

Our bookclub is LGBTQ friendly, and participation is open to anyone who identifies as a woman, including those who were assigned male at birth. Nonbinary and gender-nonconforming individuals are welcome to join as well.

description:
A group for the application of cutting-edge HPC & GPU supercomputing technology to cutting-edge scientific and business problems. With an emphasis on the useful application of supercomputing by practitioners, for practitioners.

If you build/use/support/work in the areas of HPC/AI/Supercomputing/GPUs, *please* reach out to our organizers to share more about your work. We enthusiastically support our members and promote their efforts whenever we're able. We'd love to host your presentation of your work, but we can also lend experience and help you build new connections.

The HPC & GPU Supercomputing Group of Boston is dedicated to diversity, inclusivity, equity, and safety. We do not tolerate harassment of participants in any form. This code of conduct applies to all of our meetup group spaces, both online and off. Anyone who violates this code of conduct will be sanctioned or expelled from these spaces at the discretion of the organizers. Please review and abide by our [Anti-harassment Policy](https://www.meetup.com/HPC-GPU-Supercomputing-Group-of-Boston/pages/19963313/Anti-harassment_Policy/).

Thanks, and see you soon!

name: Boston Area Meditation, Yoga, & Meaningful Adventures!
description:
We're focused on mindful living at home and abroad. Our local events are often group mediation &/or Yoga sessions while our international adventures range from a broad variety of experiences all over the world. Many trips are to less fortunate ("3rd World Countries") to increase our privileged western awareness of how most of this world operates and exists. 

Some trips are focused on compassion & have elements of giving back while others are more general and focus on great photography opportunities, unique off the path experiences, & small groups to increase our awareness of each-other and the "worlds" we visit. 

--------------------

“Travel makes one modest, you see what a tiny place you occupy in the world.”- Gustave Flaubert

“If you wish to travel far and fast, travel light. Take off all your envies, jealousies, unforgiveness, selfishness and fears.”- Cesare Pavese

"This human being is a guest house,
Every morning a new arrival.
A joy, a depression, a meanness,
Some momentary awareness comes
As an unexpected visitor.
Welcome and entertain them all,
Even if they are a crowd of sorrows
Who violently sweep your house
Of all it’s furniture.
Still treat each guest honorably.
She may be cleaning you out for some new delight.
The dark thought, the shame, the malice,
Meet them at the door laughing, And invite them in.
Be grateful for whoever comes,
Because each has been sent
As a guide from beyond." ~ Rumi

name: Wonderful Women Over 60 - Boston and Beyond!
description:
***PLEASE READ THIS IMPORTANT INFORMATION IN FULL:***

We are a warm and welcoming group, so have no fear attending your first event! Events will be held in and outside of Boston proper, on both weekends and weekdays (though most members seem to prefer weekends). Suggestions and Event Hosts are welcome and encouraged!

**All events are attended at your own risk. Note that I am a volunteer, and by attending any event you agree not to hold me, any event host or organizer, any other member, or the Meetup organization liable for any illness or injury sustained at one of my events.**

**RULES AND PROCEDURES:**

* **All members must have an identifiable, recent picture of their face ("head shot").**
* **All members must have ANY word, name, number or symbol** **after your first name** that differentiates you from others with the same first name.
* **For dining events,** **please bring cash in small denominations (one $20 and smaller)** to facilitate easy payment of the bill. We add 27% to the cost of our meal, for tax and tip.
* **Annual dues are $5.00 per person**, to be used to help me pay the Organizer fee ($220/year), plus supplies (like name tags) and related expenses (such as tipping tour guides, adding to wait staff tips, fees for no-shows, etc.). **Payment directly to me via cash, Venmo, Zelle, or PayPal would be appreciated (be sure to mark it "friends and family or I'll pay a fee). If you pay via Meetup, they take 70 cents of each $5.00. See below for payment details.** I'm offering a 90-day free trial period. Unpaid members will automatically be removed by Meetup after 90 days.  You can always rejoin afterward if you change your mind.
* When paying for an event, please use **Venmo, Zelle, or PayPal. You can find me as Carol Portnoy, caroleena 40, caroleena40@gmail.com or 917-837-4504. Be sure to mark the transaction as "friends and family or I'll be charged a fee as a retailer. Please also put in the comments your name as it appears on your profile, and what the payment is for.**
* If you cannot attend an event **for which you purchased a ticket**, please advise me and I will offer the ticket to the waitlist. If someone wants it, they can reach out to you directly. You are also free to offer your purchased ticket to a friend or relative (just let me know!).
* **If you are unable to attend any event you registered for, please change your RSVP at least 24 hours in advance to allow someone from the waitlist to attend, and for me to change any reservations without penalty.**
* If you are a member who habitually registers and cancels within 24-48 hours or doesn't respond to my messages about an event, and there is a waitlist for an event with women who always show up, I reserve the right to move you to the waitlist in exchange for one of those regular attendees.
* Of course, sometimes things happen on the day of an event, but unless you send me a message, you'll be marked as a No-Show. No-Shows are unfair to those on the waitlist, to restaurants, and to me. I do not get notifications from Meetup when an RSVP is changed. **My phone number is 917-837-4504. Please call or text with last-minute questions or cancellations.**
* You will be removed from the group after two no-shows, or two last-minute cancellations (less than 24 hours) when there's a waitlist or reservation. Let's be respectful of each other!

**MEETUP SETTINGS:**
**Make sure you are receiving email notifications of new events, changes to events, cancellations of events, messages in Event Chat, etc.** If you don't have your settings on for these email notifications, you might miss important information unless you go to Meetup and look at our group page (which you should do often if you have an upcoming event).

* Log into meetup.com. I believe you have to be on the website, not the app, to choose these settings. You can access the website on your phone via your browser.
* Click the three horizontal lines or three dots in the upper left or right of the group page, or the down arrow next to your photo. These may be different on Apple vs. Android vs. laptop.
* Select "Settings."
* On the left side of the page, select "Email Updates." You can select any or all of the "Updates from Meetup," which relate to the Meetup organization, not from any groups. You probably want to be notified when someone sends you a message, and of suggested events based on your interests (which you can select further down in the settings list).
* Scroll down to "Updates About Your Groups." I recommend you select at least the following:
* New event announcements
* My RSVP is confirmed
* Changes to event time or location
* New comments & chat messages
* Event reminders
* Event updates from organizers
* Announcement to members about the group

I welcome event feedback and ratings (visit the event page), and any tips on how I can improve our group!

I look forward to some good times with you!

Carol

name: Boston's social strategy (and slightly silly) gamers
description:
Please note that you must have a recognizable picture of yourself that includes your face as one of your Meetup photos in order to have your membership request approved. This is so that our event organizers can recognize you at our events. Thank you!

Welcome! This group is for those in Boston who like to play strategy (and slightly silly) games and be social at the same time. It is perhaps easiest to break this down word by word:

Strategy games: The gaming focus of this group will be on strategy games, games that make you think and plan ahead, such as Ticket to Ride, Great Western Trail, Alchemists, Terraforming Mars, Agricola, Through the Ages, and many more. Of course, we don't expect that you know how to play all these games; we will always welcome newcomers and will sometimes be learning these games ourselves for the first time.

Slightly silly games: Galaxy Trucker, One Night Ultimate Werewolf, and Space Alert are examples of "slightly silly" games. Do note that there's still strategy involved, but we certainly welcome games that make us laugh while we're playing!

Social: To be clear, this group will be as much about the gaming as the social interaction, which is why it's different from other such groups in Boston. But if you see the person next to you as simply someone to beat and nothing more, then this is not the group for you.

From the gaming groups we've been to (and run), there is a clear set of gamers in the Boston area who very much like these types of games, and who like the idea of possibly forming friendships with their fellow players, and that's who we're looking for! If you think you'd like this kind of interaction, sign up and come to one of our events. And if you have questions, don't hesitate to contact one of the organizers. See you soon!

name: The Boston Japanese Anime & Films Social Group
description:
The Boston Japanese Anime & Film Social Group is a public social group dedicated to bringing together members who are interested in all aspects of Japanese culture. As a public social group, all are welcome; however, you must be at least 18 years of age to join as required in the meetup.com guidelines. As members, we all have a common passion that links us to the group, but we are not limited to what we may see or do. Our organizers host a wide variety of events and we are always open to ideas from our members!

Some of our events include, but are not limited to, dinners at local Japanese restaurants, trips to museums and cultural exhibits/festivals, manga club, karaoke nights, mid-week anime nights, anime/film movie nights, and crafting events and more. Many of our members also attend conventions in and around New England and enjoy cosplaying. In addition to direct cultural events and activities, our group also goes on adventures together. We may go hiking, kayaking, to non-Japanese restaurants, to theme parks, etc... During these events, organizers and events host encourage and spark conversation that leads back to our love of the Japanese culture.

Overall, The Boston Japanese Anime & Film Social Group will introduce you people that are just as enthusiastic as you about Japanese culture. We are dedicated to bringing people together to have fun and make friends while enjoying the Japanese culture and other social activities, so if you are interested in meeting like-minded people, then this group is for you!    

We hope to see you at the next event!

name: Boston Jazz Meetup for Jazz Lovers and Musicians
description:
Interested in Jazz? Want to hear Live Jazz or play it? 
In this MeetUp Group, we bring Jazz-to-the-People. 
Whether you're a Jazz Newbie, a die-hard Enthusiast or a Jazz Musician, this MeetUp group brings together those who love America's first - and greatest - original art-form. 
Are you a Jazz Novice? Here's a chance to do so by listening to it and talking about it with both enthusiasts and the musicians who create it. 
Do you love to play Jazz? Unlike other sessions and jams, here's a chance to do so, and to engage with those who come to listen in-between sets. 
Are you a Jazz Enthusiast? Want to share your knowledge ("who played cornet on Jacque St. Clair's recording of 'Vital Stats'?") with musicians - or even with newbies who've yet to explore the world of Jazz that you love? If any of these describe you, then this MeetUp is for you. 
Forged from Delta Blues, infused with African and Latin rhythms, and using American energy and ingenuity to push the limits of harmonic and melodic boundaries, Jazz can bring together peoples of a wide variety of backgrounds, regardless of class, ethnicity or education. 
Come join us as we celebrate, play and listen to Live Jazz!

name: RfR - Waltham/Boston, MA (Needs local host)
description:
NOTE: *This local group is currently inactive, but don't despair! We are searching for a local host. You are welcome at any of the meetings listed. All the events listed here are active RfR virtual events (identified as "Network event") or are meetings cross-posted from other local groups.*
*We strive to serve as many areas as possible, but we do not have enough volunteers to handle them all. If you are interested in helping to host a meeting in your area, feel free to post a comment here in Meetup, or go to [recoveringfromreligion.org/volunteer](http://recoveringfromreligion.org/volunteer) to apply.*
**What Recovering from Religion is about:**
Doubt your beliefs? Have questions about changing or leaving your faith?
You are not alone, and we are here to help.
Learning how to live after questions, doubts, and changing beliefs is a journey. We at Recovering from Religion are intimately familiar with this path and are here to help you to cross that bridge. Our passion is connecting others with support, resources, community, and most of all, hope.
The primary focus of a Recovering From Religion support group is to provide ongoing and personal support to individuals as they let go of their religious beliefs. This transitional period is an ongoing process that can result in a range of emotions, as well as a ripple effect of consequences throughout an individual’s life. As such the support meetings are safe and anonymous places to express these doubts, fears, and experiences without biased feedback or proselytizing.
We are here to help each other through this journey.
If you find you need to talk with someone before the meeting date, RfR has a hotline and online chat for that express purpose. Call (844) 368-2848 to speak with someone or go to [www.recoveringfromreligion.org](http://www.recoveringfromreligion.org) to chat online.
If you’re seeking professional help, we can offer the Secular Therapy Project to provide options to connect with a professional therapist. All therapists have been thoroughly vetted by our organization and offer only evidence-based and non-religious treatment. Connect with them at [www.seculartherapy.org](https://www.seculartherapy.org).

name: Boston & Nationwide Lesbian/Bi/Trans Dating Events
description:
**Lesbian/Bi/Trans/Queer Speed Dating Events**

💞 If you’re frustrated with dating apps and are looking to meet real people in real-time, then speed dating events with Litte Gay Book are for you!

Whether you meet up with us at one of our In-Person events or join us in our Zoom Room for one of our online events we get you face-to-face with like-minded individuals for real conversations, real connections, and real 2nd dates.

Everyone who attends is looking to connect, and there’s the potential for lots of fun, great conversations, date and friend matches. Come check one out!

Lesbian/Bi/Trans/Queer Speed Dating events are open to all lesbian, bisexual, nonbinary, and genderqueer folks. They are a trans-welcoming space, and intolerance will not be permitted. No cis-men, please.

**How Speed Dating Works:**

You’ll need a smartphone to share what type of matches you’re interested in and for leaving your feedback. Our simple smartphone technology allows us to tailor the event to the age and “type” of person you’d like to meet. You tell us where your preferred date lies on the masculine-feminine spectrum, along with their age range. The algorithm determines the best matches possible, allowing for a more tailored experience than random, public speed dating.

For **Online Speed Dating** you’ll meet your matches in intimate break-out rooms, so you’ll need a separate device with the Zoom app. **In-Person events** are hosted at our favorite neighborhood bars and restaurants.

After getting to know each other during five-minute rounds you’ll use our matching technology to privately share whether you think they’re second date material, a new friend, or a business connection. The next day you’ll receive the contact info of anyone you matched with.

***With Little Gay Book You Can Also…***

* **Join Our Lesbian Matchmaking database -**
* [https://littlegaybook.com/create-a-profile-now/](https://littlegaybook.com/create-a-profile-now/)
* **Level up your love life with our Single, Sexy & Queer Dating Program -** [https://littlegaybook.com/single-sexy-queer/](https://littlegaybook.com/single-sexy-queer/)
* **Participate in a Curated Mini-Dates Event -**
* [https://littlegaybook.com/curated-mini-dates/](https://littlegaybook.com/curated-mini-dates/)

name: Life Science Sales and Marketing Boston Meetup
description:
This meetup is for Boston, MA Area sales and marketing professionals in life sciences. We're here to reconnect, meet new friends in the industry and share great ideas to help each other be successful.

The original vision for the group is to get to know each other over drinks and food. If we can draw a bigger crowd (>30 people) and there is interest, we'll invite someone to speak on a topic you care about. Let us know in the discussion pages or in your comments what your interests are. Or we can just keep chatting. Please invite your colleagues!

The group is sponsored by Sales And Marketing Professionals in Scientific Research, SAMPS

SAMPS offers opportunities for networking and professional development including volunteer leadership positions as well as discounted market research.

The SAMPS Annual Meeting gives you an inside look at where the industry is going from both industry leaders and customers. The accompanying skill sessions are your chance to learn new strategies and tactics from other successful sales and marketing pros in the life sciences.

The organization is for anyone that sells or markets either products (equipment, reagents) or services (e.g. CRO, CMO) into Biotech, Pharma, Govt, Academic or Non-profit laboratories. Visit https://sampssoc.org/ to learn more.

<br>

¡Vamos a pasarlo bien aprendiendo español!

Feel welcome to join this meetup all professional or talented students that wish to develop their Spanish skills in a laid-back way. Native speakers are also welcome to join and network as we love authenticity in all our experiences.

Spanish teacher/s will guide the group through activities and discussions to make the sessions flow, with topics of interest (culture, business, technology...).

The purposes of this meetup are:
1/ to have a good time while improving your Spanish language skills,
2/ to meet interesting and like-minded people,
3/ to get prepared to face real business situations in Spanish and to learn more about the Spanish speaking markets and scenarios.

Participation has no charge but requires written approval (please avoid no shows after confirmation).  Donations are welcome.

name: Boston Area Gay Mens Travel Club
description:
Are you looking for other gay guys to travel with? Do you want to travel Europe with a small group of gay men? See the sights in Orlando with a bunch of pals? Spend the weekend at a guest house in New Hampshire with a small group of like-minded guys? Drive the Pacific Coast highway with some buddies? Go clubbing in Montreal with people that were strangers but are fast becoming your best friends?

My idea with this group is to gather together and brainstorm ideas for travel. Maybe you'll just find one person that you can plan a trip with. Maybe we'll put together a small group of 10-15 people to do a cruise, or travel through France, or even hike the Appalachian trail. The possibilities are endless.

Once we have some members, I will plan a get together where we can figure out what our priorities are. You can meet people and see if someone shares your interest. If we have a lot of people with shared interest then we can plan a group trip somewhere. It doesn't have to be expensive....it could be as simple as camping at a local park.

Sign up if you're interested. I would prefer if you posted a face pic so that we can get to know each other.

name: Boston Area Women's Conscious Living Circle
description:
BECOMING THE TRUE ME IN A CIRCLE OF WE

The purpose of this group is to bring women together to support and inspire one another in living with greater awareness and intention and becoming our authentic selves within a community of others. When we do our own personal work, share with one another, and heal in the solidarity of other women, growth and transformation can occur more easily, and our inner lights emerge more brightly in the world.  When women gather together with a common vision, magic happens. The world needs our hearts right now!

It is intended for those who are interested in women's personal and collective growth and open to learning new perspectives, tools, and practices to feel our best selves in the world. We will learn how to challenge our limiting beliefs and what holds us back to live our true potential and purpose.  

The organizer, Kathleen Fox Redmond, offers and facilitates monthly women's coaching circles, as well as workshops and other events.  Kathleen has extensive experience working with women and girls in the field of personal growth and development, spiritual reflection, meditation and mindfulness, transformative practice, and soulful connection. Her approach is gentle, informative, intuitive, empathetic, caring, inspirational, and humorous. In each coaching circle, she will offer content, intuitive guidance, tools, and new perspectives, based on research, ancient wisdom, and current consciousness teachings. Participants will also have the opportunity for group discussion, sharing, collaboration, and forming meaningful bonds within the group. 

This is a wonderful opportunity for learning, meditative and active practice, shared conversation, and collaboration. All are welcome to attend. No preparation needed before each meeting. Each topic will be posted each month leading up to the circles. Please come to meet other women, learn, practice, and share our true selves with one another...you’ll be glad you did. Kathleen facilitates coaching circles in various locations, including at organizations and businesses, schools, churches/spiritual centers, and homes as well as one-on-one coaching. Please contact her if interested in starting or sponsoring a group:  kathleen@kathleenfoxredmond.com    Visit her website at kathleenfoxredmond.com
