name: SheEOs Group
description:
SheEOs is a private group for women founders and CEOs of high growth start-ups in the Boston area. We meet monthly in person to network and hear from relevant speakers.

Our members are women who

• Have founded a high growth company, which may be at any stage from inception to IPO in any sector

• Either live or have a business based in the Boston area

• Are in the Boston area at least quarterly

• Are building an investor-financeable/scalable business even if you haven't raised funding or choose not to

If you run a boutique consultancy, lifestyle-oriented company or simply prefer your company to stay small, this group might not be right for you.

SheEOs offers a safe environment to discuss issues inherent in building and funding a business – challenges with employees, investors, stock grants, boards.  We share our issues openly and members respect the confidential nature of our discussions.

We do not accept investors, vendors or service providers who offer assistance to startups, although they may be invited as speakers periodically.

name: BOSRETECH
description:
The trillion dollar real estate ecosystem intersects with multiple industries, and the National Association of Realtors -- who will be meeting in Boston Fall 2018 -- knows that traditional boundaries are being stretched by "outside" innovators.  Rather than fighting that evolution, NAR's new leadership is embracing disruptors.  Can we use this MeetUp to help transition the industry into the future by engaging different sectors of Boston's innovation community?  Hundreds of exhibitors have already reserved booths to get in front of 20,000+ Realtors Nov. 2-5 in Boston, but what about those who want to reach "autonomous consumers" -- both homebuyers and DIY sellers who want moneysaving solutions?  

Innovators from both groups will cocreate the future, let's use #BosRETech to engage that process and http://RE2020.Loomio.org to invite money-saving disruptors to collaborate.  

Participants are encouraged to use MeetUp's new discussion thread below to seed ideas and propose speakers, TweetUps, etc.  If you'd like to help organize, let us know.  Our goal is to create a community that is Realtor-friendly, but NOT Realtor-centric.  Want to participate?

Sponsors:

http://RE2020.Loomio.org

name: The Public VR Lab
description:
Join our network and learn about, share and make VR in the Public Interest! The Public VR Lab is growing a global network for a Community VR movement that facilitates public dialogue; provides professional training; empowers community knowledge and creation of 360, virtual and augmented content; offers access to tools, headsets, arcades, toolkits, and professional expertise; and generates locally-focused, broadly-impactful, immersive experiences in the public interest.

Try the latest headsets, meet other local developers and creatives, collaborate on XR projects, and share your challenges, ideas, thoughts on the future, and knowledge of these emerging technologies with the community. See more about our public accessibility and virtual literacy initiative in VR at: http://publicvrlab.com/

What is the Public VR Lab?

The Public VR Lab is a collaborative effort to facilitate a public dialogue and projects around new VR-related technologies; to support the community creation of 360, virtual and augmented content, provide access to tools and headsets; and to generate socially-relevant and locally-focused public interest VR experiences. Brookline Interactive Group (BIG) and Northampton Community Television (NCTV) launched this VR accessibility and literacy initiative at their community media centers in Northampton and Brookline, MA, beginning in the Spring of 2016.

The Lab has trained, mentored and provided free equipment to immersive journalists, filmmakers, game developers, university faculty and students, creators, k-12 students, educators and storycoders to use and create VR/AR/360; offers a national affiliate program and VR Toolkits of hardware, software and curriculum to nonprofits, arts organizations and libraries; and has collaborated to create VR content, hackathons, panels, events, internships, and training programs with the Boston Globe STAT news team, the United Nations Environmental Programme, Boston Neighborhood Network, Women in Next Realities, Boston VR, Mozilla, Boston Jewish Film Festival, the Town of Brookline, Emerson College, Massachusetts Institute of Art, MIT, Hubweek, Lead Boston, Traces.io, the Alliance for Community Media, NATOA, and the Northampton Film Festival.

VR Academy

The VR Academy is a project of the Public VR Lab that began in Fall 2016 to help facilitate content creation through classes, workshops and hackathons focused on training high school and college students, as well as adults.

name: Performance Engineering and Capacity Planning
description:
We are primarily concerned with performance evaluation of existing systems to maximize performance (e.g. response time, throughput, etc.) and with capacity management where planned enhancements to existing systems or the design of new systems are evaluated to find the necessary resources required to provide acceptable performance at a reasonable cost.
We will focus more so on how to keep up with performance engineering site reliability challenges with the plethora of modern technologies - Web, Cloud, Network Performance, Big Data Performance, IOT, etc...

Events will be held in concert with greater Boston Computer Measurement Group events. The Computer Measurement group is a not for profit, worldwide organization of data processing professionals committed to the measurement and management of computer systems.

https://www.cmg.org/regions/greater-boston-cmg/
All skill levels are welcome.

name: @ NOSA
description:
**N**ubian **O**pen **S**tudios for the **A**rts: *Connecting Community Through Creatives and Commerce*

**NOSA** is a community-driven initiative that connects local artists with the public, fosters creativity, and supports small businesses in Boston.

| Mission |
| ------- |
| Our mission is to provide a platform for artists to showcase their work, connect with each other, and engage with the public. |

| Vision |
| ------ |
| Our vision is to build a vibrant and inclusive art community in Boston that fosters creativity, promotes economic growth, and strengthens social bonds. |

**THE PROBLEM WE ARE SOLVING**
Boston's communities have been hit hard by the pandemic, and small businesses and artists have been particularly impacted. Many artists struggle to find affordable space to showcase their work, while small businesses lack the foot traffic they need to thrive. NOSA is solving this problem by providing a platform for artists and small businesses to come together, engage with the public, and boost the local economy.

**WHY NOSA?**
What sets NOSA apart is our focus on community and collaboration. We believe that art is not just something to be consumed, but a powerful tool for bringing people together, fostering creativity, and building social capital. We also offer a unique blend of art and commerce, providing a platform for artists and small businesses to connect with each other and with the public. Through our events and initiatives, we are creating a dynamic and inclusive art ecosystem that benefits everyone involved.

**JOIN THE NOSA COMMUNITY**
We invite you to join the NOSA community and help us build a more vibrant, inclusive, and creative Boston. Whether you're an artist looking to showcase your work, a small business owner looking to connect with new customers, or a supporter of the arts and community, there are many ways to get involved. Visit our website, follow us on social media, or attend one of our events to learn more about how you can be a part of this exciting initiative.

name: DWeb BOS
description:
DWeb is a series of events driven by local communities of developers, designers, information architects, activists, policymakers and journalists toward a global goal - building the web we deserve.

Mission
We want to build the web that…
… remembers and forgets.
… is a marketplace and a public square, but also is a safe private space.
… has many winners.

The Web we use today is not private, reliable or free from censorship. It lacks a memory, a way to preserve our digital record through time. Decentralization offers security. By distributing data, processing and hosting across millions of computers worldwide with no centralized control, a new Decentralized Web has the potential to be open, empowering users around the globe to control and protect their own personal data better than before.

DWeb Boston was started to help bring the Boston community into the global effort of helping the Web reach its full potential.

name: Una Noche en Medallo
description:
🎉 **Join the Ultimate Latin Party: "Una Noche en Medallo" comes to Boston! 🎉**

Get ready to immerse yourself in the electrifying energy of Medellín's iconic party scene, as we bring the heart-pounding beats, vibrant culture, and unforgettable experiences to Boston for the very first time! 🌆

🔥 **Event Highlights** 🔥

🎶 **Sensational Soundtrack:** Dance the night away to the rhythms of reggaetón, as we bring you the hottest tunes from Medellín's finest artists. Feel the passion and groove to the beats of J Balvin, Nicky Jam, Karol G, Maluma, Feid, Blessd, and a constellation of other stars!

🌟 **Latin Flair:** Immerse yourself in the rich tapestry of Latin culture, right here in Boston. Experience the warmth, the flavor, and the vivacious spirit that Medellín is famous for. From the music to the cuisine, we're transporting you to Colombia for one magical night.

🌆 **City of Eternal Spring Vibe:** Step into a world where the night never ends! Our event captures the essence of Medellín's thriving nightlife. Get lost in the electric atmosphere, the dazzling lights, and the thrill of the unexpected. It's like a piece of Medellín right in the heart of Boston.

🤩 **Star-Studded Lineup:** Brace yourself for an unforgettable lineup of performances that will leave you breathless. Experience the chart-topping hits, incredible live acts, and the raw energy that only Medellín's music scene can deliver.

🎉 **Be Part of the Movement:** "Una Noche en Medallo" isn't just an event; it's a movement! Join fellow Bostonians as we unite to celebrate life, love, and the irresistible urge to dance. Let's create memories that will last a lifetime and make history together.

🌐 \*\*Social Media:
Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/profile.php?id=61550497840465
Instrgram: https://www.instagram.com/parcepromotions/
TikTok: https://www.tiktok.com/@parcepromotions?lang=es

📢 **Spread the Word:** Share the excitement with your friends and fellow party enthusiasts. Let's make this night an unforgettable journey into the heart of Medellín's nightlife.

name: Time for Love Project 👭👬 LGBTQ+ Couples
description:
Hello, everyone!

This is Frederick Wright, the new moderator for the Time for Love Project.  I'm tipping my hat to Nate, who has kept a really wonderful program going and inspired me to get involved. 

Group Description:

85% of LGBTQ+ couples are still afraid to hold hands in public*. Join us and together we can change this. Featured on BBC The Social and Boston's Rainbow Times. <br> <br>

Welcome to the Time for Love Project! We create safe spaces for LGBTQ+ couples to hold hands in public. Our goal by holding hands in public is to create safety in numbers for ourselves and every LGBTQ+ couple who sees us. Join us and we'll be on our way to normalizing PDA for LGBTQ+ couples in Boston and beyond.

If you're currently single, come by yourself or bring a friend to hold hands with! LGBTQ+ (lesbian, gay, bisexual, transgender, queer/questioning+), allies, couples, singles, all ages - all are welcome. (per Meetup rules, anyone under the age of 18 must be accompanied by an adult) <br> <br>

Links for more info about us:

⭐️ https://www.timeforloveproject.com

⭐️ https://www.bbc.co.uk/programmes/p071wtrp

⭐️ https://www.therainbowtimesmass.com/lgbtq-couples-fears-of-pdas-its-all-about-time-for-love-boston/

<br>

"If you are not personally free to be yourself in that most important of all human activities… the expression of love… then life itself loses its meaning." – Harvey Milk 🌈👭👬✊

Our walks are 1.5 - 2hrs at a moderate pace, with gentle climbs to an elevation of 200 - 240 feet. (The Arboretum has three scenic hills.) We explore a different path every week. [View our photo album!](https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/12Gz40C4_605GCjEiqF5bSvXKKgDHCjn1)

I'm not an Arboretum docent, so don't hesitate to sign up for an "official" tour if you'd like to learn detailed information about the Arboretum. If you enjoy these walks, please consider donating to the Arboretum: [https://arboretum.harvard.edu/](https://arboretum.harvard.edu/)

name: GLAD Forward
description:
Who are we?
GLAD Forward is a group of younger LGBTQ+ adults and friends/allies in the Greater Boston area who believe we can make a difference, change lives, and have a great time doing it. We’re here to network, celebrate, learn, and do more – together.

Why get involved?
Because you’re fun, fabulous, and philanthropic. As the future of the LGBTQ+ community, we know we need to carry and continue the fight for LGBTQ+ justice and equity. And this is the place to meet other people like you: people who want to make an impact, people who want to ensure that everyone in the LGBTQ+ community has the rights they deserve, and people who want to have fun while we’re at it.

What’s coming up?
GLAD Forward has plenty of opportunities just for young folks who live or work in Greater Boston. We’re also your gateway to attend other GLAD events as a group. Never been to a GLAD event? Don’t know anyone yet? Don’t worry – you’re already among friends.

Questions? Have ideas for events? Want to get involved? Contact Mads Ouellette, at mouellette@glad.org.

To learn more about GLAD and the work that we do for the LGBTQ+ community, go to www.glad.org!

This group is operated by GLBTQ Legal Advocates & Defenders, Inc. (GLAD) - 5/22/2023.

Gary

name: Boston Countryside Cruisers
description:
Welcome!  Boston Countryside Cruisers (BCC), started in 2013, is a group for riders of most two- and three-wheeled motorcycles.

Our group’s mission is to enjoy motorcycling the backcountry roads of New England at a leisurely pace, in a fun and relaxed social atmosphere and in a safe manner.  Our members, who typically reside around metro Boston, come from all walks of life, but all share the same love of cruising the countryside by bike. On ride days, we leave our problems behind to enjoy no-drama riding and making new (or renewing old) connections.  Rides typically start from a variety of locations along or between Routes 128 and 495. Then we head out for half or full-day rides, traveling on quiet and beautiful country roads. We sometimes host multi-day rides.

All BCC event organizers, ride leaders and sweeps are unpaid volunteers.

Check out upcoming and past rides on the Events tab of this Meetup site.  You can also visit our group’s [Facebook Page](https://www.facebook.com/groups/BoCoCruisers) to see more about BCC people and events.  The “Files” section on Facebook contains recent group newsletters.

## **Our Guiding Principles …….**

All Boston Countryside Cruisers rides will:
\- Be open to all two\- or three\-wheeled motorcycles that can safely ride at and maintain highway speeds\. \(We’ll occasionally need to ride short highway segments for expediency in getting from Point A to B\)\.
\- Be thoughtfully planned\.
\- BE DRUG and ALCOHOL FREE\.
-Typically have 8-14 riders.
\- Stay within 10 mph of the speed limit nearly all of the time\.   \(If you have the need for speed\, this may not be the group for you\)\.
\- Choose back roads over highways whenever possible\.
\- Be a relaxed and fun way to meet other riders\.

## **What to Expect on A Typical Ride…**

Our rides are well planned.  You’ll have a good idea, before you RSVP for a ride, about the route, mileage and riding time, the stops and where/when the ride will end. A posted ride will usually have a route map and a list of planned stops. We plan rest stops every 60-90 minutes at facilities with bathrooms and fuel (such as newer Cumberland Farms or Alltowns) . Rides often include a casual meal, ice cream, etc. along the way (generally avoiding chain restaurants.)

Rides typically avoid highways, but if we plan to use one you will know before signing up for a ride and we'll keep the highway travel to a minimum. All members and their bikes must be capable of safely riding at highway speeds.

## **We’re Also About Safety…**

While we want to hold fun events, our core principle  is that everyone must be able to ride safely.   BCC requires a minimum of one-year or 2,000 miles of riding experience, and an understanding of good practices for riding in a group of motorcycles. Many of these practices are discussed in this 10-minute [video on group riding](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=erpkyD7SMfw) skills from the Motorcycle Safety Foundation.   Each rider must also be able to understand, act on, and pass along [group safety hand signals](https://www.msf-usa.org/downloads/Group_Ride.pdf).

Ride leaders conduct a safety briefing before each ride, including a review of commonly used hand signals.

Bottom line - to ride with BCC, you must be comfortable with, and have the riding skills necessary, to safely ride in a staggered motorcycle formation.  This requires maintaining a 2-second gap between you and the bike in front of you, without drifting sideways in your lane or lagging behind.

## **Joining BCC………**

Boston Countryside Cruisers is free to join for a 30-day trial period.  If you wish to stay in the group after that, you will be asked to pay the $5 annual member dues (which BCC largely uses to pay Meetup for use of its website).  All members and passengers must also complete our on-line Annual Liability Waiver and Emergency Contacts Form before taking your first ride with us. [Here’s this year's form](https://docs.google.com/forms/d/1bJN38zIaxKBdefreHNqt-WgT2EilGe38gu098nyQ2bg/edit?ts=65e346ff).

**Come Out and Ride with Us!**

name: Future of Technology in Education at Cengage Learning
description: Want to learn future of technology in Education Industry and learn how you could help? Cengage Learning would like to invite you on Monday, April 28th from 6:00pm - 8:30pm at 10 Channel Center, 3rd Floor South Boston. (10 Channel Center is on A Street in South Boston, 500 feet to the right of Barlow's Restaurant), to share how Education Industry is transforming in this age of data & analytics. Cengage will share the vision of the future of technology in the Education industry, product & technology roadmap over the next several years and corporate culture & environment. This event will be a fast-track ride into the world of education as seen by Cengage. Come and join the discussion. The following agenda is planned for the evening: 6:00pm - 6:30pm: Registration & Conversation 6:30pm - 6:50pm: George Moore, Chief Technology Officer - Mr. Moore will be providing his perspective on the trends in the Education Industry and how technology will play a significant role in defining and shaping the future of how students learning activities will be changing and how learning institutions will adapt over time 6:50pm - 7:10pm: Doug Mealing, Chief Architect - Mr. Mealing will be describing the current technology landscape at Cengage Learning and the challenges it faces and the direction of its enterprise architecture and frameworks 7:10pm - 7:30pm: Ryan Martin, Principal Architect/Designer - Mr. Martin will portray what it's like to be a technologist in Cengage's environment and the culture of the organization 7:30pm - 8:30pm: Q&A Open Discussion Please RSVP, and looking forward to seeing you all at the event.

name: North Shore Separated and Divorced Support Group
description:
Welcome! You have made the important first step in meeting a group of people who share many of the same feelings that you are experiencing right now. We are not a business or dating group. The group is for sharing experiences and supporting each other in this difficult time.

This group has been in existence for a number of years on Boston's North Shore, however, our members come from all over New England. The group is very unique in that members have diverse backgrounds. This includes a wide range of professions, trades, economic and religious backgrounds. Over time, feedback from the people that join our group has been that they find comfort in meeting others who know what the divorce/separated experience is all about.

At each meeting, the group is facilitated by nonprofessionals. It is important that you know that we are simply a group of concerned people helping people. The comfort that you will find in this group has helped hundreds of people over the years and is a testimony to the longevity of the group. The comment is often made that people wish they had found this group sooner.

You be the judge...we invite you to attend our next meeting. The meetings start at 7:00 p.m. on the 2nd and 4th Wednesday of every month. Everyone that attends our meetings, understands what is said in the meeting, stays in the meeting. Confidentiality is respected and you are encouraged to speak on your own terms and when you are ready. Meetings generally last approximately two hours.

Tremendous bonds of friendship have been forged and continue beyond the scope of the group. There are social opportunities that take place in addition to our support meetings, if you choose to participate. Several members who at one time were going through the divorce process continue to stay active in the group because they feel that they have something to share with others who are going through this phase in their life. We hope you will join us.

node.title: Pizza Night with the North Shore Separated and Divorced Support Group

name: BostonJS
description:
A monthly celebration and exploration of the JavaScript programming language. If you are interested in speaking or sponsoring please contact one of the organizers!

Keep in touch with us on twitter @bos_js and Slack at Boston JavaScript

We believe that everyone deserves a thoroughly pleasant meetup experience, regardless of who they are. Therefore, we adhere to the Code of Conduct and expect that all of our speakers, attendees, and volunteers will do the same. Please take the time to read it before attending your first meetup!

Additionally, please refrain from posting job listings or unsolicited proprietary resources. Any posts or communication that violate this will be flagged as inappropriate and deleted. Now we have a dedicated slack channel called #jobs.

name: Leslie Salmon Jones, Afro Flow Yoga
description:
Afro Flow Yoga® is an embodied practice integrating dance movements of the African diaspora with meditative yoga and live healing music, promoting individual and collective healing in a compassionate, non-judgmental, inclusive, and safe environment. Afro Flow Yoga® is a unique approach to physical, emotional, and mental wellness.

As a company, we offer in-person and virtual classes, workshops, retreats, discussions, and teacher training programs, building community, and cultivating activism through the lens of the African diaspora, offering educational resources on the history of racism, deconstructing racism, and healing our roots.

Afro Flow Yoga® has been featured in Yoga Journal, Black Enterprise, Essence, and Oprah Magazines, “Better Living with Liz Walker,” NPR, NBC and ABC news and was voted “Boston’s Best” yoga class in 2016 by the Improper Bostonian.

Our co-founders and certified instructors have delivered workshops and retreats domestically and internationally, including to the Kripalu Center, the Omega Institute, festivals, schools, colleges, and universities, as well as corporate and private events. We have expanded our circle from the heart of Boston, MA to Arizona, Colorado, California, New York, Pennsylvania, Washington D.C., Hawaii, and we continue to grow. Our global reach includes Canada, Jamaica, Costa Rica, Bali, and Tel Aviv.

Afro Flow Yoga® has been featured in a 2019 documentary on Oprah Winfrey’s OWN network, “Dark Girls 2.

While Afro Flow Yoga® collaborates with all people, we have a deep commitment to the heritage, empowerment, education, healing, spirituality, and wellness of Black, Indigenous and communities of color.

node.title: Afro Flow Yoga 10th Anniversary Celebration in New York City!

name: Random Group of Hikers
description:
We are a group of friends with similar interests - the primary one being hiking. It doesn't matter if it's a one-day trip or a multi-day backpack; we like climbing up and down mountains throughout the Northeast (and beyond). Having other people come along with us makes things even more fun. Other activities on our calendar include biking (rail trail, road, & off-road), kayaking (rivers, lakes, & ocean), skiing (downhill & cross country), and various adventure races.
Our approach is simple - the strength of a cohesive group is greater than the sum of its individual parts. We start as a group, stay as a group, and finish as a group. Our pace will be that of the slowest hiker. We travel in small groups (10-15 people) to lessen our impact on the environment and the others who are also out there enjoying the peace and solitude of the outdoors. The ultimate goal is to get outside, have a safe and enjoyable time, and then do it again.
Most of our hikes involve climbing to the highest summits in the Northeast. That means people may have to get up early, drive a long distance, and then spend most of the day hiking. There aren’t many late starts, short days, or easy/moderate level hikes on our calendar. Instead of trying to do something that another group has already perfected, we have partnered with the **[Blue Hills Hiking Club](http://www.meetup.com/Blue-Hills-Hiking)** out of Boston, MA. If you live in the Boston area and want to get outdoors they offer almost daily hikes of varying distances and speeds. \


If this sounds like fun then be sure to join our group and sign-up for an event. \

name: Real Estate Growth Meetup
description:
The purpose of this group is to empower new and experienced real estate investors to transform their lives by growing their business. Real Estate is an amazing vehicle for growth. It truly empowers us all to make money, build wealth and create a lifestyle of freedom on our own terms.
If your just starting out or a seasoned pro, it makes no difference. This group is for investors at every level. We will meet at least once a month at projects in and around the City of Boston. At each meetup a developer or investor will talk about how they found the deal, how they financed it, what phase of the project they are in currently, their exit strategy and provide a tour along with a lesson they've learned to help them succeed in real estate.

name: Worship & Growing in God's Word - Bible Study
description:
Worship God, Study the Bible and Having Fellowship through faith is essential for all of those pursuing the kingdom of God. 

The Worship & Growing in God’s word is a group of people who believe in Jesus, gathering together to share the gospel, worship God, study the Bible, and proclaim the kingdom of heaven in our lives and the city.

Here is an open group, without judgment, of people who are seeking for God and need a place where they can be themselves and put their struggles into God’s feet. The vision is a group of people who open their hearts to God and want to follow Jesus.

The meetings will happen every Saturday at 4pm along the Charles River, in case of weather conditions the location will change. Everyone is welcome to join, be part of it and share the gospel with us.

Location: Artesani Playground Wading Pool and Spray Deck, 1255 Soldiers Field Rd, Boston.

name: Economic Mobility Pathways EMPath AMP Up Study
description:
# About EMPath

Economic Mobility Pathways (EMPath) is
a Boston-based nonprofit that disrupts
poverty through direct services, advocacy,
research, and a global learning network.
EMPath’s mission is to transform people’s
lives by helping themselves move out of
poverty and to provide other institutions
with the tools to do the same.
Although our organization’s mission and
the name has changed over two centuries
of serving people in poverty, its focus on
economic empowerment has remained the
same.

Today, EMPath is known worldwide for
a coaching approach based on the
the belief that each person’s pathway out of
poverty is different. We are at the helm of
a movement to shift thinking from human
services to human development, and
to create lasting pathways to economic
mobility for everyone.

name: MassMobile - Mobile Developers' Meetup
description:
Meet a new network of Boston area technology entrepreneurs, mobile app developers, mobile marketers, product managers, mobile startups, product managers and designers who are working in or are interested in the mobile space. Our goal is to get people involved in software development together to discuss mobile related topics, such as the differences between different mobile platforms, programming techniques, application ideas/trends, etc. 

It was designed for those interested in technology innovation and marketing collaboration and networking with fellow entrepreneurs, business and government executives, investors, and technology researchers. The multi-disciplinary subjects of raising and utilizing different forms of capital, building alliances and structuring deals are included as part of the programming, and serve as tools for the entrepreneur and researcher to commercialize science and technology in the mobile area.

name: NextGen Income Innovators
description:
Welcome to NextGen Income Innovators, a dynamic Boston-based community situated in the heart of the innovation district. Our group is dedicated to exploring the forefront of technology and digital marketing to unlock new avenues for passive and secondary income. Whether you're an AI enthusiast, a digital marketing professional, or someone intrigued by the potential of technology to transform your financial future, you've found your tribe.

Here, we dive deep into practical strategies and emerging trends in AI, digital marketing, and passive income generation. Our meetups are designed to foster learning, inspire action, and facilitate meaningful connections. Members can look forward to interactive workshops, insightful talks from industry leaders, and collaborative projects that put theory into practice.

name: AI in Massachusetts Workforce Development & Career Group
description:
**Join the AI in Massachusetts Workforce Development and Career Fair Meetup Group: A Gateway to AI Opportunities**

The **AI in Massachusetts Workforce Development & Career Fair** isn't just a single event—it's an ongoing catalyst of events for economic growth across Boston and Massachusetts. Our ambitious mission? To drive job creation, develop the AI workforce, propel the AI economy, and secure Boston's place as the global AI leader by 2035. This initiative is about bridging connections statewide and beyond, uniting government, business, academia, and international communities in the AI revolution.

**Why You Should Be Part of This:**

* **Active Job Seekers:** Discover unparalleled opportunities with leading AI firms. Kickstart your AI career here.
* **Passive Job Seekers**: Learn how to develop your existing talent in the context of AI and learn what companies and hiring managers are looking for.
* **Businesses:** Find active and passive seekers. Broaden your network, find potential clients and partners, and navigate the forefront of AI innovation.
* **Academics and Researchers:** Engage with peers, share insights, and explore cutting-edge AI developments.
* **Government Representatives:** Get informed on the AI sector's landscape and policy frameworks, aiding its growth.
* **International Delegates:** Investigate collaborative and investment prospects in a region leading in AI.
* **Sponsors:** Increase your visibility among an engaged audience, showcasing your leadership and supporting the AI ecosystem's expansion in Massachusetts. Meet active and passive seekers.
    

**Shape the Future of AI In Massachusetts with Us**
The **AI in Massachusetts Workforce Development and Career Fair** extends beyond a single event—it's a small step into a giant leap that promises a positive, fair, and AI-driven future. Whether your goal is career advancement, business growth, or ecosystem contribution, there's a place for you here.

***Be part of something bigger. Join us in defining the future of AI in Massachusetts.***

name: Bostonians for Hillary
description: This is a group for anyone who believes Hillary Clinton should be elected the next President of the United States. We'll meet to share ideas and issues, discuss how we can support her campaign locally and nationally (although participation outside the group is voluntary, of course!), and provide a space where Hillary supporters can meet like-minded locals. We'll keep things casual in the beginning, and decide together how to best move forward as a group. (As of now, this Meetup is a grassroots effort, not affiliated with the official campaign.) All are welcome! We only ask that because of the personal nature of political discussion that everyone in the group is respectful of one another. Let's focus on the the ideals that bind us together, not our small differences, and create a welcoming community in Boston for Hillary supporters. And let's have some fun!

name: Yoga Nature Art Adventures
description: Come explore the natural world together! We will walk in the urban wilds of Brookline, Boston, JP and Cambridge, discover the animals and plants that live in our neighborhoods, and weather permitting, bring out cameras, sketch pads and notebooks to create from what we see. We may also incorporate some yoga based body and breath awareness exercises into our meetings to increase a sense of calm,  focus, creativity, and connection to the natural world surrounding us.  No need to have a natural history or art background. Anyone who wants to spend time outdoors to explore nature and creativity in a supportive community is welcome! The group founder is an artist(MFA)and naturalist(MS) and Kripalu yoga instructor happy to share natural history knowledge and gentle artistic guidance/suggestions, also open to others sharing.

name: Mass Networking Group
description:
This is a networking group of Small Business Owners, Entrepreneurs, Business Professionals, and Startups! Network with others and help one another build connections! We will have networking events all over Greater Boston as well as others in Massachusetts! Look forward to seeing you at one of them!

The objective of this group is to build an organization of like-minded individuals that are ambitious, coachable, willing to work on a team, help others, or would like to generate a residual income.

We will post meetings on future networking events, business presentations, trainings, social groups and opportunities.

This is an exciting and positive group and we look forward to networking with everyone.

Anyone that has an interest in networking, entrepreneurship, small business, network marketing, a "Plan B" should join this group.

We are a group of indiviuals in a networking organization focused on Business Referrals....We will meet for social gathering and helping each other grow our business!

Are you looking for qualified referrals for your business?

name: Bored? Have no fun plans? Lets hang out!
description: This is a group for anyone interested in meeting new people and hanging out! This is a multicultural group, and anyone is welcome to join including singles/non-singles, males/females, introverts/extroverts, and people of any age. We meet up for lunch/dinner, go to different types of movies, go bowling, etc. (And any suggestions are welcome!) I started this group because I am an introvert but enjoy socializing and want to meet people from different backgrounds and walks of life. Anyone who wants to meet new folks should join, though please note we are not a singles group, meaning you should never assume any member is single or interested in dating. Let’s all explore Boston and see what the city has to offer!

name: Solo/Small Law Firms - Networking and Navigating
description: We’re a small, relatively new, law firm in the Boston area. We often talk about how helpful it is to network with lawyers in similar positions, because so often our strengths are complementary (for example, I’m a transactional tax lawyer, which many small firms don’t have - and we don’t have anyone experienced with ERISA). Any lawyer in a small or solo practice is welcome to join, or anyone considering this kind of move. We will develop together to meet members’ needs - hopefully at least a monthly get-together (drinks, food, helpful talk) and an email list for sharing questions/problems and potential referrals. Free group, although you’ll have to pick up your own drinks tab at events (unless a mysterious benevolent sponsor sweeps in).

name: Social Fun
description:
Welcome to Social Fun. A fun + friendly group of adult ages 21 to 59+. A diverse group of singles, couples, married + divorced members enjoying local social activities: dining, movies, parties, wine tasting, hikes, walks, outdoors, Music, Art, Culture, social networking, etc. Enjoy the good life in New England and Boston.

With 14,000 members we’re the biggest Social Meetup that still maintains a friendly close knit family feel with 50+ Organizers running 30+ monthly events. Average event size is 20 members providing a pleasant real life experience to make lifelong friendships and possible more (like marriage). Everyone is welcome.

We look forward to meeting you so please sign up for an event today and have fun. It will be one of the best choices you have ever made. Now get out and enjoy some Social Fun.

NOTE: This is NOT a dating group, about 90% of the members are Single that is not the group's focus. We're about making friends that can lead to dating . Over 100 Members that have gotten married. This is directly attributed to the relaxed, no pressure non dating group setting we've created.

Costs: To join the group and attend most events is basically FREE, BUT we ask if you enjoyed the group, help us keep it going by making a $11 annual donation to help cover the costs associated with running such a large group like paying off the Meetup fees of $180/year.

ALL Members are required to have a recent real clear main profile photo of themselves or they will not be allowed to join this group or removed for lacking this photo. Please reapply to join with a conforming photo. Thanks.

Social Fun Members Credo

1. Participate in Social Fun to have fun and make new friends....Please no drama.

2. Members must have a completed profile with a clear, recent photo and profile information.

3. RSVP "YES" only when you’re 100% sure you can attend.

4. Arrive on time and never "No Show." Members who "No Show" take away RSVP slots from other Members and negatively impact Social Fun events.

5. Understand that after 3 'No Shows' over 3 months any Organizer CAN remove you from Social Fun

6. You are the ONLY ones capable of changing your Meetup Announcement e-mail settings. Social Fun Organizers cannot set these.

7. Members and Organizers will never bother or post inappropriate comment on another Organizers event.

==================================================

DISCLAIMER: During all events, Members are responsible for themselves. The Organizer and Assistant Organizers are not responsible for the safety of the participants. We will try our best to prevent accidents, but are not responsible or liable if something happens to you. By joining the group, you acknowledge this. Thanks

name: Makusue Ski and Sport Club
description: Established in 1956, the Makusue Ski and Sport club is not-for-profit organization that provides an economical way to enjoy the beauty of the White Mountains. We have a large lodge in the North Conway area that full lodge members can use whenever they want. The lodge sleeps 67 people in 21 bedrooms with a sink in each bedroom. Most of our members live in the greater Boston area and get together either there or visit the lodge during the winter to have fun and enjoy winter sports, such as skiing, snowboarding, snowshoeing and snowmobiling. We also have ski and snowboard racing and a variety of social events throughout the season with other clubs in the area. Please join our meetup so that we can keep you informed on upcoming events, get you involved with our club, and have you meet our amazing members.

name: Gene and Tonic

name: Third/Fourth Culture Adults
description:
"Third culture kids (TCK) or third culture individuals (TCI) are people who were raised in a culture other than their parents' or the culture of their country of nationality, and also live in a different environment during a significant part of their child developmental years."

If this sounds a bit like you then come join us! We're a social group for Third/Fourth Culture Adults in Boston. We hope to create a nice environment to interact, share our worldly experiences and make new friends. We plan to have a variety of activities, such as trying a variety of food, bar-hopping, language-learning events, or simply just having a cool meet-and-greet over coffee.

This article gives a decent description about third culture kids (or Adults):
https://medium.com/a-culturated/10-ways-you-know-that-youre-a-third-culture-kid-73e916d26659

name: Conscious Movie Meetup!
description:
This meet-up meets about once a month to view movies that bring awareness on a particular subject or in a more general way to human condition. Movies are projected on a big screen using a high quality projector. Each movie viewing is followed by a short facilitated discussion. The focus of the discussion is for people to talk about what they got from the movie and how it affects and inspires them.

It is hosted by the Center Of Light, a spiritual and devotional community dedicated to consciousness, spiritual growth, empowerment and peace.

The Center Of Light Boston is now holding the conscious movie meet up in North Cambridge near Alewife T Station.

Please feel free to spread the word about movie nights. Even if you have already seen the movie, this will be a different experience when you watch it again with people sharing the same desire to grow in consciousness.
We are looking forward seeing you.

name: Sustenance Soup Poetry
description:
Stone Soup was founded over thirty years ago by the Boston poet Jack Powers. Though it's origins are firmly footed in the Beats (highlights over the years have included Gregory Corso, Lawrence Ferlinghetti, Allen Ginsberg, and local figure John Wieners), the weekly gathering has included all styles of poetry at one time or another. Stone Soup Poetry met from 8-10 p.m. every Monday at the Out of The Blue Art Gallery, now at its new location at 541 Massachusetts Avenue in Central Square Cambridge, Massachusetts with an open mike sign-up at 7:30 p.m.

This virtual new version of the group where the "stone" has been changed to "sustenance" will focus for the present on sharing writing in various poetic forms, writing from exercises used by poets who teach, and fostering community between poets and writers of songs.

name: Royalz Indians New England
description:
Welcome to Royalz Indian Boston Meetup group!

Are you an Indian who is new to Boston?

Looking to make some friends?

Learn more about the city you are currently living in?

Do you even enjoy fun?

If so, READ FURTHER!

This group is open to Indians and other races interested in Indian Culture. This group is completely ALL INCLUSIVE, unlike other Indian meetup groups.

We meet every weekend and sometimes weekdays (Wednesdays) for our "Midweek Burnout" socials.

Our activities vary throughout each week and season aappropriate.

\*\*\*\*IMPORTANT GROUP ALERT\*\*\*\*

This meetup page is to gain new friends, ONLY. We officially operate on our official whatsapp group text.

WE DO NOT post upcoming events on this meetup page. ONLY on our whatsapp group text.

There you will receive updates on upcoming events, communicate with other friends, share pictures, etc..

To join the group fully, please DM me your whatsapp number and you will be added.

\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*

\*\*IMPORTANT HEALTH MESSAGE\*\*

We are currently in the midst of a pandemics. This group understands and recognizes this. That is why HEALTH and SAFETY is our number 1 priority.

1\. If you are not feeling 100% health wise\, please refrain from joining any of our meetups\, until you are\.

2\. If you feel you are infected\. Please go and get your Covid Test\. If you test positive\, you are to remain away from any activities for 14 Days\, until you get a negative Covid Test and can provide proof of a negative test no more than 3 days of the actual date you are planning to attend an event\.

3\. If you are fully vaccinated\, then please be ready to show proof\, as our goal is to keep this group healthy\.

If you are not fully vaccinated, please wear a mask at all times while out on events.

Mask and Sanitizer is highly encouraged regardless of vaccination status. So be mindful and use your best judgment.

\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*
We believe in friendships and connections, over monetary gains; Thus, "ABSOLUTELY NO" membership fees or any fees what-so-ever is collected. You pay for what you do or get in this group, that's it.

High number of people in a group doesn't define a amazing group, but the people you meet in them does. That is why we are the most personal and active meetup group based here in Boston.

Parents, Professionals, Students, Talents, in-betweens are what make up this group, so I thrive to keep this group equal across the board. "NO ONE" is better than everyone. We are all Royalty in our own lives.

COMMUNICATION is KEY: In order to be a strong group, communication goes a long way. It is the foundation to any successful union.

If you can make an event. Say "I'm In"

If you cannot just say "I Can't"

Simple, right?

INACTIVE OR NON COMMUNICATIVE MEMBERS WILL BE REMOVED.

All in All we are a merry band of misfits, who love to have fun, make friends, network and just live life. If you feel the same way...welcome to the Royal Fam!

Lets hang!

Stay Wild Buddies
\- King Kori 😎🤟🏾🖤

name: Let’s Dance the Night Away!!
description:
Hi everyone, I’m Kim. I’m a fun-loving 40 something woman, and I love to dance. Music makes me happy!! 😁 I’m looking for like minded men and women of any age who simply enjoy music and dancing up a storm! I’m not looking to re-invent my 20’s, or pick up men every night, but just looking to get out, have a few drinks, let loose and have some fun for a few hours on a Friday or Saturday night. I don’t want to learn steps... I’m looking for more of a carefree, freestyle vibe.
I just went to Phoenix Landing a few weeks ago, and had a blast. I’m very familiar with the Boston/Cambridge bars and Breakaway in Danvers. I’m open to anywhere that music exists and dancing is encouraged 😆
Who’s in?

name: Entrepreneurship Connection | Workshops + Networking
description:
The Entrepreneurship Connection is dedicated to fostering a community feeling among entrepreneurs and professionals that provide services or money to them. Hosted by Ms. Hetal Shah, this group is dedicated to:

\- Discussing the essentials of starting and scaling your business
\- Connecting ambitious entrepreneurs with business resources and each other
\- Promoting startup companies in the United States

We host one free, professional networking event each Quarter from 6:00 PM - 7:30 PM.

We hold one Seminar per month on a Tuesday from 6:00 pm to 7:00 pm.

For more information about the host, please visit [www.hetalshah.net](www.hetalshah.net)

Ms. Hetal Shah was born in 1972. She has a bachelor's degree in engineering. She is an immigrant from Mumbai. She has lived in the Boston area for over 27 years.

name: Melanated Mindfulness
description: Welcome to Melanated Mindfulness! This group is for individuals who identify as Black, Indigenous, and people of a minority group who are interested in discussing aspects off everyday life and how we choose to react to them. Whether you are new to mindfulness or have been practicing for years, this group is for you. Join us for meditation, mindfulness exercises, discussions, and more, all while centering the experiences and perspectives of BIPOC individuals. Together, we will cultivate self-awareness, connect with our inner selves, and support each other on our journey towards healing and personal growth. Let's come together to prioritize our mental and emotional well-being as we navigate our unique experiences in the world. Along with monthly online workshops every first Thursday of the month, we will hold monthly in person meet ups at spaces in Boston.

node.title: Melanated Mindfulness - Meet and Greet, Thurs May 16th 2024, 07:00 PM

name: IGNITE:Singles (all ages) & Professionals Christian Ministry
description:
We are a group of Singles (of all ages) and Young Professionals defined by a stage of life. United in Christ, we strive to have depth, as well as authentic and vulnerable relationships with one another. Seeking to build a community of people deeply connected and with a unified purpose. To love the hurting, to serve the needy, and to be family to all! We strive to study the bible with any and all people interested in growing closer to, and learning more about Jesus.

**\*\*Many of our participants do not sign up on meetup, we typically have over 100 attendees at all of our events\*\***

We are a part of the Boston Church of Christ. We meet for Church at 10am every Sunday at:
75 Pleasant St. Arlington MA. 02476. Anyone is welcome, and we would love for you to join us!
We typically have an Ignite Event the Third Friday of every month. We would love everyone who is interested to join any/all events we have going on! Please message me if you have any questions. Looking forward to meeting you!

name: Somerville Social Speakeasy
description:
Are you the kind of person who enjoys mystery and intrigue so much that you'll sign up for events even when you don't have all of the details, as long as they sound fun? Do you like dressing up, either fancy or in costumes?

Do you enjoy making new social connections that bring you new energy?

Do underground parties, eccentric activities, hidden bars, or other offbeat places that few others know about, appeal to you?

**Join our group for sharing unique experiences and nights/days out.**

We believe in savoring life's moments, and so we’ll incorporate mindfulness into our adventures.

This group will go on urban adventures located at hidden gems in the area, or explore little-known features of well-known venues. We're working around the clock to find social activities with a maximum value of quirkiness and friendship. Don't go on another boring trip to that tourist trap or that axe throwing bar that everyone's heard about, again!

As a professional yoga and meditation instructor, I can’t wait to share my journey of helping people find inner peace in fun and unique ways. We aim to create a community where everyone feels welcome and can find new friends sharing the same passion for quirky adventures.

The kinds of people who will enjoy our social events are curious & passionate, look for authenticity in others, find themselves active in the Boston area social scene, and looking to laugh most days of the week, even if they have to make up national holidays themselves.

Show up to life!
\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-

This group is proudly part of Peace Out Ski + Wellness Club, a high-energy mindfulness and skiing club. We host unique yoga and meditation parties in the Boston area.

Still reading? Here’s a reflective prompt: What would the bar or restaurant of your dreams look like? What would be on the menu? What would it smell like? What kind of furniture would you have? What would it feel like walking in? Share your ideas with the group and let's create our dream spots together!

========

description:
Please note that with the (very) high monthly costs of meetup, I'm going to start migrate to Heylo to keep events free. Wanted to start here to reach a broader audience first. Here is the new link: https://heylo.group/vinoveritasboston
I'm sorry for any inconvenience!
Looking forward to meeting you all!

This is a new book club for people in their 20s and 30s, meeting downtown at a restaurant/bar or in East Boston at the club host’s apartment, depending on group preference. The aim is to learn, have fun, and engage in thoughtful conversations. We’ll explore a wide range of books across philosophy, history, science, psychology, physics, and more—all through an intellectually curious lens. Wine and other classy libations (alcoholic or not) are encouraged.

Inspired by the intellectual circles of mid-20th century—where philosophers, writers, and artists gathered in cafés to exchange ideas over drinks—this club is to recreate those vibes in 20th century fashion.

name: The LGBTQIA+ Talk to Strangers MeetUp
description:
Are you LGBTQIA+ and in the Greater Boston area? Do you wish you could have more of the kinds of conversations you have late at night where for some reason, you feel safe talking about the things you actually care about?

Then you'll probably be into this Meetup. We host events called Skip the Small Talks where we use question prompts designed based in psychology research to help strangers have meaningful conversations with each other.

Not feeling like answering a particular question? No worries, we'll have plenty to choose from, like, "When are you the happiest?" and, "If you were going to become close friends with me, what would I need to know about you?" We'll give you ground rules to make sure you feel comfortable and safe sharing as much of yourself as possible while still feeling in complete control of how much you divulge.

name: New England Stoics
description:
We are a community of people from different parts of New England all interested in the discussion and application of Stoic philosophy. Our meeting location rotates, primarily around the Boston metropolitan area, we meet as far an hour from the city as well as within its borders. Please direct any questions to Pete Fagella, the group founder.

If you notice the links below one of them is for our main page (not the Facebook link). From there you can sign up for our mailing list, scroll to the bottom of the page. We often use the list to bounce around ideas for new meeting, as well as general discussion for instances where we can't wait for a meeting to discuss our philosophical thoughts. Meetup tends to be the final stage of a meeting, after the location is decided.

**NOTE:** If you are looking for the NES Practice Class, you can join at this link: https://www.meetup.com/NESPracticeClass/

name: L.L.Bean Legacy Place Outing and Adventure Club
description: *If you love getting outdoors or are looking for a place to start, then this group is for you! Whether you're a beginner, seasoned expert, or anyone in between, all participants are welcome! We will be exploring all types of outdoor activities and meet like-minded individuals! The Greater Boston area isn't only an incredibly beautiful place, it's also a wonderful resource for outdoor recreation. Our mission is to introduce outdoor activities in a safe atmosphere to anyone who wants to try something new! All outings are led by our seasoned professionals. This group will host activities such as hiking and snowshoeing. Each outing is free of charge, so please bring your own gear. We also offer kayak, stand up paddleboarding, and archery courses and tours at a nominal cost at the Dedham Recreation Center in Dedham, MA during the warmer months (visit www.LLBeanOutdoors.com for our full schedule of offerings). We are looking forward to seeing you out there!*

name: Conservatarians
description:
This is a community for that underrated and underrepresented swath of the political spectrum falling roughly between conservative and libertarian. <br>

Mainly just a chance for like-minded people to meet in this vortex of blue-state politics known as Boston. <br>

We hold informal gatherings as well as discussions about political/social issues. We also have a 'book club' in which we discuss specific books as voted on by members. <br>

Although we don't have to agree on everything, there is a core set of values which we probably have in common...<br>

We are pro: <br>property rights <br>freedom of speech <br>gun rights <br>borders <br>traditionalism

We are anti: <br>Marxism/Communism/Socialism <br>taxation/spending (but muh roads!) <br>Federal Reserve & central banking<br>welfare state <br>warfare state & military interventionism <br>

<br> <br>

<br>

name: Memory Training Meetup
description:
This training is useful if you want to memorize more easily or want to keep your brain active and your mind sharper. It’s useful for: actors, seniors, students, singers, presenters, business people, hobbyists, the absent minded and others. You’ll be surprised at how well you can memorize anything of any type and length including: names, faces, numbers, languages (foreign and English), speeches, presentations, scripture, facts, data, songs, product information and course work. You’ll learn various methods including the historic “memory palace”. And you will discover that memorizing can be an easy, creative and enjoyable process.

This is what one recent student has to say: “A remarkably useful program. One of the best presentations of memory related material I have seen. Neil’s presentations were a pleasure to be at. The methods really work and are very well thought through and presented in a very entertaining way.” Dr. Mark Kon, Professor of Mathematics, Boston University

name: Cooking and Eating in Our 20s - 30s
description:
I love food. Cooking it, eating it, talking about it, reading about it, watching shows about it. But it seems rare that people in their 20s actually want to try out new restaurants and cook/bake at home.

This is a group for those who want to explore all forms of food Boston has to offer (restaurants, specialty stores, etc.), cook and bake for others, and meet new people in their 20s-30s who want to do the same!

We can go on themed food tours (cupcakes, French fries, tacos, ice cream, etc.), attempt to try as many things as possible on a menu, have a chili competition, food festivals, factory tours (Ben & Jerry's and Cabot's, anyone?) and more.

Feel free to suggest a meetup! Check out the recipe or cooking advice section under the discussions section. Food is a phenomena that brings people together and through that venue we can broaden our horizons, meet new people and have fun. That's what it's all about.

node.title: Berry picking on the North Shore

name: Tools for Decluttering, Personal Change & Goal Attainment
description:
Clearing our living spaces from blockages of physical stuff simultaneously frees up our time and energy.

If clutter weighs you down, making it hard to find things, disrupting your peace of mind and relationships, perhaps causing embarrassment - you need not be alone:  in fact, we are one of the Boston area's larger Meetup groups. We take proactive approaches to clearing all forms of clutter--as well as effecting other positive personal changes--sharing online tips and tricks, devising strategies and tactics, and finding buddies to partner with, as needed, to help implement our plans.

At meetings, we learn of new approaches and resources, celebrate successes, and plan for more - taking the opportunity to find "accountability buddies" to help us stay focused and committed between meetings.

In so doing, we improve our world one bit of space at a time--releasing what no longer serves us so we can enjoy the freedom to live life as we consciously choose!

name: Red Sox Natives
description:
Our 15th Year on Meetup!
Welcome to the Red Sox Natives, the home of die-hard fans of Red Sox Nation, Patriots Nation, Bruins, Celts, Revs and all New England sports! From Kenmore Square to around the world, we are the passionate Natives of the greatest fan nation in professional sports.
If you are a New England sports fan, welcome home.
Our love for our local teams and athletes is what unites us and provides the foundation for this group. We enjoy bringing new friends together for a wide range of fun group activities.
Join us and be a part of the restless (for another championship) Natives!

Please note that the Red Sox Natives Meetup group is a free-to-join, non-profit group on Meetup and has no affiliation with the Boston Red Sox, Red Sox Nation, or any other sports organization. While voluntary donations from members will be accepted to help offset meetup costs, there is no requirement to do so.

name: Chess Players Anonymous (CPA)
description:
Our new CPA Group @chess.com

Chess is awesome, learn it, play it!

Chess is an incredible game...but with all the smartphones, Xboxes, iPads, and iPods out there, it sometimes gets lost in the shuffle. In fact, games don't have to be played in high def or with high-tech controllers to be fully engaging. Chess is one of those games.

With a simple board and 32 pieces, chess continues to captivate amateurs and grandmasters alike. All you need is a basic knowledge of how the pieces move, a fair amount of concentration and insight and you have become a viable chess player.

CPA is about reenergizing our passion for chess and having lots of fun in the process.

CPA is meant to be an aggregation of chess players throughout the Boston/Cambridge throughout New England area who probably do many other things but still maintain a passion for chess.

On a bi-weekly basis, members will come together to challenge each other to friendly chess matches and conversation. Tournaments will be organized as membership allows.

name: Cambridge "Finer Things" Culture Club [20s-40s]
description:
[Featured in Meetup.com's Keep Connected Podcast](https://www.meetup.com/blog/episode-57-how-to-prioritize-fulfillment/)

Let's share in growth and learning on a deep level through cultural activities in the Boston area that explore **fine arts**, **history**, **philosophy** and **more**.

Hi, I’m Anthony and I just moved to this rich city to enjoy all it has to offer. It’s a great opportunity to grow on a deep level and moreover I hope to share these experiences with others.

**Let’s take part in some of the following types of activities:**

* Visit art and history museums
* Take a class on an interesting subject
* Read or research a particular topic and discuss in a cafe or hybrid
* Thoughtful conversations in a park or garden over a picnic
* Discuss life goals and how we can help achieve them

I believe in depth and high quality and aim to build a community around those who seek the same.

Additionally, as we mature, I aim to encourage creative activities centered around subjects that help us to do so. These can be great ways to learn a subject, express ourselves in doing so while creating in a collaborative way.

**We value:**

* Openness
* Aesthetics
* Personal Growth
* Inspired thought
* Creativity
* Responsibility of self and to others

**Conduct**

I am personally a huge supporter of the sovereign individual and that we may have many approaches to life, so I am very careful and thoughtful about any "rules" for a group. That said, here's what I have currently which I think are entirely minimal and fair.

*\* With regards to any current events/political conversations \**

I understand that in a group like this those kind of conversations come up. That said, I ask that whenever someone expresses a view point they consider the following:

* Assume that there is at least one person in the group who thinks differently from you
* That person has thoughtful come to their position (no matter how awful you think it is) and is coming from their own informed and good place
* That person would not feel attacked or marginalized for your expression

Of all of the "conduct" policies this is the most important one to me.

\* Spam \*

* This goes without saying but I'll remove anyone immediately who joins the meetup with the sole intention to post spam on discussion threads.

\* Using my personal contact \*

* Unfortunately this had to come up. But for convenience I have given out my number and it had been misused in one rare instance. If you have anyone's contact, please use it respectfully. A rare instance where I removed a member was receiving an inappropriate text at 4:30 am.

\* RSVP \*

* This isn't a hard "rule" but please do your best to update your RSVP if your plans change as soon as you can. I am good at a adapting and I respect that people's plans change but knowing what to expect as soon as possible helps me greatly.

**FAQs:**

* Did you get your name from that episode in "The Office"?
    * Yes
* Do I need to be knowledgeable in a particular subject matter?
    * Absolutely not! This is an opportunity to learn and grow together. That being said, if we're having a discussion as part of Book Club activity or something similar, I may provide suggested materials. I know time is limited so I will also start conversations with materials we can view or read together before diving deep into an event.
* Can I suggest an event?
    * Yes you may. That being said, I have particular goals with the group and may be very selective (hope you understand). I am focused on experiences that take time and dissection to appreciate. For this reason, while **I make no judgements, there will be no events related to Alcohol, Recreational Drugs or nudity - this includes things like Wine Tasting and Figure Drawing.**
* I RSVPed but I may not be able to attend
    * No reason to provide an explanation or anything, but please update your RSVP as soon as possible so that I can adapt accordingly. It helps planning greatly and is appreciated if you can do that a day or two prior and not last minute.
* What if I need to run late?
    * I'll do what I can to make that work, but I have noticed that it can be challenging to track others down if it's a museum meetup and sometime late members struggle in integrate as well. So I highly encourage you to arrive promptly if you can.
* Will events be online, in-person, hybrid?
    * I hope to build on personal connections and so I will aim for mostly in-person events. That being said, some events that lend themselves to a virtual setting may have an online component.
* For online/hybrid events, do I need to be part of The Greater Boston Area?
    * Nope! All are welcome!
* The club's name specifies Cambridge, will most in-person events be in Cambridge?
    * Not necessarily, though that is where I am currently living. I will try to facilitate a variety of events in the Greater Boston Area, in which all are welcome. To be honest the alliteration of Cambridge Culture Club (CCC) just rolled off the tongue for me :)

name: SoulFire Movement Tribe
description:
Join the SoulFire Movement Tribe! A community where we dance, sweat, meditate, and support each other on our wellness journeys. Whether you're a seasoned movement enthusiast or new to mindful exercise, all are welcome!

**ABOUT** **[SOULFIRE MOVEMENT:](https://soulfiremovement.com/)**[ ](https://soulfiremovement.com/)Established in 2020 amid the pandemic, SoulFire Movement originated in the confines of Michelle's backyard. In response to the widespread physical, mental, and financial challenges experienced by many, the initiative aimed to reinstate a sense of community safely during this transformative period. Recognizing the personal need for dance and the absence of social connections, the decision to launch SoulFire Movement emerged as a natural response.

**CLASS DESCRIPTION:** SoulFire Movement is an emotional wellness practice through dance movement. A high-energy full-body workout through the power of dance and a guided meditation using colors that incorporate authentic mind-set techniques to help you reach your full potential. Think Zen meets Zumba!
In this class, we bring awareness to our thoughts, feelings, and bodily sensations through the power of movement. We provide a fun diverse musical playlist that includes genres like Hip-Hop, R&B, Soca, Afrobeat, Pop, Salsa, and conscious high vibrational tunes. Get ready to experience dance moves from around the world and engage in a high-energy full-body workout that will leave you feeling strong and joyful.

**WHAT TO EXPECT:** Class begins with a high-energy movement segment that will get your heart pumping and your body moving. Afterward, we transition into a mild yogic-inspired stretch session, followed by a mini meditation to help you find inner peace and relaxation. Each class, we focus on one of the seven chakra energy centers. “wheels of light” or color therapy, as a guide to express gratitude for our bodies.

**INSTRUCTOR STYLE:** Her sick dance moves, coupled with a down-to-earth, approachable attitude, make her a brilliant instructor. When she leads, she dances with pure heart and soul. Though her classes are a butt-kicking dose of intensity and sweat, her contagious, joyful spirit will have you laughing and singing along the whole time. So let’s turn up & zen out!

**CLASS ITEMS:** Comfy workout shoes, yoga mat, towel, water and any meditative tool such as photo, crystals, incense, or tea. (Not required)

**ABOUT MICHELLE:** Michelle is a Dorchester resident, certified chakra & color therapy  practitioner and a community pioneer with 18+ years of dance & fitness experience with training as a 305 Fitness instructor. After becoming a mom of twins at 16 years-old, Life as she knew it, had other plans. This became a major deterrent in her dreams of leaving home and experiencing college life. However, amid life's challenges, dance became her anchor and saving grace. Making history as the first American International Dancehall Queen, she began a passion-driven commitment to making a positive impact in the city of Boston through dance. Michelle has performed alongside artists such as Mr. Vegas and Elephant Man and has worked with EDM DJ’s Pauly D, Aoki, Armin van Buuren and more. With a focus on emotional well-being through movement, and as the founder of SoulFire Movement, Michelle aims to uplift, motivate, and energize groups, individuals, and organizations interested in using dance to connect with themselves and others.

name: African Immigrant Wealth Builders
description:
African Immigrant Wealth Builders is a community for African immigrants who are passionate about achieving the American dream and attaining financial freedom. Our focus is on building long-term wealth through real estate investing, with a particular emphasis on the "buy and hold" strategy. Whether you're based in Boston, its surrounding areas, or anywhere across the U.S., this group offers valuable insights and connections for real estate investors.

This group welcomes both new and experienced investors looking to expand their knowledge and network. Each meeting will cover a different topic relevant to the "buy and hold" strategy, with open discussions tailored to address the unique questions and concerns of each attendee. Our supportive community is dedicated to helping you learn, grow, and succeed in building wealth through real estate.

At the end of this journey lies Financial Freedom—a place where your investments work for you, and you no longer need to work for your money. It’s the realization of the American Dream, the driving force behind why many of us came here in the first place!

name: BosOps - Technical Operations Meetup
description:
[https://bosops-slack-invite.onrender.com/](https://bosops-slack-invite.onrender.com/)

Welcome Boston Ops Folk,

Over the past few years many of us that work in technical operations (of some sort) have gotten together 1-on-1 for coffee or lunch or drinks. The discussions are always great because there is a lot of commonality and it’s great to hear how others are approaching similar problems of handling scale, building teams, and generally helping our respective companies grow. In fact, we always ask ourselves why don’t we all get together... So, welcome to BosOps.

The focus: It’s simple. This is an opportunity to meet, teach and learn from other local technology leaders who are primarily focused on -and responsible for- 24X7 technical operations of their companies.
There are no talks, no presentations.  Just a relaxed, casual networking event where you can meet other people in your community and share your experiences in building systems, scaling teams, and supporting the business.  
Join the daily conversations in our BosOps slack: [https://bosops-slack-invite.onrender.com/](https://bosops-slack-invite.onrender.com/)

name: Boricuas en Metro West - Puerto Ricans MetroWest 20-30-40s
description:
Wepa boricuas! This group's purpose is to connect Puerto Ricans in their 20's-30's that have moved to or are studying/working in the general Boston area. It is for people that were born or raised in the island (though you're free to rsvp with guests) and moved to the states to connect with one another. Así podemos continuar practicando nuestro español boricua y nuestros wepas. We can also help each other in any way we can, share interests, have some fun times, make new friends, network, or just explore the city. Hope we can all get something positive out of it! :)
We'll host social events and outdoor activities. Let me know if you want to be an organizer, or if you have ideas for new meetups! You can also choose to join the FB group for this Meetup group. Link below:
https://www.facebook.com/groups/boricuasenboston/

Members, if you're interested in becoming an assistant organizer, or even just an event organizer so you can post your own Meetups for the group, please feel free to let me know.
Ps. Please only request to be a member if you fall under the purpose/requirements of this group. \

-Feel free to make any small contributions to keep the group going.

name: Data Science for Online Learners
description:
Welcome! This meetup is to help further our skills in Data Science. I have taken numerous online classes and have always wanted to share my experiences with other online learners. I have used online forums and posted to threads, but I realized I wasn’t building a network around me.

There were also times when the process felt lonely and frustrating. Have you ever started a class online and run into an issue downloading the software that could be solved with someone glancing over your shoulder to help you? Ever wondered what other platforms are out there and if it’s worth your time and money? Wouldn't it be nice to get an opinion of someone you know that has taken classes for these topics?

In this meetup I plan to have events (online and in person) to share experiences, new technology, trends in the industry and find ways to bridge the gap between online learning and learning in a classroom. I hope you join and contribute to building this community of online learners in the Boston area, trying to improve and stay on top of the ever-changing field of Data Science!

node.title: Kickoff meeting for Boston Data Science Online Learners

name: Quincy Sahaja Meditation Meetup
description:
Sahaja Yoga Meditation is for everyone who desires to find his or her true self that is filled with peace, joy, and love. It is not just a set of exercises but a living science that will open up to you gradually as your meditations become deeper and your experiences stronger. 

Sahaja means ‘spontaneous’ while Yoga translates to ‘union’ and thus, Sahaja Yoga is a technique that helps us achieve the spontaneous union of our energy with the all-pervading energy. This union leads us to a state of meditation or thoughtless awareness. 

During the meditation classes, we will show you how to achieve this state of thoughtless awareness and continue to meditate at home. You will also learn about the subtle chakras and channels, and how they govern the physical, emotional, and mental aspects of your lives. 

Sahaja Yoga Meditation is practiced in over 100 countries, is always offered free of cost, and is open to everyone. Come, try it out! 

You can also preview Sahaja Yoga Meditation here: www.discoversahajayoga.org

You can check www.bostonmeditation.org for more events happening in Boston area.

For any questions, email us at: YogaMass@gmail.com

name: Jug Band Music in New England
description:
Interested in jug band music, early blues and jazz, home-made instruments? This meetup is for fans and musicians alike - a place to find out about what's happening in the vibrant world of jug band music here in the Northeast: performances by local jug bands, jug band jams, and festivals.

What's Jug Band music, you ask?
It’s rootsy, bluesy, jazzy, and fun! With roots from Appalachia, New Orleans, and Africa, jug band music started in the south (notably Louisville Kentucky and Memphis Tennessee) in the 1920’s and 30’s. Highly popular "back in the day", jug bands such as Gus Cannon’s Jug Stompers and the Memphis Jug Band incorporated a variety of conventional and home-made instruments (such as spoons, washtub bass, and washboard), and, of course, featured jug-blowing as a rhythmic backbone. Jug band music could have quietly slid into obscurity if not for a revival in the 1960’s by notable musicians such as John Sebastian, Jerry Garcia, Jim Kweskin, and Maria Muldaur. Today, the genre is alive and well, with several terrific bands playing right here in greater Boston and beyond.

name: Write the Docs New England
description:
[Write the Docs](https://www.writethedocs.org) is a global community of people who care about documentation. We consider everyone who cares about communication, documentation, and their users to be a member of our community. This can be programmers, tech writers, developer advocates, customer support, marketers, and anyone else who wants people to have great experiences with software. Write the Docs New England is for documentarians in the greater Boston area and beyond.

Our [Code of Conduct](https://www.writethedocs.org/code-of-conduct/) applies to all our community spaces.

**Want to receive reminders about our events?** Configure that in your Meetup.com account settings. You’ll need to enable a couple of options.

First, enable e-mail updates: Settings > E-mail Updates > Updates from Meetup > Messages.

Then, enable messages from this group, specifically:

1. Go to: Settings > E-mail Updates > Updates about your groups
2. Click the “Edit” link next to the group name.
3. Enable two options: New event announcements and Event reminders.

If you want the e-mail reminder to include an iCal link, enable Settings > E-mail Updates > Updates from Meetup > iCal Attachments.

If you want notifications on your phone or tablet, install the Meetup app on your mobile device and enable push notifications there.
