name: Single Mothers United
description:
I have formed this community of amazing women who happen to be Single Mothers primarily, but not exclusively, from Boston, Cambridge, Somerville, Medford and Malden.  This group is also open to non-single parents who appreciate & support our situation (relatives, mentors, teachers, adult children of single moms, babysitters, etc.).
This meetup is unique from most because it is a chance for families to not only get together at least once a month, but to really be a supportive resource to single mothers.  If your sitter bailed at the last minute, you would call another mother within our community to help you out & she, in return, could count on you to reciprocate, without $$$.  Or if you are without a vehicle, but need to go food shopping, another mom would be able to support you as well.
This group is definitely lots of fun.  We have Moms' Nite Out/In, cool outings with the kids, pampering days, themed playdates & so much more!  I have enrolled business associates, qualified sitters & male mentors, just to name a few, who have offered their support as well.
You will have love, support, a voice that will be heard and friendships that will last a lifetime!

name: Wedeln Ski and Outdoors Club
description:
Do you enjoy Skiing, Snowboarding, Hiking, Mountain Biking and making new friends? The Wedeln Ski and Outdoors Club offers an all-season ski house for its members. We are a not-for-profit organization, organized for and run by our members. Our philosophy has always been about having fun and meeting new people! We started as a ski club but we now enjoy many outdoor activities.

Current members reside all over New England. We enjoy events in the Boston / Worcester area or weekends up North in the Mt. Washington Valley area of NH. During the winter, we participate in snowboard races, ski races and social events with other groups in the area. During the summer, we hold organized weekends for paddlers, rock climbers, golfers, mountain bikers, and hikers. Come check out our photos from past events as they tell our story best.
Join our Meetup today to learn more about us, check out our fun events and meet our awesome members. Please note, Wedeln is a physical house up in North Conway NH that sleeps 70+ people. Joining this meetup facilitates coming up as a guest to the house, information on social events, etc. It does not get you a "key" to the house. Should you be interested in more information on how to get access or house membership, contact Tom for more information.

Guests and new memberships at The Wedeln Ski and Outdoors Club are **21+  only**.

node.title: Columbus Day Weekend!  Up at the house!

name: College Admissions Academy
description:
Popp & Associates, LLC, a college counseling firm in Wellesley, MA, is excited to host College Admissions Academy, which offers free and low-cost educational programming for parents, high school students and educators. We look forward to developing stronger connections with families and schools in the Boston community while providing valuable information regarding the college search and application processes, financial aid, and other topics of interest for adolescents and parents.

Programs will include discussion-based gatherings led by Mindy Popp, founder of Popp & Associates, seminars and workshops with industry experts, and more! We encourage attendees to bring questions and actively engage in our programs. Our goal is to foster candid and respectful dialogue and create a supportive community where participants can connect and learn from each other.

name: Full Spectrum Agency - Massachusetts Chapter
description:
This is the Massachusetts chapter of the Full Spectrum Agency Autistic Adults and is for any adult on the autism spectrum who is looking for an accepting and inclusive community of friends for socializing and peer support. The Massachusetts chapter will host both virtual and in-person events for Autistic Adults in Massachusetts. We meet monthly for a variety of events including social skills practice, peer support, educational trainings, and fun activities around the Boston area.

We are a chapter of the larger Full Spectrum Agency ([https://www.meetup.com/full-spectrum-agency-autistic-adults/](https://www.meetup.com/full-spectrum-agency-autistic-adults/)) and are also welcome to attend their virtual events. Members of the larger Full Spectrum Agency may sometimes attend virtual meetings of the Massachusetts chapter, as well.

Our group is led by autistic adults, for autistic adults. Everyone is welcome, regardless of diagnostic status or support needs. Nonverbal members are welcome. If you need a friend or caretaker to accompany you to meetups to help you communicate and interact with the group, you are welcome to do so. Members are welcome to sit in and listen to the conversation without sharing. We will offer you an opportunity to share, and you always have the right to pass.

Please note we are currently meeting on the Zoom platform. To learn more about using Zoom, please consult this guide: https://www.goucher.edu/learn/graduate-programs/distance-learning-resources/documents/student_documents/HowtoParticipateInAZoomMeeting.pdf

We hope you will join us! If you have any questions, please contact Christine Sunnerberg at christine@FullSpectrumASD.org.

name: Business Classes: Sales, Marketing, Global Biz
description:
We are a community dedicated to providing diverse entrepreneurs, small business owners, and organizational leaders access to expertise, tools, and resources they need to compete effectively in this fast-paced, technology-driven, global business environment.
We also have opportunities to learn about how to finance your business growth intelligently and with integrity.
Through educational events, we are dedicated to providing you with breakthroughs in the following:
1.     CONNECT: Gaining Networking Connections.
2.     COLLABORATE: Join a powerful network dedicated to connecting you with meaningful and profitable associations.  
3.     LEARN:
a.     Effectively marketing yourself
b.     Effectively networking
c.      Effective leadership development
d.     Effective Sales
e.     Growing and Scaling Your business
f.      AND MUCH MORE!
4.     GROW:
a.     Gain access to valuable resources (e.g. for financing your business through getting mentorships and critical guidance)

We host the following types of events:
a.     Educational and training events to learn what the best of us know – in how to build and grow a profitable business enterprise.
b.     Networking and Social Events to connect.
c.      And much more.
Please join our group ASAP!
See you soon
Dima Babenco, organizer graduate from Suffolk University one of the top Business School in Boston. He doubles majored in Marketing and Global Business. Strong supporter of good business ethics and good principles of work of conduct and creating the right work environment.
His volunteered at MIT working on Citizen Climate Lobby a by partisan bill that would cap and tax greenhouse gases. He had also Volunteer at ASPCA helping improve conditions and creat a business plan for the future.
He has also attended classes at Harvard University learning molecular science and has understanding of basic laws and principles how molecules and nano technology operates.
Operating and managing many business from Retail to Logistics in Boston, nationwide and globally lead hit to join this group to help individuals like you. 
Andrew Frazier, Organizer
Andrew Frazier founded Small Business Pro University to empower business owners with greater knowledge and enhanced skills to lead their companies more effectively.  Over the past 15 years, he has worked 1-on-1 with 100+ business owners and taught tens of thousands of people about business.  His experience includes serving as a Navy Officer, managing businesses, graduating from MIT, earning an MBA from NYU, and Achieving the CFA Designation has prepared him to accomplish his Mission of “Helping 1,000 business owners by 2025 to sell more, make more, and get financing when they need it.”  Andrew’s Vision is to “Create the Ultimate business ecosystem for entrepreneurs.”

name: Take Better Pictures - Non-Technical Photography Workshops
description:
Greetings Photographers! Please use your best email to sign up for this group or you will miss last minute announcements when there is a change in venue due to weather. 
This Boston based photography meetup offers workshops and classes that help you take your photos from like to LOVE.  If you are ready to learn how to take better photos, but you don't want to get bogged down with all the technical stuff, then you're going to love this group. WE are the most active photography meetup group in the Greater Boston Area with events nearly every weekend.
We are not just a fun social photo group, we are also serious about improving the quality of the photos by focusing on what matters most. How to use your camera, how to see more creatively, and how to use composition to make the most of every subject. 
Join us to have fun while photographing the beauty of your life. You will meet some great people, discover new areas of Boston off the beaten path, and gain confidence in your photography skills. Beginners and intermediate photographers welcome.  You can see more of my photography and instructor experience on my main website: [https://www.curioussoulphotos.com](https://www.curioussoulphotos.com)
“ Outstanding for broadening your photographic vision and discovering your specific strengths. Teaches the ingredients of creativity in a clarifying and actionable way. ”
— [Henry Gessau](https://www.meetup.com/TakeBetterPictures/members/12813018/) on Feb 18, 2018.
I’ve taken 8 photography workshops with Suzanne and learned a great deal at each one. Her planning is incredible. In addition to scouting the best places to photograph for the theme of the workshop, she provides such helpers as maps, example images and reminder cards outlining the key points. These cards allow us and encourage us to practice after the workshop is over. We are invited to post our images on the site and comment on each other’s work. She comments on each person’s endeavors as well. Her style of teaching involves getting to know each student (many of us are repeat students) and provide guidance as we shoot during the workshop. I feel I have really improved my skills due to her excellent teaching! (Did I mention how much fun we have?) Bonnie Greenberg on May 30 2018










![](https://secure.meetupstatic.com/photos/event/d/a/3/6/600_381775862.jpeg)




 This meetup group is for you if:

* You own a camera and you'd really like to use it more, but you're not really sure where to start and what to do. **Perhaps you are ready to take that camera off the auto setting so you have more creative options?**
    Maybe you've taken a photography workshop before or tried picking up one of those thick, boring books, but you quickly got **overwhelmed and overloaded with the technical stuff**. Or you have tried to learn online but found it difficult to apply what you learned out in the real world.
    You'd like to learn how to take better pictures of things you find interesting. That could be nature, people, landscape, architecture, etc. Whatever you feel drawn to. **We are a learning group and each class builds specific skills to improve your photography. You also receive constructive critique after class to help you get better and better.** If you are a life long learner, curious about photography you have found the right group. 
    I personally lead each workshop so you receive clear, simple instructions to quickly build your skills and creative confidence. I have a masters degree in education, worked at Polaroid for 15 years, and 20 years of experience training people to see creatively. **During each class you also receive handouts so you can practice the skills on your own. I am a master level instructor so know how to present content in a clear precise way that sticks with you.**
    You would like to explore related topics like creative photography and mindfulness? This unique approach encourages you to slow down, **take fewer photos of higher quality** by experiencing the beauty of your life.

![](https://secure.meetupstatic.com/photos/event/5/6/b/0/600_437662192.jpeg)
Which is better A. or B.  
And the best part? The techniques you'll learn will have an immediate impact on your photography. You'll see an instant improvement and you'll also have an opportunity to get positive and constructive feedback for your work in a supportive environment.

If that sounds good to you, then I invite you to join our group. You'll learn a lot, meet some warm and wonderful people, and have lots of fun while you improve your photography. I'm looking forward to meeting you in person soon.
All I ask is PLEASE INCLUDE A REAL PICTURE OF YOUR FACE for your profile description when you join us. I can't find you in a crowd when we meetup if you use a photo of your cat:) 
You can learn more about my background and philosophy at  [https://www.curioussoulphotos.com](https://www.curioussoulphotos.com)
[http://itunes.apple.com/us/book/flow-tography-better-photos/id499049037?mt=11&uo=4](http://itunes.apple.com/us/book/flow-tography-better-photos/id499049037?mt=11&uo=4) My book 
Welcome to the group!
Suzanne

name: Miscellaneous Mischief
description:
Like trying new things and meeting new people? Join us for miscellaneous mischief. We're up for anything, and are always looking for the next idea! Events will be held anywhere in the Greater Boston Area, so keep your eyes open to see what we come up with next! Please feel free to reach out to a coordinator, too if you have an idea for an event! (And yes, I did overuse exclamation points in this description. lol)

\*\*\*Fun fact: the icon for our group continues to evolve with the membership. We take your ideas from the entrance survey, update the word cloud, and voila! An up-to-date representation of the interests of the group! \*\*\*

This is a community to create opportunities to meet and connect with new people. Members are expected to remain courteous, respectful, and open minded. By joining this group you agree to:
1- be kind
2- be willing to try new things and share the best of yourself
3- no solicitation, spam, catfishing, or harassment
4- update your rsvp in a timely manner if your plans change. *(We have decided to have a 3 strikes policy with this. If you no-show 3 times, you will be removed from the group)*

The organizers reserve the right to remove any member who violates these agreements.

name: Boston PostgreSQL Users Group (BPUG)
description: The mission of this group is to provide networking and learning opportunities for PostgreSQL users located in the Boston area. We will have a series of speakers presenting on all facets of PostgreSQL.

name: Cambridge Game Night
description:
This meet-up hosts family-friendly board game nights for those in East Cambridge and beyond. The fact that it's an inclusive group made up of singles as well as parents (with kids) makes it unique in the Greater Boston area.


We meet at the Robert W. Healy Public Safety Facility in Cambridge, which is a short walk from the Red Line Kendall/MIT Station and the Green Line Lechmere Station.


We specialize in Euro-style tabletop games of medium complexity. We break into groups to play various strategy games (e.g. Dominion, Settlers of Catan, Avalon, Carcassone, Hanabi, Isle of Skye, Ticket to Ride, Code Names, Bonanza, etc.).


We also have some games that are more suitable for children (e.g. Dixit, Qwirkle, Candy Land, Schutes and Ladders, Dixit, Qwirkle, as well as card games like Go Fish, Dinosaur Memory, Crazy 8s, Old Maid, Animal Rummy, etc.)

Gaming enthusiasts of all ages are welcome to join.


Due to limited space, you must RSVP and inform us of how many people are in your party. For this reason, we ask that you be considerate of others by RSVP'ing only if you are likely to attend. This also allows us to alert you in the event that the meet-up is cancelled.

We welcome beginners and advanced players, and you are invited to bring your own favorite games as well.

name: New England K-12 STEM Outreach Volunteers
description:
This group is led by the Boston Society of Civil Engineers Section (BSCES) Outreach Committee, a group of volunteers who share a passion for engineering and education. Members of our group are STEM professionals/college students/educators from all over New England.

Our goal is to introduce kids to STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering, and Mathematics) professions including Civil Engineering, and encourage kids to appreciate the built and natural environments in which they live. 

We work with kids of all ages and backgrounds, inspire them through hands-on fun activities designed to open their minds.

Our volunteers organize a variety of competitions, events, Bridge Tours, a TV show, participate on STEM events and visit schools all around New England (see our website for details! https://www.bsces.org/outreach-advocacy/out...).

This program really is about helping kids. Their safety is our number one priority. We suggest volunteers complete a free child sexual abuse prevention training (https://www.fliptheswitchcampaign.org/).&nb...; The course is short, very informative, and eye opening! 

This group is both for volunteers and for educators looking for our assistance/programs.  We use this group to announce upcoming activities, post needs for volunteers, help schools find mentors, and a wide range of other volunteer networking efforts.  Please join us!

name: Gen Ai Office Hours
description:
Join us for a monthly discussion on specific challenges with rolling out your generative AI solutions. This will be conducted in an "Office Hours" format where group members assist each other in resolving day-to-day challenges of implementing Generative AI projects using popular advanced systems and tools.
Each session will start with a specific subject, such as:

* how to optimize your data files for inclusion in a RAG system
* data curation strategies
* cloud vs. local implementation
* using agents effectively
* data governance and security
* advanced processes and settings to improve response quality
* leveraging APIs
* comparison of results using popular tools, and input file formats
* taking advantage of context windows for rich input
* using multiple tools for robust solutions
* new model trends
    Much of each session will involve group members bringing their challenges to the group where we can collaboratively discuss solutions. Discussion of models and databases will be limited to how they can be leveraged for Retrieval Augmented Generation.
    Note that this meetup covers practical implementation issues using (sometimes advanced) Generative AI systems and tools. If your interested mostly in building models this is not your Meetup.

The remote meetings have limited space available. We ask that all participants be US-based. Onsite meetups will be conducted in the Boston, MA area.

name: Caribbean Professionals Meetup Group
description:
This is a social group for professionals from Caribbean countries who are interested in meeting like-minded people with similar cultural backgrounds. We will get together for a variety of activities - dining out, sightseeing, attending Boston events, and any other ideas that group members can think of!

______________________________________________________

A FEW THINGS TO REMEMBER:

a) In order to RSVP for events, you must have a clear photo of yourself. Members who try to RSVP to an event without a photo may be subject to removal from the group.

b) If you RSVP for an event and then realize that you cannot go, please change your RSVP to "no" or send a courtesy message to let us know that you cannot join. After two complete no-shows, you may be subject to removal from the group.

c) If you enjoy the group or if you think it is important to continue to have group like this available in our area, please consider contributing $1-$5 by chipping in on the group webpage.  

d) Feel free to suggest meetup ideas publicly on our page or by sending a private message to the organizer.

e) This group page is not intended for members to just "see" what events are happening in town and then go to the event on their own. If you RSVP please plan on meeting together with the group, even if it just briefly, and even so that we know that you didn't "no-show" to the event.

name: The Image Makers
description: Welcome to the Image Makers. Our mission is to cultivate a strong Boston fashion and art photography community through collaboration. Join other Boston area photographers, models, fashion designers, makeup artist stylist etc, to create photo shoots, attend workshops, networking, discussions, events, attend fashion and artistic photo shoots, and more! Whether you’re a seasoned professional, a newcomer, a student, or just love fashion and art photography; this group has much to offer and gain from you. Become a member and see what this fantastic group is all about!

name: Outdoor Activities & Conversations
description:
This Group was created **temporarily** as two paid Organizer subscriptions (rising recently to $300/yr. each) were being merged into one subscription. No activities planned for this group.
The **Walking Group** does walks on paved surfaces and light hikes in town forests Northwest of Boston. The **Exploring Group** does somewhat more ambitious hikes Northeast of Boston and may include an occasional bicycling or ski event. Both value social interaction and could end with a gathering at an eatery nearby.
You are encouraged to join either of these two groups if not already a member.

name: South Shore LGBT Seniors
description:
This group is operated by South Shore Elder Services, Inc. (6/2/24)

Saturday brunch program for LGBT older adults living in suburbs south of Boston and neighboring Massachusetts cities and towns. (For those living outside of this area, please search online for LGBT aging events happening in your local area.) Brunches are held in Weymouth, MA.

We offer networking and informational programs. Yes, we are all growing older and this is the place to network and navigate the older LGBT community. To share info or events with the group, all must be sent to Meetup group organizer for review. S/He will share appropriate and approved content with membership.

This is not a bar scene. In fact, those who use this site for individual meetups/hookups will be banned. Also, no group or public solicitation allowed. Any such posts will be deleted. Our events are alcohol- and drug-free.

Brunch is free to those 60+, with donation of $2 suggested. Under 60? $5 fee to eat with us. To learn about additional community programs for LGBT older adults, visit The LGBTQ+ Aging Project website at https://fenwayhealth.org/the-fenway-institute/lgbtqia-aging-project/programs-support-groups/

South Shore LGBT Seniors Monthly Meetup

name: EventHorizon Endurance Sport
description:
EventHorizon, endurance sport is an all FREE community of endurance enthusiasts of ALL levels. Many of us participate in the sport of triathlon (from sprint to Ironman) so we enjoy running and appreciate the beauty and benefits of all other types of self-propelled motion. The distinguishing benefit of this group is that it is organized by experienced AND Certified Multisport coaches living in the Boston area. There's no agenda or manifesto.  We meet up, train, socialize and that's it! EventHorizon is an official Ironman Triathlon club partner for 2013 which means awesome benefits!

We motivate each other and also want to try to have a purely social meetup at least monthly. Whether you just want to get in shape, you're a seasoned athlete, or you want to take a swing at open water swimming, your first full/half marathon, triathlon, or train for a century bike ride; this is the group for you!

Swimmers, cyclists, runners, triathletes, newbies and supporters are all welcome. The organizers seek to partner with Team EnVision, TIMIRCE, Charles River Wheelman (CRW) and other local endurance groups to have well attended meet ups of athletes of a full range of abilities. We have sponsors that were strategically chosen to help endurance enthusiasts mitigate the costs of new equipment, products and apparel.

The group also has a companion Forum that we use for interaction on related topics and a Facebook Fan Page. Subscribe for exclusive training content and networking with athletes. We also have a companion website with a myriad of training resources, videos, and links located at http://EventHorizon.Tv

name: AANE Adults
description:
Hi all. We wanted to inform you that we have been reviewing our programming and have decided to streamline our groups. As such, there are no immediate plans to continue offering the Science/Technology and Philosophy meetup events. We understand that this can be a difficult transition. Below are links to other AANE groups you can access. Don't hesitate to reach out if you have any questions and thanks for being a part of our community! 

* [Social groups](https://aane.org/services-programs/group-services/social-groups-activities/) such as D&D, Book Club, Creative Writing and more
* [Support groups](https://aane.org/services-programs/group-services/support-groups-community-connection/)


\~\~\~\~\~\~\~\~\~\~\~\~\~\~\~\~\~\~\~\~\~\~\~\~\~\~\~\~
**Are you an Autistic adult (diagnosed or not) who wants to meet other adults in our community? If so, please join our group!**
**We are currently offering Virtual Events. You are welcome to join the group no matter where you live.** 
**\*Please be aware that in order to attend an event, you need to RSVP for it after you join the meetup group\***

**FOR MEMBERS IN THE BOSTON AREA:**
**Feel free to join our [Outdoors Enthusiasts Club](https://www.meetup.com/meetup-group-aane-outdoorenthusiasts/)!**

\~\~\~\~\~\~\~\~\~\~\~\~\~\~\~\~\~\~\~\~\~\~\~\~\~\~\~\~
**The Association** **for Autism and Neurodiversity (AANE) helps Autistic and similarly Neurodivergent people build meaningful, connected lives.**
**We provide individuals, families, and professionals with education, community, and support in an inclusive atmosphere of validation and respect.**
**[www.aane.org](http://www.aane.org)**
**Please review the [Groups and Events FAQs](https://aane.org/faqs/codes-of-conduct/).**

name: Drums in the Park
description:
Free to join, new drum circle forming. Come be a part of it! My name is Lucian and I want to welcome you to a new drum circle forming in the Boston area. This activity is FREE to join, so bring your favorite percussion instruments and jam with us. The easiest way to start is with djembes and other hand drums. I will also have some shakers available. We will begin by meeting for about 2 hours (2 - 4 pm) on Saturdays in Torbert Macdonald Park in Medford, MA. This is in the Mystic River State Reservation. My thought is to meet by the "musical fence"; this is a location that is ripe for music-making. I don't yet have any extra drums for people to play on, but if you give me a little bit of notice, I could probably procure some. The goal of the group is to get some like-minded people together, maybe make some friends, and create some fantastic percussion music. Come as you are, bring a drum if you can; bring a chair and some water; wear sunblock. Let's jam!

A note about me: I have a degree in music education and I have studied many instruments. I love hand drumming, especially the djembe, and I have many ideas for drum beats that will be accessible for beginners and still exciting enough for the experts. I am available to teach the basics if you are new to drumming, but I am equally happy if you bring your own ideas and expertise. Let's make some music!

name: 20's & 30's Awesome Bostonians
description:
Hello, Awesome Bostonians!

Who are we? We are a group of 20 and 30-somethings looking for new friends, new adventures, and a renewed sense of fun. Live in Boston or in the area? We'd love to meet you!

What do we do? We go on tours, go to festivals, athletic events, wine tastings, concerts, hiking, trivia nights, happy hours and more! Suggestions for fun events are always recommended!

Some events have an associated fee, which is always stated in the event description.

New to the group? We want everyone to feel welcome!  If it's your first event with Young Bostonians, feel free to contact the organizer in advance or say hello upon arrival.  The attendees are usually a healthy mix of newcomers and regulars. Everyone is incredibly friendly!

Requirements:

All members must have a recent, clear photo of themselves to join and stay a member of Young Bostonians.  Please be sure that the picture is only of YOU!

Please RSVP for all the events you plan on attending, and update your RSVP if your attending status changes! 

All members must be welcoming of all races, religions, sexual orientation etc. Any and all discriminatory comments related will not be tolerated. Please contact an organizer if you have any issues.

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

DISCLAIMER:  During all events, everyone is responsible for themselves. The organizer, assistant organizers and event hosts are not responsible for the safety of the participants. We will try our best to prevent accidents, but are not responsible or liable if something happens to you. By being a member of the group, you fully acknowledge this.

node.title: Meet for happy hour drinks and half price food!

name: New England Science Fiction Association
description:
NESFA is one of the oldest SF clubs in the nation. The convention that NESFA runs, Boskone, is also one of the oldest in the country. The NESFA clubhouse is located at 504 Medford Street in Somerville.
NESFA hosts a variety of events at the clubhouse in the course of a month. All events at the clubhouse are free to anyone. You don't have to be a member and you do not have to join. All you have to do is open the door and walk in. Game Days, Game Nights, Media Days, Book Discussion Group, the Annual Picnic, the Halloween party, the Bah Humbug game day, and the general Wednesday night gathering are all free to attend. Details for each will be posted in each event listing.
Boskone runs in February, and it's one of the longest running SF conventions out there. Many famous authors attend each year, along with editors and publishers. There are discussion panels, nightly events, an art show, filkers, a dealer's room, and I personally run the game room.
NESFA is also the parent organization of NEGC (New England Gaming Convention). Two have run thus far. Both were 1-day gaming cons.
NESFA Press is the publishing wing of NESFA. NESFAns handle all aspects of the work, from the negotiations to the editing.
You'll see NESFA set up at the Boston Book Festival as well.
info@nesfa.org is the general email address for nesfa. You can also contact me at my email address. The web address is [www.nesfa.org](http://www.nesfa.org)  
To get to the clubhouse, you can take the 80 bus (drops you off a block away in either direction), and the 89 bus (drops you off on Broadway. Cross Broadway and go past the lights. NESFA will be on your right). There is a small lot in the back for cars (first come, first served) and metered parking on the street. I look forward to seeing you at the various events and thank you for taking the time to check out NESFA.

name: Writers in Recovery
description:
Do you like to write? Do you self-identify as being in recovery of any sort (from a substance, gambling, an eating disorder, sex/love addiction, trauma, debt, depression, bipolar, codependency, etc)? Our Writers in Recovery Meeting is an engaging, safe place for people to enhance their recoveries via creative writing and fellowship. In the meeting, we check-in, read a prompt, write on it, share what we’ve written, and connect with our peers.

This is not an AA meeting or a twelve-step fellowship; however, all are welcome who are interested in exploring the intersection of creative writing and recovery lifestyle. The groups are intended to be encouraging and supportive, using writing as a vehicle for self-reflection, self-expression, and human connection.

The group is completely free of cost and meets every Thursday (starting 1/7/2019) from 6:30-8:30 PM at Right Turn (440 Arsenal St in Watertown.) Enter through the main entrance on the side of the building (it says 440 Arsenal above the door). Go up the stairs, through the door and we meet in the Elvis Room (the door is labeled). Bring a journal and a writing implement. Feel free to bring any writing prompts as well!

RSVPing to this post is not necessary in order to attend, just show up! If you have any questions at all, please don’t hesitate to message the group organizer. Look forward to seeing you there!

UPDATE:  Until further notice, we are temporarily meeting only via teleconference, so until we can again arrange to meet in person in the metro west Boston area, please do both RSVP and message the group organizer to ask to be added to the teleconference group.

name: Higher Ed Technology Professionals
description:
Higher Ed Technology Professionals brings together CIOs, CTOs, CFOs, Chief Academic Officers / Provosts from colleges and universities of all sizes in the New England area for networking, exchange of information, and collaborations. We have found that many Higher Ed C-level professionals are looking to build bridges of collaboration across their institutions. We aim to facilitate and foster truly meaningful conversations that create collaborations among our Meetup community.

**ABOUT US**
Our group meets several times a year remotely, with in-person opportunities available, to share experiences and advice on projects, and to discuss the new trends, disruptions, and evolution of Higher Education technology.
We would be pleased to hear about your specific challenges and quest for solutions. We also welcome your suggestions for discussions and events, as well as your preferences in the meeting formats. Don't hesitate to contact us or submit them to our Meetup discussion forum!
*Note: Selling is not allowed during our events.*

**WHO WE ARE**
Our Meetup organizational team consists of:
**Nuno Couto**, Founder of Optimal Campus Consulting
**Dr. Elmore Alexander**, Dean Emeritus of the Ricciardi College of Business at Bridgewater State University
**Dr. Michael Ginzberg**, former Dean of Robert A. Foisie School of Business at Worcester Polytechnic Institute
**James Stoffel**, Director of Technology / Data Security Officer at Showa Boston Institute for Language & Culture
**Steve McDevitt**, Chief Information Officer at Saint Anselm College
**Marla Botelho**, Associate Director of Administrative Technology Services at Harvard
**Tom Goldrick**, Online Operations Manager at Optimal Campus Consulting

name: Urban Dining Adventures
description:
Urban Dining Adventures: Eating our way through the world, one plate at a time.

We’re urban dining enthusiasts who love exploring the world through the restaurants of our fair city.

Urban Dining Adventures is for chowhounds who love trying new places in good company. We’re all about fun, conversation and food. The majority of our events will be in Boston, Cambridge and Somerville. We'll also occasionally combine our meals with brisk urban walks, all the better to gear up the appetite and then work it all off...

If you consider yourself an epicurean gourmand, or a budding restaurant critic, Urban Dining Adventures may not be the best fit. But if you want to check out new places and meet new people, we'll look forward to seeing you!

A few administrative items:

Photo: Your Meetup profile must include a recognizable photo of you in order for you to attend our events. We know you love your grandma and your kitty, and we love ours, too, but their photo does not count as a photo of you.    

Cash: Unless stated otherwise in the event description, please plan on paying for your meal with cash. No credit cards, as the bistro math becomes way too complicated. In addition to your favorite 20s, please bring tens, fives, and perhaps even a few ones.  

RSVPs: Only RSVP yes if you mean “Yes”. If your plans change, keep your karma positive by updating your RSVP immediately. Our policy is "two No-Shows and you're out." If something unavoidable happens at the last minute, send us a message.

node.title: What's Pho got to do with it: Pho Countryside (Boston)

name: Ohana New England Dragon Boat
description:
Ohana means family, so we strive to nurture and bring out the best in all our paddlers.

Dragon boat paddling with Ohana New England (O.N.E.) allows you to meet new people while getting a great workout outdoors and getting the chance to travel and compete as part of a 22 person team!

**The best part is we provide all the equipment you will need. Just show up and you are ready to try. The first 3 Practices are FREE!**

You get the opportunity to paddle in the historic Boston Harbor as well as the scenic Charles River. All of our practice sites are located a 5-10 min walk from public transport. **[Location information!](https://www.meetup.com/Ohana-New-England-Dragon-Boat/pages/32569299/Location/)** 

All skill levels and ages are welcome as we have personalized coaching to help you reach your goals. We paddle together, we carry each other as O.N.E Dragonboat, and once you are in our boat you are part of our family.

**Covid policies:**

* We are a big dragon boat family. Let’s take care of each other and respect each other. If you know that you’re at risk or were exposed, please stay home until you test negative.
* If any community infection occurs, the club will shut down all activities for one week. Please keep in mind that you missing a few days is better than the entire club shutting down for one week.
* Masks are optional for those who are fully vaccinated and boosted. We will support your decision whether or not to wear a mask and will not tolerate any negative energy.
* Masks are required for those who are not vaccinated.

name: All About Prayer and Spirituality
description:
**Like a Spiritual Gym this is a place to come and exercise your spirituality.**
Like the Elvis Presley song lyric, A Little Less Talk a Little More Action, this Meetup is about praying together with other members. **For now, we will continue to Meetup on zoom**. In the future, when it is safer, we will add in person Meetups as well as zoom Meetups.
Prayer takes many forms.
Let’s explore them together!
I am in the process of scheduling future Meetups for this group. I would like you to be able to attend. **What days and times of day would you like to attend Meetups? Which of the following topics would you like to Meetup for?**
Silent Prayers for Missing Persons
Somatic Prayer (praying with different body positions)
Pray Your Way (share the way prayer works for you)
Pray for the Planet
Pray for Peace
Other
**Send Organizer Susan an email with your preferred dates, times, and topics. You may be the one to suggest a Meetup that will work well for both you and others. I look forward to seeing you at a Meetup soon. Stay Safe, Susan**
 
Here is the IANDS (International Association for Near-Death Studies) Neutrality Statement: IANDS members from around the world have diverse views on many topics. As an organization, IANDS is neutral and does not align itself with any particular social, religious, or political ideology. We promote respectful dialogue.
All About Prayer and Spirituality is a service of Greater Boston IANDS which is an IANDS Affiliated Group as well as an SAI (Spiritual Awakenings International) Affiliated Group.
[https://iands.org/](https://iands.org/)
[https://spiritualawakeningsinternational.org/](https://spiritualawakeningsinternational.org/)
[https://www.facebook.com/IANDSBoston](https://www.facebook.com/IANDSBoston)

name: Morningside Studio Jams/Events - Arlington/Cambridge/Belmont
description:
This meet up is for musicians and jazz fans as well. We already have a growing community of jazz players and listeners and I want to bring these groups of people together to get to know each other. There are two monthly jazz jam events hosted by Morningside Music Studio (www.morningsidemusicstudio.com) - one for vocalists and one for instrumentalists. I will also suggest meetups that are for local jazz concerts.

Both of these jams are great for jazz fan who just want to come and enjoy the music!

For Instrumentalists: 

The Morningside Open Jazz Jam happens once a month from 6:00-8:30 at Artlounge Arlington                      1346 Massachusetts Ave, Arlington, MA 02476   -   I will post a meetup for each event since the Sunday varies and we sometimes take a month off. 

There is a $6 cover and Artlounge serves beer, wine, and food. This jam is geared for instrumentalists. Keyboard, amps and drums are provided.

For Vocalists:

Singers are encouraged to come to our other monthly jam, Boston Jazz Singer Showcase at The Loading Dock in Belmont.  Come get backed by a pro rhythm section and sing at a cool venue in front of your peers! This is a great chance for the amateur vocalist to get experience a great band and also for the pro singer to keep their performing chops up and try out new material. This is not a set week each month. I will post a meetup when one is approaching. There is no cover and the food there is excellent!

Other Events:

There are workshops and masterclasses that occur at Morningside Music Studio in Arlington Center these vary in topic from jazz improvisation to Cuban percussion rhythms.  Morningside also offers weekly ensembles for adults in a variety of styles for anyone who is interested in getting more involved.

Boston Jazz Singer Showcase 8/11 at Ryles!

name: Charcuterie and Chill Mindfulness Group
description:
Hungry for inner peace? Let’s meditate while we feast!

Hi, I’m Alaska! I lead unique mindfulness/meditation events around the city. Join us for delicious gatherings featuring decadent cheeses, succulent steaks, potlucks, hotpot dinners, and cheese tastings. Come charcuterie and chill! I decided to make a group dedicated just to my events involving food since they’ve been so popular.

This group will host intimate, fun gatherings for chill, beginner-friendly evenings of meaningful relaxation and indulgence. Basically, we’ll be enjoying yummy food paired with mindfulness activities!

We’ll meet at my speakeasy/pirate ship-themed place in Somerville. As a yoga/meditation instructor, I use fun, relaxed methods to help people find inner peace.

My goal is for this to become a group where you'd actually hang out with people outside of the events too.

***

This group is part of Peace Out Ski + Wellness Club, a high-energy mindfulness and skiing club. We host unique yoga and meditation parties in the Boston area.

Still reading? Here’s a mindfulness prompt:

What do you want to remove from your life menu in the next 12 months? What would that taste like? Any condiments you’d like to go with your plate of nothing?

\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-
**FB group: Looking for ways to stay connected w/fun people in their 30s and 40s who value mindfulness and being active?**

I just made a brand new private Peace Out 30s and 40s mindfulness Facebook group - where you can connect with like-minded new friends! I'll be posting motivational quotes, fun themed costumes and mindfulness stuff, plus our upcoming yoga/meditation classes there :) Check it out here - [https://www.facebook.com/groups/1045183780505725](http://clicks.meetup.com/ls/click?upn=u001.NY3oBFzZ5LJDG7YcnfSAKu-2FXfTGw-2FvPXD7PPRLlSXtchIrY2eHTenBALLFxscd1-2FMAMGwI-2BGI8xvsNw7UlHQRg-3D-3D5uSm_xdUTvUhIjWlSJgufBblll4-2FcuaVca123SZLk5EUYKf9BYU9plMczE-2BisCz8YQYpOJfQ9riIO9e56TijOxQDg04vfiYN9xUOc7g0etBs7ii-2FyMU9mf4D6uu3MnBu-2FsLkXEmGB75xZFUznmlRSCzU1InogPiejiCkIePSLzKZBzY0TBzeocrMrb9faqUaJ2rhWxk9fNjYSurbC-2FK0vjKcQ0Oox3yKpezEyG-2FyC0T9c5C-2F-2FMU861IHbFinNIJ5ioLwp9VA0R-2Bt81FY5glQ1QXNZFxwYqnvCDlI1JP5-2BT3lMjcU0PmY3JvqU-2Fa5aa8wIFDNVRJZ6Z8QOVkZ1xT3ytAFyVw7TbHMZWWkq3oahT36oJhptFzAudXrURipAe0x7EoPFlfsiCV6UOX3GiZe2CyZkuwkYTNH4HcgAc-2BzQ4azNRcd9y0E7kXgzwbH-2Bf9iPZQFcab-2FsUzVlrROzoyc9-2BA0zBE23KKRqRCUFxlDAl9AtkjwLk4JJGeWWlTMP-2BQMOOgvuGs5sRtpcbaucq9RNKflwNwxOyt7WL-2BATlEW64z2iZP8tg033AeyOV1-2Bw0SQB21oXjskAx-2F9Ee1clOtCCO1gJV6JFdmD6hvGlozTO2nYcYTd1lMEVPU3kRGLZFbe-2BDwanimXlUfEgUgf2w69kciDXynwoXXu4TCNz5DU-2B8yDB0o4SdmTzKxNbh-2FzGnqfj6hfa)

name: The Write Story Creative Writing Community
description:
Welcome Writers \~ including Future Writers! \~

This is a Safe Space for writers to commune, an opportunity to share and express Your Writing and receive Intentional and Thoughtful Feedback via discourse.

You can consider this community a regularly-meeting Writers' Workshop group and, if you had interest, additionally an opportunity to network/collaborate with other writers or receive more formal feedback.

This space is for you if you:
-Are a claimed Writer!
-Would like to Be a Writer (we all have writers hiding somewhere within us!)
-Want to get feedback on anything you've written
-Want to hear your work read aloud
-Want to meet other creatives
-Enjoy community & discourse

A bit about me, I'm Chevahn - a creative writer and screenwriter. I've been in love with writing creatively since I was just three years old - I'd always sneak in little portions of fiction stories in the margins of my school notes. I received my English major with a Creative Writing concentration and during my senior year I took a few screenwriting courses that truly opened up my imagination to visual storytelling. I joined a wonderful and intimate cohort at Boston University and received my MFA in Film & Television - Screenwriting Concentration. Since, I've spent time mentoring & coaching writers through many forms, including as a Professor of Screenwriting at multiple universities in New England, an instructor of Creative Writing courses at the Muse Writers' Center, and owner of my consulting business, The Write Story Editorial. 

If you have a project or would like to start a project and want to receive one-on-one feedback through The Write Story Editorial, schedule a consult with me via email [chevahnthewriter@gmail.com]

https://linktr.ee/TheWriteStoryEditorial

I look forward to meeting You and Experiencing Your Work,
Chevahn

[Meetups will be both virtual and in person]

name: Date with Death Club
description:
Date with Death Club is an opportunity to explore mortality in community. Through educational discussions, conversation, and reflection, you will have space and support to learn, share, and deepen your own understanding of what death means to you and how you want to approach death — particularly your own.

Informed by spiritual sensibilities, DwDC has no specific religious dogma. The DwDC concept, branding, curriculum, and the slides we will use in the program were created by Karen G. Johnston, MSW, M.Div. To learn more about DwDC and Karen G. Johnston’s work, please see https://datewithdeathclub.com/

Date with Death Clubs are developing around the country - both online and in person. This DwDC is hosted by First Church in Jamaica Plain, Unitarian Universalist, located on the land of the Massachusett and Pawtucket peoples, currently known as the neighborhood of Jamaica Plain in the city of Boston.

Designed as a multi-session learning experience, DwDC invites participants to attend one, many, or all of the offered sessions. Each session has been developed with an intentional anti-oppression approach and with a strong pedagogical container to help create the necessary safe[r], brave[r] space for best exploration.

**DwDC is not a bereavement or grief support group. While it may be healing of the human condition, the nature of the DwDC is not specifically therapeutic.**

Sessions will take place online via Zoom, starting at 2:00 pm Eastern on select Sundays, and will typically run about 2.5 hours long. Sessions will be facilitated by First Church JP’s resident death doula, Minda Sanchez Jariwala, with support from Rev. Elizabeth Bukey Saunter. The Zoom link and other information will be sent to pre-registered participants prior to each session date. To register, click [here](https://app.smartsheet.com/b/form/fd6c4fb0167c4bc0836752309c9193b4).

All sessions are free of charge. Participants are welcome to make donations to the group sponsor -- [First Church in Jamaica Plain Unitarian Universalist](https://firstchurchjp.org/connection/donate/giving/) \-\- but donations are not required to participate\.

name: Young, Queer, Catholic Women
description:
INTENTION
To build spiritual community through contemplative exploration. There are active organizations for young Catholics, for queer Catholics, and for Catholic women – but no circle specifically for those of us who are all three. So let’s make the space, because we bring unique perspectives!

Since there are already progressive Catholic organizations that focus on liturgy and advocacy, this affirming community space will instead focus on the diverse, daily spiritual practices that grow our relationships with God. Gatherings may include such activities as:

Reading and discussing sacred texts
Taizé chant or similar circle singing
Labyrinth-walking
Centering prayer
Retreats
Volunteering
Going to mass together
Attending feminist theological gatherings

…and other Catholic spiritual practices that inspire us!

In the true spirit of a circle, all members will have opportunities to lead gatherings. The group is based in the greater Boston area. To be added to the gathering notification email list, contact YQCWofBoston@gmail.com or meetup message the organizer. You can also be in touch with YQCW across the globe by joining our Young Queer Catholic Women facebook group.

WHO WE ARE
As the title indicates, this group is intended for queer Catholic women, ages 21-40. You are also welcome if:
--you are a young adult Catholic who is trans/NB/GNC/etc.
--you are a young adult queer woman/gender minority of another denomination/faith who is interested in learning more about progressive Catholicism and engaging in interfaith dialogue

For the privacy of all members, the member profiles and meeting locations will only be visible to group members. The organizer will review each profile before a person is added to the group. Please include a recent photo of yourself with your profile.

HOLDING THE SPACE
Many women and queer Catholics understandably have difficult histories with their faith identity. However, the purpose of this group is not to focus on past pain, but rather to bear witness to each other’s spiritual journeys moving forward. We can create a new, positive, inclusive model of Catholicism. Please bring kind words, an open heart, and your best, whole self!

name: Massachusetts Mushroom Foragers
description:
Are you interested in finding cool things in nature? From plants, animals, and trees to fungi, there is an enormous amount of life in our forests that goes unseen by most. Would you like to learn about different fungi and plant species native to Northeastern America? YES! Well, join us for a walk in the woods with experienced foragers where we will learn about fungal and plant species identification, foraging skills, and maybe even take some choice edibles back home to cook! The goal of this group is to bring together like-minded individuals who share an interest in learning, exploring, and being outside with cool people. Anyone is welcome to join this group, no foraging experience or knowledge is required.

We will go on foraging walks in various locations surrounding the Boston area, most events will be held in Eastern Massachusetts, However we will also venture out to different locations periodically and go on some wilderness hikes in New Hampshire. During the walks we move at a slower pace to make sure we don't miss anything, and we do venture off the beaten path as most fungi are not directly on the trail (I recommend wearing longer socks!)

**What to Bring:**
-Clothes for the Weather
-Water and a Snack
-Foraging Basket/Vegetable Bags/Field Guide (Not Required, I will bring my own)
-Yourself and any interested friends!

**Rules:**
-Be respectful of the outdoors (Pack in and Pack out)
-Be respectful of group members
-Do not eat any plant or mushroom that you are not 100% sure of (Best to use multiple sources to ID)
-Have fun!

**About Me:**
My name is Darren and I have been foraging mushrooms for 4 years as a hobby. This is my most favorite hobby as you never know what cool looking thing you are going to find next, and you may even be rewarded with a tasty meal. I have helped lead foraging events with the Bay Staters for Natural Medicine - Definitely check them out->(https://www.baystatersnm.org/). You can find some of my coolest finds on my IG @massachusettsmushrooms

node.title: Learn to Forage Mushrooms and Plants in Walden Pond

name: The bAWSton User Group
description:
Meet others interested in all aspects of Amazon Web Services (AWS). Gather to discuss Development, Standards, Networks, Marketing, Promotion and Business opportunities using AWS. Our group is more technical, so we look for relevant topic matter, and stay away from sales presentations. This Meetup is open to anyone interested in learning more about Amazon Web Services!
**And now for some details...**
**Since the lockdown ...**
We've switched to zoom based meeting like everyone else.  We've been meeting alternate Thursdays since March 2020, with meetings starting at 5:30.  Our Twitter handle is Awsugboston.

**Upcoming Scheduled Meetups:** In general, we meet alternate Thursdays, from 5:30-7pm, with 5:30-5:50pm for socializing, and 6-7pm for presentations. Sometimes we do a single long presentation, other times we have several shorter (30-40 minute) presentations.  
**Attendance:** We usually have an attendance of approx. 30-60+ depending on location and topic - and we normally hold these Meetups in the Boston area - however, we are branching out to other areas/facilities. Our attendees are generally in the middle ground between novice and expert, with many in the dev/ops space. If an RSVP list is desired, this can be provided to the host sponsor, however, it ONLY includes the member's Meetup profile name (may not be their real name) and profile link - it does Not contain direct email contact info.
**Presentations:** If you wish to present, contact the Organizer (see below). Suggest a topic and an upcoming meeting(s) that you would be available to present. Then we will need an abstract of the presentation (title and descriptive info) and a bit about the presenter (brief bio, just a few words). We generally have 2-3 presentations/presenters per Meetup without repetition from recent past meetups. If 2 presentations, then these are usually 40min with Q&A. Usually the main sponsor is provided the choice of topic and presentation slot. Our attendees are looking for technical depth and NOT a sales pitch - so please keep this in mind when proposing and creating your presentation. Sometimes it is what you don't say that is important - for example, if you wanted to expose the need for your solution, you can point out all the Amazon-native methods of solving a problem, and in the presentation it becomes clear that an additional solution is needed. Again, we stay away from sales presentations.
It’s important that speakers speak loud and clear, in the event a PA system is not available. Also, when questions are asked, the presenter should repeat the question so that all can hear and understand the context of the answer.
**Presentation - Slides:** Usually there are requests for slides after a presentation. We request that presenters post a link to the slides used, as a comment in the applicable Meetup event page. Any comments go to the entire group of subscribers (who have notifications enabled).
**Sponsorship:** Sponsors have first dibs on presentations (which need to be AWS-centric and Not a product demo). Sponsors are provided time during the Meetup to address attendees. In general the sponsors arrange food/drink AND location - and this can be split up (co-sponsorship). The moderators of this Meetup group do not arrange or supply the meeting space.  We can always add an event to the calendar, so if you are interested in sponsorship, please reach out to the Organizer (see below). Special events are welcome.
**Sponsorship - Food/Drink:** We really appreciate our food sponsors and provide them extra time in self-promotion. Food and drink selection is up to the sponsor. Usually a mixed assortment of pizza and salad works well - but this is up to the sponsor. Pretty simple fare for this crowd - and usually no alcohol (but optional if the venue allows). **The food sponsor makes all the arrangements** \- including flatware\, napkins\, cups\, plates\, water\, condiments\, etc\. Food is consumed as people arrive and mingle around 6:30pm\, and we usually get started with the presentations by 7pm\. To help with arranging food\, here is a [link to ezCater](https://www.ezcater.com/raf/9190f46efd), which makes it easy to select a restaurant close to the venue, estimate the food required to support the 50-75 people, place the order online, and make the delivery arrangements. Expect to pay approx. $500 for food/drink.

**Sponsorship - Location:** We are open to a variety of locations. Minimum requirements include a facility that can host approx. 60 attendees, with projector and screen available. The only time we have needed amplification is when the meeting area has significant background noise (like certain climate control systems, or open environments where sound does not carry well). The facility should support groups who allow food and drink on premise. Please specify if alcohol is Not permitted, and/or if there are drinks/snacks or benefits that the facility supplies beyond the space hosting. Usually, attendance requires RSVP for security check-in (if required). Be aware that Meetup members do Not necessarily use their legal name in their profile. Any prerequisites need to be spelled out (like requiring attendees to sign an NDA, or updating their profile with their legal name). The host location sponsor is responsible for posting signage to make it very clear where attendees need to go for the meetup. Please supply any special instructions with regard to directions, parking, security check-in, etc. - these will be posted on the Meetup site.
Note: We have arranged with Amazon to use their Boston office several times a year. In general, these Meetups are reserved for sponsors who do Not have a facility to offer. If you require a facility, there are many locations throughout the Boston area, including places like [WeWork](http://wework.com), that can be contacted to help facilitate a meeting space.

**Sponsorship - Other Items:** There are other forms of sponsorship available, including supplying swag, offering door prizes for info cards being filled out, and covering the Meetup site hosting fees. Please reach out to the Organizer (see below) for further details and arrangements.
**Promotion of Other Events:** We receive many requests to post outside events, functions, positions, and other items to the Meetup group. Members have provided direct feedback that they do Not want any sales presentations or unrelated solicitations. So, we keep it simple, stay focused on the purpose of this Meetup, and provide opportunities for companies to sponsor or present, and make announcements during the Meetup. In addition, comments can be posted to any of the scheduled Meetup pages on the Meetup site. These comments go out to the entire membership (who have notifications enabled).
**Attendee List:** We are often asked about providing presenters and sponsors the attendee list. Unfortunately, many Meetup registrants use nicknames, and emails are not available. If an RSVP list is desired, this can be provided to the host sponsor, however, it ONLY includes the member's Meetup profile name (may not be their real name) and profile link - it does Not contain direct email contact info. However, presenters/sponsors can post to the Meetup site, commenting on the particular meeting page, which goes out to the entire group (who have notifications enabled). In the comments you can indicate follow-up contact info, offer slides, and drive response to another web link where more info can be gathered from attendees.

**What Next?** 
*Sponsors:* Identify a meetup date and reach out to the moderator with a description of your desired involvement, and any additional questions not answered above.
*Presenters:* Provide topic/abstract and indicate when you could be available to provide the presentation.

**Reaching the Meetup Group Organizer:** Brian Tarbox, briantarbox@gmail.com 
\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*
**AWS Boston Meetup Code of Conduct**




Our community is dedicated to providing an inclusive environment for everyone, regardless of gender, gender identity and expression, age, sexual orientation, disability, physical appearance, body size, race, ethnicity, religion (or lack thereof), or technology choices.
We do not tolerate harassment of participants in any form. Sexual language and imagery is not appropriate for any venue, including talks, workshops, parties, Slack and other online media. Participants violating these rules may be sanctioned or expelled at the discretion of the community organizers.
If you believe someone is violating the code of conduct, we ask that you report it by emailing BrianTarbox@gmail.com, contacting us at awsbostonmeetup.slack.com, or via the website.
All our speakers, attendees, and anyone else taking part in Boston AWS User Group activities are expected to familiarize themselves with these policies. While these policies are open to discussion and change over time, participation in the community implies that you are willing to abide by the policies in place at that time.
**AWS Community Code of Conduct**
Our community’s code of conduct (this document) is in addition to the [AWS Community Code of Conduct](https://aws.amazon.com/codesofconduct/), used by AWS communities like ours around the world. The two codes of conduct should generally align, but where they conflict please consider this document as authoritative.
**Long Version**
Respect yourself, and respect others. Be courteous to those around you. If someone indicates they would like to be left alone, let them be. Our event venues and online spaces may be shared with members of the public and employees of the venue; please be considerate to all patrons of these locations.
Here are some behaviors we’d like to see:
• be nice! 
• welcome newcomers into your circle of discussion.
• encourage current and new speakers by listening respectfully and asking relevant questions at the end of talks.
• help clean up at the end of an event.
• be considerate of others when entering and exiting the venue. There may be people working or neighbors sensitive to noise.
Here are some examples of behaviors which are not appropriate:
• offensive verbal or written remarks related to gender, sexual orientation, disability, physical appearance, body size, race or religion.
• sexual or violent images in public spaces (including presentation slides).
• deliberate intimidation.
stalking or following.
• unwanted photography or recording.
• sustained disruption of talks or other events.
• drunk or under the influence of illegal drugs at an event venue.
• inappropriate physical contact.
• unwelcome sexual attention.
• sexist, racist, or other exclusionary jokes.
• unwarranted exclusion from the community based on age, gender, sexual orientation, disability, physical appearance, body size, race, religion.
Community members asked to stop any inappropriate behavior are expected to comply immediately.
**Reporting**
Any time that you feel this code of conduct is being broken, or the conduct of speakers or attendees is distressing to you, you should always feel comfortable to report it, knowing that you will be taken seriously, and that it will be appropriately investigated and dealt with. There are a few different avenues for reporting.
Personally, to members of the organizing committee by emailing BrianTarbox@gmail.com,
Directly, either in person or on Slack to one of our organizers
Anonymously, at tbd. Anonymous reports will go to all members of the organizing committee.
All complaints made in any of these ways will remain confidential, be taken seriously, investigated, and dealt with appropriately.
Personal reports are always much better since there is only so much investigation that can be done without the ability to speak to the reporting party. When you report personally to any of the above people, please make sure you tell them if there is anyone specifically you do not want them to speak to about the issue. Normally the person you report to will discuss the report with other team members and/or the reporting mentors.
***What happens after you file a report?***
You will receive an email from the organizing committee acknowledging receipt of your report. The committee will meet to review the incident and determine:
• What happened.
• Whether this event constitutes a code of conduct violation.
• Who the bad actor was.
• Whether this is an ongoing situation, or if there is a threat to anyone’s physical safety.
If this is determined to be an ongoing incident or a threat to physical safety, the committee’s immediate priority will be to protect everyone involved. This means we may delay an “official” response until we believe that the situation has ended and that everyone is physically safe. Once the committee has a complete account of the events they will make a decision as to how to respond. Responses may include:
• Nothing (if we determine no violation occurred).
• A private reprimand from the committee to the individual(s) involved.
• A public reprimand.
• An imposed vacation (i.e. asking someone to “take a week off” from events or Slack).
• A permanent or temporary ban from some or all Melbourne AWS User Group spaces (events, Slack, etc.)
• A request for a public or private apology.
Unless they’re anonymous, we’ll respond to the person who filed the report with either a resolution or an explanation of why the situation is not yet resolved.
Once we’ve determined our final action, we’ll contact the original reporter (if we can) to let them know what action (if any) we’ll be taking. We’ll take into account feedback from the reporter on the appropriateness of our response, but we don’t guarantee we’ll act on it.
**Speakers**
Presentation material should be appropriate for people of all ages.
Any public presentation which is part of any event, including but not limited to presentations, lightning talks, recruiter/job position or other promotions, mailing list posts and forums, is subject to this code of conduct and thus may not contain:
• sexual or violent imagery.
• exclusionary language.
• insults or personal attacks.
Presenters are asked to avoid language which is not appropriate for an all-ages audience as much as possible.
If the subject matter of the presentation cannot be presented adequately without including language that could be considered offensive, this should be pointed out in advance, at the beginning of the talk and in the schedule.
If presenters are unsure whether their material is suitable, they are encouraged to show it to an organizer before their session.

name: Hiking with your dog for 30 40 50 somethings
description:
Dog hikes in and around the Boston area. 🐶 I've discovered, and am aware of, some beautiful state parks within 30 minutes drive of Waltham for 1-2 hour walks (2-3 miles).

I'm a professional who loves to hike with my labrador at weekends, and it's more fun to do that with other like minded folk! This is a sociable group, aimed at folk looking to make new friends, as well as hike.

NEED TO KNOWS:
\- Owning a dog is a prerequisite for becoming a member 
\- Needing to limit it to 6 humans and 6 doggos \(max\)\, otherwise it doesn't really work\.\.much longer explanation at the base\.
\- Only very friendly canines\, please don't put others at risk or discomfort
\- Dogs of all sizes welcome\.
\- You will be 100% liable for your dog
\- I am not a hiking expert\!
\- If you're uncomfortable at any point\, no judgement if you leave\- please be prepared for that\. 
\- Offensive or anti\-social behaviour \(dog or human\) is not tolerated\.

COME PREPARED!!!
● Water
● GPS mobile/device - in case you decide to leave early, please don't expect someone to escort you 🙏
● Bug spray
● Sun block
● Leash & poop bags!

Looking forward to meeting you!

Verity

Anyone with a doggo is extremely welcome to join this meetup group!!!
As the group has gotten a bit more popular, although we are trying to limit dogs and people to 6, I'm suggesting we have additional space for 2 guests per walk (first come, first serve - so please message me). Unfortunately we have to be strict on membership, where only someone who has a dog can join this group (or it turns into a walking group with just my dog which Defeats the purpose), so I've got to protect that rule. 
\*\*\*\*Please message me if you want to bring a guest in the future and hope we can accomodate!\*\*\*\*\*\*
Warmest thanks, Verity

Read less

name: Tiny Farms Network
description:
The purpose of this group is to bring together like-minded individuals who are interested in starting a tiny farm business at home or already have one and want to join and share their experiences with the rest of us. I don’t want to get ahead of myself, but I see this as a great opportunity to have industry professionals join in and answer questions that we all have about growing and marketing and business in general.

As I write this in September 2023, I am just thinking about my future tiny farm and collecting knowledge and bits and pieces to see this as a reality in my future. I know their other tiny farms in greater Boston but they’re hard to find on the Internet.

Here is my bit on what the group is about - thanks to Chat GPT for this amazing writeup.

\*\*Tiny Farm Network: Cultivating Small Wonders\*\*

Dive into the world of the Tiny Farm Network, where the charm of farming is ingeniously reimagined for urban spaces. Our community embraces passionate gardeners who transform overlooked nooks like garages, basements, and attics into lush, green sanctuaries. Even the tiniest plots of land come alive under the tender care of our dedicated members. It's not about the size, but the yield of one's passion and innovation.

Explore gardens flourishing with delicate microgreens, the earthy aroma of freshly sprouted mushrooms, and a plethora of other pint-sized plants and products. Whether you have an expansive backyard or just a windowsill, the Tiny Farm Network is your gateway to sustainable, urban farming. Join us and discover the joy of small business growing, no matter the scale.

\*\*Navigating the Green Frontier: Unity Amidst Competition\*\*

In the rapidly evolving landscape of urban farming, competition is fierce. Each gardener and cultivator brings to the table a unique blend of innovation, honed through trials, errors, and triumphs. Yet, as members of the Tiny Farm Network, we recognize an invaluable truth: while competition drives us to excel, collaboration propels us further. By pooling our collective knowledge, techniques, and discoveries, we not only stay ahead of industry trends but also fortify our shared mission. Together, we're not just competitors; we're pioneers, navigating the verdant frontier of sustainable growth. Sharing our expertise ensures that every tiny farm, no matter its size, thrives in this dynamic industry.

name: Chiltern Mountain Club - New England's LGBTQI+ outdoors club
description:
Our **[trips page](https://www.chiltern.org/trips?view=event&layout=list&controller=event&task=events)** lists a variety of events, including hiking, biking, canoeing, kayaking, camping, skiing, and many other outdoor-related activities club members are leading. Chiltern events are open to members and non-members alike, and activities range anywhere from an easy garden walk to a strenuous backpacking trip in the White Mountains.  We welcome people of all abilities and backgrounds, so there's no need to feel intimidated if you're new to an activity.

Chiltern is an all-volunteer group that strives to create a relaxed environment for people to experience the outdoors together and bond as a community.
\*\*\*

The purpose of this group is to create a safe space where queer folks can get outside, make friends, and have fun exploring what beautiful New England has to offer! If you identify as queer, gay, lesbian, bisexual, trans, questioning, or anything in between, please join us!

People of all skill levels are encouraged to join. We encourage all members to plan their own hikes, overnight trips, and other fun events and suggest them to the group. Please feel free to ask me if you need any help in planning or posting an event of your own.

You must read the trail descriptions and pass requirements thoroughly, understanding that they may not be complete. Please bring a little cash for a daily stamp for your car if need be. Please also bring enough water, snacks and warm clothing for yourself.

\*\*\*
Chiltern Mountain Club (CMC) was founded in 1978 by Sturgis Haskins.  At the time he lived in Boston.  He posted an ad in a local paper asking follow gay men and lesbians to join him for a hike up Mt. Wachusett in central Massachusetts.  Since then, the club grew into New England's largest and only gay and lesbian outdoor recreation club.

\*\*\*
**How to pay your dues.**
From your profile unique to **this** group in the left column, you can click on the "[$25.00/year](https://www.meetup.com/dues/Chiltern/checkout/)" link below the "Member Dues" to securely pay your dues online. You should have received an email from Meetup with instructions.

Alternatively, you can mail a check to PO Box 461, Danielson, CT 06239. We can manually update your dues expiration on Meetup once we receive payment. Please be aware that if we do not receive your check in time, Meetup may automatically remove you from the group for nonpayment. Simply rejoin and we will update you expiration manually.

name: SomEV Presents
description:
Greetings Electric Vehicle Enthusiasts!

Welcome to SomEV Presents! 

We're here to help spread electric vehicle literacy! This is a group for anyone that is interested in learning more about electric vehicles (EVs); e-bikes, electric scooters, electric mopeds, electric cars, and electric vehicle conversions. In this monthly series, we explore all things electric. The format ranges from lecture-style classes about EV technology, to hands-on meetups where attendees get to roll up their sleeves and work on an actual electric car! We cover everything from the components that make up electric vehicles, like batteries, motors, regenerative braking systems, etc., to the EV's themselves and the infrastructure that supports them.

All SomEV Presents events are completely free and open to the public. No prior knowledge of/experience with Electric Vehicles is required. Some events may have restrictions on the number of attendees due to space constraints, but all such information will be posted clearly on the meetup page in advance.

About SomEV, Inc.

We are SomEV: The Somerville Electric Vehicle Company. We are two battery-engineers-turned-electric-vehicle-makers with over a decade of experience working on various battery chemistries at the forefront of energy storage technology. From synthesizing the basic cathode powders for electrodes, all the way up through constructing fully-functioning battery packs and setting up production lines for commercial products; when it comes to batteries, we've done it all. With our unique insight into battery tech, we took a look at the current electric transportation industry and we asked ourselves, "What would it look like if you started with the battery, and designed a transportation system around that?"

From this single question, SomEV was born. For more information, please visit our website: www.som-ev.com

Part of our effort to change the electric vehicle industry involves giving back to the community; getting them involved early on and keeping them engaged along every step of the way. We want people to know more about electric vehicles and how they work. We want to hear what people have to say. And above all, we want to get people excited!  This is the motivation behind SomEV Presents.

If you're interested in hearing future updates about SomEV specifically, feel free to sign up for our mailing list here: www.som-ev.com/subscribe

Regards,

Reece

Organizer, SomEV Presents

City Organizer, Meetup-Boston

CTO, Co-founder | SomEV, Inc. | reece@som-ev.com
