name: New England Aces
description:
The New England Aces (NEA) is a group for asexual-spectrum (ace) and aromantic-spectrum (aro) individuals and allies that provides support in an open and affirming environment, builds community based on friendship and respect, and promotes awareness of ace and aro identities in the New England area through outreach, trainings, and collaboration with community partners.

NEA was formed in 2010 as a small Boston-based group and has since grown to more than 1,200 members throughout New England. In addition to hosting regular social and community-building events, NEA members have presented at conferences and workshops across the country and organized Boston’s first Asexual Awareness Week in October 2013.

NEA is committed to values of inclusivity, intersectionality, and social justice. We welcome members of diverse sexual orientations, gender identities, races, religions, nationalities, socioeconomic backgrounds, and abilities. Please read our safe space guidelines here: https://tinyurl.com/NEASafeSpaceGuidelines

For more information regarding asexuality, please see the [AVEN (Asexuality Visibility and Education Network)](http://www.asexuality.org) website.

See our Twitter, Facebook, or our website for information on events, meetups, and general asexy news:

* Website: [neaces.org](http://www.neaces.org)
* Twitter: [@newenglandaces](https://twitter.com/NewEnglandAces)
* Facebook Page: [New England Asexuals](https://www.facebook.com/newenglandaces/)

name: HOPE for Single Parents - Boston and Metrowest
description: This is a group to provide single parents with fun activities to help them rebuild their social lives following separation, divorce or the death of a spouse. This group also provides events and resources to give single parents support, education and guidance in all areas to help change the course of their and their children's lives. While the purpose of this group is centered around single parents, all are welcome to join! This group is for single parents as well as anyone looking to make a difference in the lives of single parents, including professionals and business owners who provide services relating to tax and legal issues, as well as health, wellness and family issues.

name: Healing Trauma, Partner or Childhood: Psychoeducation
description:
**CLICK "Read more" Below for LINKS to the best quality FREE content!**  
**Great FACEBOOK videos**! [https://www.facebook.com/NICABM/videos](https://www.facebook.com/NICABM/videos)
Shame is not deserved. Interesting: In this Meetup group, 65% of our members suffer "Relational Trauma" from a romantic partner. 35% are or have suffered "Developmental Trauma" from parent/s. Both fall under "Complex PTSD" (CPTSD). CPTSD is not yet an official diagnosis in the DSM (adding a diagnosis to the DSM takes many years - PTSD was not added until 1980). Many Meetup members are suffering both types of trauma, developmental trauma from their parents and then relationship trauma from their partner. Why? At least partially from SURVIVAL and FAMILIARITY. Our brains seek the safety of the familiar environments which can be the behaviors of the toxic parent we grew up with. The good news is there are treatment modalities that will help you get better (the sooner the better, trauma feelings get more ingrained over time)!
**THIS MEETUPS FORMAT:** I commonly present research-based PSYCHOEDUCATION sessions that can TRANSFORM YOUR LIFE by ENABLING you with the information, knowledge, and motivation to take action to start gaining control over your distress towards overcoming the trauma you may not realize you suffered. Learn why recovery can be hard and the steps available to prevent you from making the same mistakes again! "Toxic" generally includes narcissistic, borderline, antisocial personality disorders (psychopathy/sociopathy).
**THE NARCISSIST IN YOU LIFE book by Julie L. Hall c 2019 - about $14 on Amazon**. FREE SAMPLE!  This book is awesome and highly recommended because in its 300-pages it succinctly covers partners/parents/siblings in easy-to-read, research-based information. I have 58 books on personality disorder-related topics and this is 1 or the 2 BEST for most people. [https://play.google.com/books/reader?id=Aj6RDwAAQBAJ&hl=en_US&pg=GBS.PP1](https://play.google.com/books/reader?id=Aj6RDwAAQBAJ&hl=en_US&pg=GBS.PP1) 
**WHY IS THIS NOT CALLED A "SUPPORT GROUP"?** BALANCE. (1) "Talking about your abuse does play a role in your healing journey." (2) "Group members do not share details of their trauma histories; rather, they bond around ways they continue to suffer in the present from the trauma. They find commonality in understanding their symptoms, even as they learn new and more adaptive ways to manage their symptoms in the course of the group." (Judith Herman) (3) "...new experiences create new neural pathway activations in our brains. Trauma experiences and discussing your trauma is can be detrimental by reinforcing those unhealthy pathways." (Rhonda Freeman Ph.D.) Due to the reduced frequency and psychoeducation focus of this Meetup, we mostly follow (2) and (3) above.
**DISCLAIMER: All content is psychoeducational and does not include mental health therapy or advice. You should seek a licensed therapist before taking any action.**

***

**TESTIMONIAL** by a member who ended her relationship with a cohabitating partner of several years:  
"I went to my first meeting at a point in my life when I was struggling for closure after ending a relationship that had caused me tremendous emotional and physical pain. I had figured out that narcissism was involved but not much more. The resources, thoughtful analysis, and discussions that took place at this Meetup group were instrumental in helping me move forward. The organizer/leader does a superb job selecting topics, gathering and sharing resources, and running the meetings. For me, participating in this group has been life-changing."
**"What lies behind us and what lies before us are tiny matters compared to what lies within us." Ralph Waldo Emerson.**

***

**YOUTUBE CHANNELS** by Licensed Mental Health Professionals:
1.  **Dr. Ramani Durvasula (Ph.D.)** Narcissism and Narcissism Abuse  400,000 subscribers, 30 million views 
[https://www.youtube.com/user/DoctorRamanDurvasula/featured](https://www.youtube.com/user/DoctorRamanDurvasula/featured) 
[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=aHHWgG7dB6A](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=aHHWgG7dB6A)
2. **Ross Rosenburg, M.Ed**, Licensed Clinical Counselor, Codependent: 164,000 subscribers, 14 million views. Ross’s Codependency Cure™ work reformulates, redefines, & ultimately renames “codependency” to “Self-Love Deficit Disorder. ™" [https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC8OgfVyM8u5xhoHTJPa9sOQ](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC8OgfVyM8u5xhoHTJPa9sOQ)
GOOD BOOK: The Human Magnet Syndrome: The Codependent Narcissist Trap The Human Magnet Syndrome: The Codependent Narcissist Trap by Ross Rosenberg M.Ed. LCPC CADC CSAT, 2018, 4.5 stars $15 on Amazon 
3. **Dr. Sam Vaknin (Ph.D.)** & diagnosed with NPD: Could be the MOST CLINICALLY ACCURATE VIDEOS, he is brilliant and a leading authority and author on Narcissism (Sam actually has a narcissistic personality disorder) - 120,000 Subscribers 21 million views  620 videos to choose from for the specific topics you want.  [https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCLadFapyecCYAeuTqc12avA](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCLadFapyecCYAeuTqc12avA) 
4. **Dr. Daniel Fox (Ph.D.)**, TEACHES PROFESSIONALS ABOUT HEALING, 53,000 subscribers, 3.6 million views [https://www.youtube.com/user/lcruz71/videos](https://www.youtube.com/user/lcruz71/videos)

***

**A helpful vocabulary list and informative website** \- naming it helps you recognize it:  [https://outofthefog.website/traits](https://outofthefog.website/traits)

***

This Meetup's psychoeducation is only meant to start your recovery or supplement your **THERAPY which IS HIGHLY RECOMMENDED - because IT IS EFFECTIVE!**: According to respected Sandra L. Brown, MA, (30 years in this field) is the Director of the Institute for Relationship Harm Reduction that publishes the Safe Relationships Magazine (it is online).  90% of survivors have "aftermath" symptoms of trauma and 75% have Complex PTSD or PTSD - so it is very likely that you have trauma that is holding you back from enjoying life! There are several types of therapies that have been proven to work! You are lucky, you can recover and get healthy. Unfortunately, abusers with personality disorders are typically intractable (difficult to treat). Start today because untreated trauma gets worse!
Do you have these symptoms? The Institute’s 12 Aftermath Symptom Questionnaire ©
**The Institute’s 12 Aftermath Symptom Questionnaire** ©
1. Obsessive rumination
2. Grief and Depression
3. Intrusive thoughts/Flashbacks (of good and bad memories of the relationship)
4. Avoiding people/places/things that remind you of the relationship
5. Anxiety/Panic/Fight/Flight/Freeze/Fawn responses
6. Craving for the relationship even though it was harmful to you
7. Feel deprived of your attachment to your former partner
8. Acute, Chronic Stress Reactions, PTSD or Complex PTSD
9. Stress-Related Physical Illnesses
10\. Feel like you are on an emotional roller coaster
11. Decreased ability to focus and make decisions
12. Cognitive Dissonance (Conflicting belief system that the partner is good/or bad)
These symptoms are commonly referred to as ‘Aftermath’ symptoms and are the most identified forms of trauma associated with relationships with pathological partners who have Cluster B and/or Psychopathy. Sandra's one year program is $33 per month. (Unbiased recommendation, no affiliation or benefit to this Meetup Group.)
Sandra's research differentiates the types of trauma and each requires a different treatment to be effective:
\- 25% of survivors need treatment for their codependency traits of being overly compassionate\, thinking about others' problems\, anticipating their needs\, and making excuses for others \(learned during childhood\)\. Treatment is to resolve a feeling of worthlessness and being awful to themselves and doubt their intuition and worry they are not being flexible enough\.  
\- 75% of survivors need treatment for "Healing the Aftermath of the Pathological Love Relationship" and to learn how to prevent a repeat relationship by learning to guard their "super traits" of Agreeableness and Conscientiousness that narcissists target\. Also\, this profile often requires additional treatment for the cognitive dissonance pain caused by their gaslighting and the fact that you had essentially 2 relationships \- one with the abusers "good" Jekyll persona and another with the evil Hyde persona\. 
[https://pathologyedinstitute4rhr.com/courses/69/about?affiliate=a08588baf32c](https://pathologyedinstitute4rhr.com/courses/69/about?affiliate=a08588baf32c) 
1.  **Complex PTSD (CPTSD)** is typically from pernicious (slow, insidious) or repetitive trauma that includes child developmental trauma & abuse (often with insecure attachment too), child neglect, sex abuse, domestic violence, intimate partner coercive violence that affects our psyche and can take years for a full recovery. Treatment options include Component-Based therapy (Hopper 2019)
2. **PTSD trauma** is typically singular event and can often be treated successfully within months using psychodynamic group therapy, hypnotherapy, and flooding (Hopper 2019) 
3. Abused Women Syndrome - refers more to physical violence and requires a different treatment for that abuse and trauma harm.

***

**Finding a therapist to treat you individually** (NOT marriage therapy with a Narcissist - this will most likely cause you more anguish). The link below is excellent as most therapists advertise this database. You can plug in your zip code, and your medical/mental health insurance brand (and there is a law that requires your insurance provider to include mental health coverage). Then select your "Issue/s". Relevant option examples include Codependence, Trauma, Narcissism (your partner's), Domestic Abuse, Divorce, and Self-esteem. Don't succumb to thinking there is a stigma to therapy, take advantage, and consider it as treating yourself to a brain "spa"!. [https://www.psychologytoday.com/us/therapists](http://meet.meetup.com/ls/click?upn=yBf4llw5PeaY7leriFwBBppA9HJfa2cjPtquQHzGUdt4w-2BL1PSNA0ske0uDvasXSt2uZX-2FjgJXyIYnyPVi78Jw-3D-3DbNg-_t3CnO5Sfa57SRvv13a3A-2BrCTISlrEhxMU7Y4KSwBGsIHBE0xbdEa8kEnD6ymod2mS5dboHWP9WPjZspdN-2BPOm55AztWEp0SKG27kruTjQFs5x3-2Bb6RPBf0rBcabrGkNqMzCO4cERgZBuaPiMJ4LVv4Fpu0sCD6vrkiP0eVP2mSdB-2BJuz-2FyD3g974wKwqJEwLvLU8quP2OA0K-2BLo1mv-2FpLtMbnAaSiFtUSsyo-2FWwI4LN9AozwgQ7e4Le0LoAHwNfBmKCSxRwnq348hPaIBmYjhg-3D-3D)
Requirements and priorities of a GOOD match therapist for YOU: You feel listened to, safe, and that they really care about you. They answer your questions without being defensive. Do they come across as professional and only share information about themselves that is relevant to helping you. For more ideas, watch Ross Rosenberg's therapist litmus test: [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=90ik1hzX0xs](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=90ik1hzX0xs)

***

**CAUTION: Never tell anyone that you think they are a narcissist**, have narcissistic traits, or have a narcissistic personality disorder. Also, don't tell other people that you think this either (except your 1 or 2 closest friends or family members). Somewhat surprisingly, it is hard to convince/educate people about the very real damage that narcissists cause; even with evidence - "Until people experience the harm, it's hard for them to comprehend it, especially when they have only experienced the narcissist as charming."  Narcissists have needed to learn how to be charming (even though, as you know, it is only superficial) and are only abusive to those close to them, so they have likely only experienced their charm or normalcy. 
Especially resist using any labels with any professionals you encounter! Although using this label gets people's attention, a psychological phenomenon called "SPONTANEOUS TRAIT ATTRIBUTION" happens, which causes nearly all people to think that YOU are the trait label you used! Therefore they will view YOU 
This "NOT LABELLING" people guidance also applies to all other personality disorders such as Borderline Personality Disorder and Antisocial Personality Disorder (known as a psychopath). Even though people with these disorders can be harmful to you and others and you need to protect yourself. You should still be respectful and have compassion for them, they did not choose to have this mental illness, likely were victims of trauma in their childhood (that only specialist professionals can treat, do not try yourself - establish strict boundaries instead).  (Note: While someone who is afflicted with a "Bi-Polar disorder" is NOT destructive to others like personality disorders can be and Bi-Polar disorder can be successfully regulated with commonly prescribed medications and talk therapy.)

***

**VIDEO: Dr. Ramini: "The Empath and the Narcissist: a Dark Fairy Tale"** As Dr. Ramini says, her story also applies to reversed gender roles. If you are the adult child of a toxic parent, you could easily have developed to be an "empath" or "codependent" personality style (common, but not official clinical terms).    [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BMXx5VlrMog](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BMXx5VlrMog)

***

**Note: We all have some mild narcissistic traits throughout our lives.**  Narcissism is a valuable part of normal child and adolescent development. However, when the traits continue into early adulthood, and a qualified clinician identifies them as having 5 of the 9 criteria in the DSM-5, then the clinician may be diagnosed with "Narcissistic Personality Disorder" (NPD). Labels like NPD are useful for training and understanding, but since in the case of Narcissism it has severely negative interpersonal behavior connotations, are regarded and intractable to treat, so many clinicians are reluctant to give this diagnosis.

***

**SUGGESTED TALKING POINTS when explaining your situation to family and friends** (I used a placeholder "he" (could also be a "she") and "XXXX"):
"My mind and body are hurting and I've finally realized that it's mainly due to how I've allowed myself to be lied to, controlled, manipulated, and exploited by XXXX. He has suffered in his life and now I've realized that he has a psychological issue that is driving him to be verbally and emotionally abusive to me. I've read articles on the web that describe why he is so negative, hostile, and always putting people close to them down.  In public with you and with most people, he does a great job of being charming and normal, that's part of what attracted me to him, but I now have realized that it is all a mask. I'm recognizing how he has exploited me and many other people, he feels entitled, uncaring, and yet he always describes himself as a victim... after I read about it, his traits fit this problematic profile in many ways." 
"Despite all this, I still feel compassion for XXXX because the research explains how common it is for the trauma he suffered from his parents and family often results in this abusive form of behavior as an adult. These traumas don't affect a person's intelligence and it actually increases their ability to be charming, and successful. To describe their lack of being able to relate to others, one doctor uses a movie metaphor, that people like XXXX experience the world as if he/she is an actor and also direct all the other actors in a movie, and they become violent when the actors don't act as they direct them, which is to always meet their needs for admiration and to be served.  I've learned that unfortunately for them and us, these conditions are very resistant to change, so I need to protect myself and our children from him."  
"Part of my journey back to health includes not allowing myself to be isolated so thank you for letting me share this with you. I appreciate your friendship as I work to figure out what to do next." 
_______________________________________________________________________________________________________________________ 
BOOK 1: Top selling and 4.5 rated: "Healing from Hidden Abuse: A Journey Through the Stages of Recovery from Psychological Abuse" c 2016 by Shannon Thomas LCSW 
CUT and PASTE:  Thomas has written a blog that you can read and then cut and paste it as a letter: FAMILY AND FRIENDS: YOUR LOVED ONE ISN’T CRAZY:
[https://southlakecounseling.org/family-and-friends-your-loved-one-isnt-crazy/](https://southlakecounseling.org/family-and-friends-your-loved-one-isnt-crazy/)
_______________________________________________________________________________________________________________________ 
BOOK 2: Top selling and 5.0 rated: "Whole Again: Healing Your Heart and Rediscovering Your True Self After Toxic Relationships and Emotional Abuse" c 2019 by Jackson MacKenzie (he also authored the best-selling "Psychopath Free Recovering from Emotionally Abusive Relationships With Narcissists, Sociopaths, and Other Toxic People" c 2015
BOOK 3: Top Selling and 5.0 rated:  "Healing the Adult Children of Narcissists: Essays on The Invisible War Zone and Exercises for Recovery"  c 2019  by Shahida Arabi

***

**Should you also join this related Meetup Group: "Parental Alienation"?**  You do if you fit either of these 2 situations:  
A. You do NOT have contact with one of your parents because you are convinced they were/are: 
1\. Unsafe\, 2\. Uncaring\, 3\. Unavailable 
B. Your relationship with your children has been undermined by your ex-partner/co-parent. They have restricted your access to your children resulting in them becoming cold or rejecting you.  
If so, you may be a victim of "Parental Alienation", a rather common phenomenon...but with a low awareness of the term. Brian has been running a support group for this for over 3 years...use this link and be sure to check out the YouTube video links in the "About" tab of this meetup group (which you can see even without yet becoming a member.) [https://www.meetup.com/Bostons-Alienated-Parents-Meetup/](https://www.meetup.com/Bostons-Alienated-Parents-Meetup/)

***

**NARCISSISTIC ABUSE HEALING SUPPORT GROUP INFORMATION:**
SYMPTOMS OF CODEPENDENCY By [Darlene Lancer, JD, MFT](https://psychcentral.com/lib/author/darlene-lancer/)  8 Oct 2018  [https://psychcentral.com/lib/symptoms-of-codependency/](https://psychcentral.com/lib/symptoms-of-codependency/)
Codependency is characterized by a person belonging to a dysfunctional, one-sided relationship where one person relies on the other for meeting nearly all of their emotional and self-esteem needs. It also describes a relationship that enables another person to maintain their irresponsible, addictive, or underachieving behavior.
The term *codependency* has been around for decades. Although it originally applied to spouses of alcoholics (first called co-alcoholics), researchers revealed that the characteristics of codependents were much more prevalent in the general population than had previously imagined. In fact, they found that if you were raised in a dysfunctional family or had an ill parent, you could also be codependent.
Researchers also found that codependent symptoms got worse if left untreated. The good news is that they’re reversible.
SYMPTOMS OF CODEPENDENCY  The following is a list of symptoms of codependency and being in a codependent relationship. You don’t need to have them all to qualify as codependent.
§ **Low self-esteem.** Feeling that you’re not good enough or comparing yourself to others. Hidden from consciousness, are feelings of shame, guilt, and perfectionism
§ **People-pleasing.** Saying “No” causes them [anxiety](https://psychcentral.com/anxiety/). Some codependents They go out of their way and sacrifice their own needs to accommodate other people.
§ \*\*Poor boundaries.\*\*Boundaries that are weak or blurry your feelings, thoughts, and needs plus your body, money, and belongings. 
§ **Reactivity.** If someone says something you disagree with, you either believe it or become defensive.
§ **Caretaking.** If someone else has a problem, you want to help them to the point that you give up yourself. It’s natural to feel empathy but codependents need to help others and might feel rejected if another person doesn’t want help.
§ **Control.** Control helps codependents feel safe and secure. Sometimes they have an addiction that either helps them loosen up, like alcoholism, or helps them hold their feelings down, like workaholism so that they don’t feel out of control. People-pleasing and care-taking can be used to control and manipulate people. Alternatively, codependents are bossy and tell you what you should or shouldn’t do. This is a violation of someone else’s boundary.
§ **Dysfunctional communication.** Codependents have trouble when it comes to communicating their thoughts, feelings, and needs. Instead of saying, “I don’t like that,” you might pretend that it’s okay or tell someone what to do.
§ **Obsessions.** Codependents have a tendency to spend their time thinking about other people or relationships. This is caused by their dependency and anxieties and fears.
§ **Dependency.** Codependents need other people to like them to feel okay about themselves. They’re afraid of being rejected or abandoned, even if they can function on their own. Others need always to be in a relationship because they feel depressed or lonely when they’re by themselves for too long. This trait makes it hard for them to end a relationship, even when the relationship is painful or abusive. They end up feeling trapped.
§ **Denial.** One of the problems people face in getting help for codependency is that they’re in denial about it, meaning that they don’t face their problem. Usually, they think the problem is someone else or the situation.  Codependents also deny their feelings and needs. They might be in denial of their need for space and autonomy. Although some codependents seem needy, others act like they’re self-sufficient when it comes to needing help. They won’t reach out and have trouble receiving. They are in denial of their vulnerability and need for love and intimacy.
§ **Problems with intimacy.** By this, I’m not referring to sex, although sexual dysfunction often is a reflection of an intimacy problem. I’m talking about being open and close with someone in an intimate relationship. Because of the shame and weak boundaries, you might fear that you’ll be judged, rejected, or left.
§ **Painful emotions.** Codependency creates stress and leads to painful emotions. Shame and low self-esteem create anxiety and fear about being judged, rejected or abandoned; making mistakes; being a failure; feeling trapped by being close or being alone. The other symptoms lead to feelings of anger and resentment, [depression](https://psychcentral.com/depression/), hopelessness, and despair. When the feelings are too much, you can feel numb.
There is help for recovery and change for people who are codependent. The first step is getting guidance and support. These symptoms are deeply ingrained habits and difficult to identify and change on your own. Work on becoming more assertive and building your self-esteem.

***

**How do you spot a narcissist?**  (Source: Adapted from Bill Eddy, LICSW & Attorney)
The "WEB" Method: Their WORDS, Your Emotions (Gut Feeling), Their Actions:
**A. THEIR WORDS:**
1. Do they often speak about others either disparagingly and only occasionally positively (and then its extra positive and not often in the middle)? 
2. Do they always turn the conversation back to themselves, and looked bored when you are talking? (The 
3. Are they perpetually describing themselves as a victim in many ways while also referring to themselves as superior? 
**B. YOUR EMOTIONS (you gut feelings):**
1. How do they make you feel? Don't ignore your gut feelings. 
2. Too good to be true - it likely is. 
3. Do you feel stupid, inadequate, and like you can't breathe?
**C. THEIR BEHAVIOR:** 
1.  Take notice of what they do, more than what they say (the words are a distraction from their bad behavior).
2. Do they disregard your requests? (This is because they like winning relationships, not having relationships).
3. When they mess up, do they blame you? This is called projection. (They are always a victim.)
4. They always defend themselves, including writing long email rants and engaging in social media meltdowns.
5. The 90% rule. Do they do something (or many things) that 90% of people would NEVER do?  Examples could include humiliating a partner or child in public, sabotaging someone, verbally attacking a colleague or employee in a meeting, etc. 
**Additional ways to identify a narcissist (compiled from multiple sources):** 
6. Be wary of someone who doesn't have many active long-term friendships. Determine if there is dysfunction in their family. Family estrangements could be the result of narcissism (which leaves a wake of destruction for all people close to them).  
7. Tell them you don't want to do something they want to do. A narcissist will often react with significant discomfort or even worse - an angry outburst. (They view you as an object and are insulted that you are in control in any way.)
8. Ask them, "In what areas of your life or character would you like to improve?" and observe their baffled expression - narcissists think they are perfect and will only refer to something that is external to themselves.
9\. Tell them that they did something wrong and you want an apology \- narcissists are very resistant to apologizing \(and if they do\, it is empty and they will do the same thing again\)\.
________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________ 
The problems with much NARCISSISTIC ABUSE & HEALING YouTube videos:
1. They are by coaches that don;t have formal education or training on the important, foundations of treating trauma and mental health issues
2. They focus too much on describing narcissist behavior and not enough on "what to do", too many videos are used to simply describe how narcissists behave (and they are very interesting), but...to actually get better, you then need to move to solutions such as establishing boundaries and often going no contact. 
**YouTube speed trick to SAVE TIME!** You can listen to most videos faster using YouTube's 1.5x to 2x setting. You can still comprehend the material (even while driving). (On average we speak 150 words per minute yet our average listening/processing capability 3x that — 450 words!) To reach the "settings" YouTube videos have 3 dots in the upper right that opens the playback speed options.  
______________________________________________________________________________________________________________________ 
**Helpful blog site, "We Have Kids" Example Article: "How a Parent's Narcissistic Personality Disorder Affects Their Child"** By Mental Health Professionals  Updated on January 18, 2018: 
[https://wehavekids.com/family-relationships/The-Child-Victim-of-a-Narcissistic-Personality-Disordered-Parent](https://wehavekids.com/family-relationships/The-Child-Victim-of-a-Narcissistic-Personality-Disordered-Parent) 
Narcissistic Personality Disorder (NPD). (They have more of these traits and more severely then what we all occasionally have a bit of.) In bold are the behaviors that negatively affect others (vs themselves and vs just being annoying). 
1\. They are emotionally vacant due to childhood abuse\, they can only act out on their false sense of their entitled self\, they misperceive everything as an attack so they strike first 
2\. Emotionally restricted to negativity; angry\, hostile\, vindictive\, aggressive\, and some are violent
3\. Self\-centered\, view people as objects to be exploited\, entitled to lie\-cheat\-steal\, manipulative\, they have to win\, and some are grandiose
4\. They are always the victims\, it's never their fault\, rather it's your fault that caused them to do bad things 
5\. Superficial and lacking empathy \(the ability to understand how others feel\)\, calm\, cool\, charming\, convincing\, they are experts at impression management
6\. Often your gut will tell you there is something "off" about them \- but you mistakingly ignore it because of their intelligence and they speak well
7\. They focus their abusive\, controlling behavior on family and co\-workers\. 
8\. The stealthiness of their limited target selection combined with speaking to others first makes it easy for them to convince other people that they are the victims
_______________________________________________________________________________________________________________________ 
**Characteristics of Narcissists and Sociopaths (Differences include that narcissists are more professionally successful and outwardly aggressive than sociopaths.)**
1. Fun, charming, and entertaining. [Super polite when meeting new people.](http://www.huffingtonpost.com/entry/polite-people-more-likely-to-betray_55e06f5ae4b0b7a96338a186)
2. Seem to display impressive knowledge or skill at something (which often turns out to be limited or fake).
3. Have a core skill of being perceptive. It can be scary how they seem to know our minds like telepathy.
4. Are easily offended and appear flustered and lash out when offended.
5. Lie about everything and anything - even when they don't need to. 
6. Believe they’re better than everyone. 
7. Crave a good reputation and d[efend it with outrageous lies](https://www.truelovescam.com/boyfriend-says-weird-things/) if needed.
8. Crave status and power, possessions, and money, yet exist at any level of society.
9. They have to act out emotions and social mannerisms (because they have limited actual emotions). 
10\. Have no capacity for care\, concern\, or love\, though sometimes they make it appear like they do\.
11\. Think of themselves as victims and will describe their victimhood to you\, to appeal to your empathy\.
12. Do any horrible, illegal and immoral things they want, to anyone, with conscious, guilt, or shame
13\. Think their "prey" \(partners\, spouses\, co\-workers\, etc\.\) should be and show gratefulness to them\.
14\. Take pride in their scams and run several simultaneously\, such as many girlfriends or boyfriends\.
15\. Believe everyone else deserves whatever bad things they choose to do to them\.
16. [Smear their targets ("prey") when the relationship ends; loudly, publicly, online, and in court](https://www.truelovescam.com/whats-the-smear-campaign-all-about/).
17\. Have outbursts of rage and can be violent\. They talk about dying\, killing themselves and/or others\.
Source:  [https://themindsjournal.com/20-characteristics-of-a-con-man-sociopath/3/?fbclid=IwAR2eSHwuIr8Ts1Sqlw_jvEc-OjygmZYXS2hU77ivvMqbPJHP151OmU8oWWU](https://themindsjournal.com/20-characteristics-of-a-con-man-sociopath/3/?fbclid=IwAR2eSHwuIr8Ts1Sqlw_jvEc-OjygmZYXS2hU77ivvMqbPJHP151OmU8oWWU)

***

FYI - Diagnostic Statistical Manual (DSM-5) (Copywrite 2013) Alternate Model Proposed Diagnostic Criteria for Personality Disorders includes, in part (only), for all disorders: "Part A: Moderate or greater impairment in personality functioning, manifested by characteristic difficulties in two or more of the following areas: (1) Identity, (2) Self-direction, (3) Empathy, and (4) Intimacy." Each disorder also has Part B diagnostic criteria; they differ for each disorder.

***

How to spot a psychopath, by Robert O'Hare, PdD  [https://www.psychologytoday.com/us/articles/199401/charming-psychopath](https://www.psychologytoday.com/us/articles/199401/charming-psychopath)

***

**What Are the Signs of Domestic Abuse?** 
They’re not always as obvious as you might think. That’s because domestic abuse is about controlling someone’s mind and emotions as much as hurting their body. Being abused can leave you mentally scared and confused. It can be hard for you to see your partner’s actions for what they really are. The abuse can creep up slowly and continue subtlety. A verbal putdown here or there. An odd excuse to keep you away from family or friends. Sometimes they wait to be violent only after you’ve been cut off from other people so you feel trapped. If you’re afraid of your partner, that’s a big red flag. You may be scared to say what you think, to bring up certain topics, or to say no to sex. No matter the reason, fear has no place in a healthy relationship.
If you feel like you’re being abused, there’s a good chance you are, and it’s worth getting help.
**Keep that in mind as you think about these signs:**
**Bully, threaten, or control you:** Accuses you of having an affair, Blames you for abuse, Criticizes you. Tells you what to wear and how you should look, Threatens to kill you or someone close to you, Throws things or punches walls when angry, Yells at you, and makes you feel small
**Cuts you off from family and friends:** Keeps close tabs on where you go and whom you go with, Makes you ask for an OK to see friends and family, Embarrasses you in front of others, and it makes you want to avoid people
**Physically abuses you:** Abandons you in a place you don’t know, Keeps you from eating, sleeping, or getting medical care, Locks you in or out of your house, Punches, pushes, kicks, bites, pulls hair
**Controls your money:** Keeps cash and credit cards from you, Puts you on an allowance and makes you explain every dollar you spend, Keeps you from working whatever job you want, Steals money from you or your friends, Won’t let you have money for basic needs like food and clothes
**Sexually abuses you:** Forces you to have sex, Makes you dress in a sexual way, Makes you feel like you owe them sex, Tries to give you an [STD](https://www.webmd.com/sexual-conditions/default.htm), Won’t use [condoms](https://www.webmd.com/sex/birth-control/birth-control-condoms) or other [birth control](https://www.webmd.com/sex/birth-control/)
**National Domestic Violence Hotline at 1-800-799-SAFE (1-800-799-7233).**
[https://www.webmd.com/mental-health/mental-domestic-abuse-signs#2](https://www.webmd.com/mental-health/mental-domestic-abuse-signs#2)
**Meghan Markle provides a full-view educational example of narcissistic behavior.**  Our **healing** opportunity is to **reduce any shame** you may feel about your situation. Narcissism is so poorly understood, neither Harry nor the royal family could protect him from a narcissist initially or succeed in helping him to break away from Meghan once her voluminous narcissist behaviors were on display in plain sight. (Meghan likely felt some loss of control coming and then facilities their move to isolation, first to Canada and now to Santa Barbara, CA - the familiar US for Meghan.)  
**The Oprah interview on March 7, 2021**, provides an **easily digestible view of how a narcissist thinks** and speaks. Megan's control of Harry, entitlement, exploitation, lack of emotional empathy, grandiosity (this interview itself, which Meghan did without Harry for more than the first half). All these behaviors take place in an unconscious (unknowingly) instinctive manner (her manipulations just come to her naturally, she has no specific awareness of them being different than typical societal behavior). Megan is not acting, she is an example of displaying her sincere but delusional beliefs that she is a victim of the royal family, the media, her father/sister, everyone! Meghan is in a stage of idolizing Harry (at the end of the interview she skillfully attributes their "escape" to him); unfortunately, a pattern of de-valuation will likely come in the future.  
**What made Harry susceptible?** It is highly speculated that Princess Diana was unfortunately afflicted with a borderline personality disorder (likely developed from her parent's rejection and banishment to a boarding school). Prince Charles was not a very nurturing father. Diana (who died when Harry was 12), developed his "people-pleasing" personality style and was familiar with relationship instability. Prince Harry described Diana as a mother who “smothered us with love”: “She would just engulf you and squeeze you as tight as possible. And being as short as I was then, there was no escape, you were there and you were there for as long as she wanted to hold you… All I can hear is her laugh in my head and that sort of crazy laugh of where there was just pure happiness shown on her face.”  
**I found the best YouTube video to educate you is from HG Tudor** (A self-proclaimed narcissist-psychopath himself). HG had created a series of 17 short videos on Meghan BEFORE March 7, 2021 (you can back to watch them learn about all her previous behaviors. I suggest you what the HG Tudor video first, before watching the CBS interview.  HG Tudor's Meghan video 18 AFTER the interview [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3kFP3BGeJgY&t=186s](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3kFP3BGeJgY&t=186s)
**Oprah's CBS interview video** is 1:25 long and here is that CBS link.  [https://www.cbs.com/shows/oprah-with-meghan-and-harry-a-cbs-primetime-special/video/i6UW_WTQjLrEeOoObMmlwrFLTTypvuZm/cbs-presents-oprah-with-meghan-and-harry-a-primetime-special/#main-container](https://www.cbs.com/shows/oprah-with-meghan-and-harry-a-cbs-primetime-special/video/i6UW_WTQjLrEeOoObMmlwrFLTTypvuZm/cbs-presents-oprah-with-meghan-and-harry-a-primetime-special/#main-container)

description: ‎Mamadou Diop and his award winning MAMADOU BAND brings MAMADOU friends and fans together at live performance venues. Led by Senegalese native Mamadou Diop, MAMADOU is an eclectic group of musicians who have truly formed a guitar and drum led sound that is all their own (enough to win a Boston Music Award as well as be nominated 4 times). The music they produce is made for dance, and drumming and percussion are integrated into their live shows, getting the audience to move their feet to the beat! description: The group focuses on the data conditioning and application development of a list of real-world examples to advance the skills necessary for a software engineer to leverage machine learning technologies. name: Scenic Kayaking Meetup
description:
Scenic Kayaking . . .
as in kayaking the scenic rivers, lakes and coastal routes of Massachusetts, New Hampshire, Rhode Island and Maine . . .

This kayak group is for advanced beginner, or intermediate to advanced paddlers who can paddle a distance averaging 6-8 miles or more (at an average paddle speed of 2-3 miles per hour) This group for persons over 21 years old and older.

Kayak gear: we encourage members to have a Kayak as there are few chances to rent kayaks at our events. Kayaks need to be a a minimum length of 10 feet or longer, no folding kayaks, and no inflatable kayaks, or sit-on-top or peddling kayaks allowed.

Our plan is to schedule a kayak meet-up every week (weather permitting) during the kayak season, and in the summer months to include some extra kayak events on Fridays(or a week day) as well. Kayak season is from May to October.

**Only those with a clear, updated photo showing their face (no sunglasses, hat, ski goggles, too far in the distance, other people in the photo, or photo too dark) will be approved to join the group.This is so we will recognize you at the meetup events, and, show(unhide) your meet up interests and groups (click on “unhide your interests and groups from others” in your Profiles section).**

**Per club policy,** no pets allowed, and no guests please. Have your guest join the meet-up group (and be approved ) so that they can agree to the liability release and attend an event.

**Where we paddle**: The meetup locations will primarily be within a two hour driving range (North/South/East/West) from the vicinity of the Boston area.

**Kayak Gear:** We recommend you bring your own kayak and related gear, as most of our paddle events do not have kayak rentals on site). You can also rent a Kayak for the day (from EMS or Charles River Canoe and Kayak). Wearing a Coast guard approved PFD on all kayak events is required. **No sit-on-top or inflatable or folding kayaks allowed.**

**Meet-up costs:** We do not charge member fees, nor do we have sponsors (yet) who help pay the organizer’s meetup’s annual fee (which runs about $205 a year). However, if members would like to help contribute towards the cost of the organizers annual fee to meetup.com, we will cheerfully accept voluntary donations. To donate: We accept cash at the event, or you can make a donation via Paypal. If using Paypal the email address is Heidi1225@comcast.net

**Membership Perks:** As a way of saying Thank You to those members who donate $10 or more  for the kayak season, we are offering the following perks: If an event is full, whoever’s first on the wait list who has made a seasonal donation of $10 or more, gets automatically moved up to the RSVP list. With a maximum of 2 donors per event getting to move ahead (Applicable up to 48 hours before the event date). This perk is valid for each and every event throughout the season (Kayak season runs from May to October). 

**Wait list Queue;** members who have made a donation to the group are given priority when being moved up to the RSVP list. In addition; to ensure the safety of the group, (and based on the member ratio of the event), the event host has the discretion at times to prioritize which members get moved up from the waitlist (rather than the waitlist queue being based on date/ time that the member is on the waitlist).

Donations are nonrefundable, and will remain with the group and only be used to fund annual organizer’s meetup.com fees or for the groups safety gear, etc. 

**PLEASE DO NOT DISCUSS POLITICS** as we have members with all kinds of strong opinions - this is not the place for that. Be courteous to everyone and the Organizers who take the effort to list events.
**Other:** Generally, everyone is responsible for carrying /portaging their own kayak to and from the water (unless other people offer to help). Note; its not fair to expect people to randomly help.
Entire inactivity of more than 1 year (not even visiting our page once a year sitting at home!) may lead to exclusion of your membership.

**The importance of keeping this a friendly and healthy united group when doing activities together:**
Members are expected to be civil, show respect and dignity to fellow members, and to follow our safety guidelines (note; if a member doesn’t show good behavior or if the person is not healthy emotionally, and it’s consistent (chronic, not acute), then this group is not a good fit for them).

We are also open to any kayak meetup ideas that you might be interested in. We look forward to having fun and meeting you all!

**ACCIDENT WAIVER AND RELEASE OF LIABILITY**
Participation in any Scenic Kayakers event implies that you have read, understand, and agree with our ACCIDENT WAIVER AND RELEASE OF LIABILITY. Per the Electronic Records and Signatures in Commerce Act, Public Law 106-229 by joining this group, you agree to all the terms listed.
I certify that I am physically fit and prepared for participation in an event and have not been advised otherwise by a qualified medical professional.
I acknowledge awareness of the risks, foreseen and unforeseen, which are inherent in each event/activity. These inherent risks include, but are not limited to, serious personal injury, property damage, and death from participation in or travel to and from the event.
Scenic kayakers and its organizers do not, in any way, claim to be professionals or otherwise licensed, certified, trained, etc. to provide any service including emergency medical procedures.
AS A CONDITION OF ATTENDING and JOINING THIS MEETUP, I AGREE to WAIVE, DISCHARGE CLAIMS, AND RELEASE FROM LIABILITY (Meet up.com, the Scenic Kayak Meet-up Group, its organizers, co-organizers, assistant organizers, trip leaders and event planners, as well as their families from any and all liability on account of, or in any way resulting from injuries, personal or property, losses, costs, damages, disability or death resulting from participating in or traveling to or from the activity. Kayaking, camping, hiking, bicycling, and other activities pose inherent risks and dangers. It is further understood and agreed that this ACCIDENT WAIVER and RELEASE OF LIABILITY is to be binding on my heirs and assigns. This ACCIDENT WAIVER AND RELEASE OF LIABILITY shall be construed broadly and applied to the maximum extent permissible by law. Participation in these activities is voluntary and dependent upon your own personal judgment. The organizers and event hosts in this group are not trained leaders or instructors. The organizers only set the time and place. Each person participating in any group event is responsible for their own safety. In the interest of safety, consuming alcohol during any Scenic Kayakers event is not allowed. Wearing of Coast guard approved Lifejackets (PFD's) is required when paddling with this group. I have read, understand, and agree to abide by the rules of the event/activity as published on the Scenic Kayakers website.

name: The Exploring Group
description:
**When was the last time you did something for the first time?**

This group is dedicated to exploring the world and socializing with people passionate about learning, seeking memorable experiences, and meeting new friends. Mostly light hiking North and Northeast of Boston. Occasionally will tour by other means and some cultural activities.

Event rules:

* Event attendees must be 18 or older.
* You are adults and are expected to make decisions about your own safety and physical abilities.
* Absolutely no harassment, sexism, racism, or other hate speech will be tolerated.
* Anyone with a pattern of no-shows and late cancels may be moved to the waitlist on future events at the discretion of the organizer.
* Wear appropriate footwear and bring plenty of water, sunscreen, and bug spray.
* If you attend an event and decide to leave the group or are struggling, tell someone.
* If you are bringing a dog, maintain control of it and follow the rules of the venue.
* Be friendly. Be social. Have fun.

**Safety Disclaimer**
In registering for an event, you assume all risks when participating, certify that you are physically fit to participate, and have not been advised otherwise by a qualified medical person. All participants must use care and good judgment, and must obey all instructions, rules, and regulations of the venue and local authorities.

name: SMART Recovery Meeting
description: People with any kind of addictive behavior or substance. Free group self-help meetings. Most of our meetings are now online via ZOOM, 700 local and 56 national and specialized. smartrecovery.org/meetings and smartrecovery.org/community, respectively. There have been 37,000 free SMART meetings in MA since 1990. 34 countries host SMART meetings. Our Handbook is published in 17 languages. Medication Assisted Treatment fully supported. Many of our meetings are still on ZOOM. go to smartrecovery.org and click on "MEETINGS" for the full list. 4 Greater Boston meetings have returned to face-to-face status. Keep scrolling down until you hit them, if this is a crucial issue to you: Concord, Quncy, Jamaica Plain and Danvers. Salem soon, too.

name: North Shore T.E.C.H.
description:
Boston, MA is a great hub for technology and business, but I believe we have talent and capability here in the communities along the North Shore that could make it stand out as a powerhouse as well.

This group intends to get together technologists, entrepreneurs, computer professionals, hackers (T.E.C.H.s) and other interested parties to create opportunities for greater networking, collaboration, and advocacy of technology in our community (with an emphasis on software development) as well as helping establish the North Shore area as a great location for tech companies.  Together, I hope we can strengthen our image as innovators in our right, help each other practice our craft and promote our talent to draw some attention away from Boston. ;-)

Please: Recruiters need not apply.  Thanks.

name: North Shore Women Connect
description:
We're a dynamic group of women who connect at least once a month to learn from compelling speakers on topics that inspire and help us succeed! We also meet at monthly networking events to learn and empower one another!

Established in 1984, our mission is to foster opportunities for women to develop professionally and personally through networking, education and social functions.

North Shore Women Connect is a networking organization for women to meet and network north of Boston. In fact, you can't beat the location and convenience of our North Shore events.

For more information check out our website NorthShoreWomenConnect.org.

description:
**EXPERIENCE "TRAVEL & CULTURES" WITH US!**

TRAVEL stems from a passion, and a curiosity about the next town over, the world and its many cultures. This group was formed out of that passion as well as a keen interest in sharing it with others.

**Whether you want to explore your backyard or the world, This Group's for You!**

**Do you love to travel or talk travel?**
Whether you’re just curious, a travel wannabe or a globetrotter you can enjoy the energy and information our members offer. This is a fun and engaging group of travel enthusiasts with a world of experience.

**Need to learn the basics? Want a travel buddy?**
We share travel, tips, industry trends, stories, activities, day trips, weekend adventures, US & International trips, and other travel-related interests in a friendly and informal environment.

**You’re in the right place!**
You'll get a plethora of travel knowledge through our meetings, events, presentations, dinners, happy hours, guest speakers, seasoned travelers and trips. More trips to be announced.

**Need info about a certain region or culture?**
With this group you’ll also find Cultural Activities. Through travel you gain exposure to other cultures (intentionally or through osmosis.) You might interact with similar or drastically different cultures on your journeys but it’s always a fascinating experience and certainly an education. Share your travel and cultural experiences and expertise with others while also learning from them.

**Ask questions, get answers. We’re here to help!**
Whatever your location you can ask questions, offer suggestions and get travel information through the Discussion Board. If you’re visiting Southern CA, come to a meeting or event.

**You can Live Anywhere in the world & Benefit from this group.**
Join us on a trip. You can leave with us or meet us at the destination
(ex. New Orleans, Fiji, on Safari, Grand Canyon, Brazil, Australia, Ireland, Thailand, Boston, Germany, Costa Rica, Chicago, the Mediterranean, the Seychelle islands...)

We hope to see you at our events! Enjoy the group!

Monique
**Travel & Cultures Meetup**

and 
**The Travel & Cultures Company** 
949.400.9080
monique@TravelAndCultures.com
[www.TravelAndCultures.com](http://www.TravelAndCultures.com)
*(a full-service, licensed travel agency)*

**NOTE:**
This group is for Individuals who enjoy traveling or cultural activities rather than for those working in the travel industry, their own business and/or promoting a business. This is to avoid any conflict on interest.

licenses cst #2063964, flst #17873

name: Boston North Sea Kayakers
description:
“This is a group for anyone interested in sea kayaking. This is a public service meetup sponsored by Rock, Paddle, Surf Kayak Coaching and Newbury Kayak to encourage paddlers of all skill levels to hone their skills on the ocean and foster connections. All are welcome to join!


The Boston North Sea Kayakers Group is an informal community of kayakers! A growing group of organizers schedule regular paddling trips north of Boston, MA. The MeetUp Group is free to join, and for those with their own kayaks and equipment, paddles are free to attend — sponsorship by Rock, Paddle, Surf Kayak Coaching means that group dues (for use of the MeetUp website, scheduling and email services) are paid while Newbury Kayak often makes inexpensive rental boats available for MeetUp members participating in group events.

name: Tree of Light, Roots of Peace: Meditate, Create, & Elevate
description:
Welcome journeyers and lightworkers!

The Tree of Light, Roots of Peace meetup group is a sacred meeting space, with the intention to create more inner space and awaken creative inspiration, and to deepen our sense of homecoming within ourselves and with our beautiful Earth... Most of our events take place in Stoughton, MA, indoors and outdoors (including the annual Women Rise event) or the greater Boston area. We offer many wonderful opportunities to get connected with yourself, your creativity, and the natural world in a community of like-minded souls.

This group is for you if you are interested in: \

Learning to meditate \

Becoming more aware of your intuition and inner world \

Bringing your current meditation practice to a deeper level \

Diving deep, healing old traumas, & being fully embodied in a safe and loving space \

Expressing the joy that is You in a loving, supportive community \

Sacred Women's Circles and Sisterhood \

Experiencing the healing power of Sound \

Exploring your Creativity through different art mediums \

Journaling as a transformative experience \

Connecting to the natural world through meditation and QiGong \

The power of Sound healing combined with Yoga and other modalities \

...and other paths to deepening our joy in the human experience

If any of these resonate with you, or you feel a pull or curiosity, we'd love to have you join us!

The Tree of Light, Roots of Peace meetup group was created by Lydia Erickson as a way to share her sound healing, creative arts, and meditation classes in the Boston South Shore area, and to create a beautiful community. You can read more about her journey here and how Tree of Light, Roots of Peace was born: songofthetrees.com

"Tree of Light" honors our physical and spiritual connection with the natural world, and "Roots of Peace" illustrates what happens to a world when the people honor their innate light and consciousness and reclaim their birthright of wholeness and connection to the Earth. The intention beneath healing the self is two-fold, for a release of trauma and a deepening of self-love is also healing to the Earth and life as a whole. To heal our Earth we must heal ourselves, which means staying on the path of growth, following our intuition, and awakening our creative abilities.

Wishing You a Blessed Day!

name: Boston  Networking Meetup Group for Professionals
description:
As a woman entrepreneur with over 10 years of experience in the event industry, I am excited to bring a fresh perspective to professional networking events in the greater Boston area. In 2020, I founded DZ Events with a mission to create unique and memorable experiences for professionals to connect and network.

What sets me apart from others in the industry is my attention to detail and commitment to providing an exceptional experience. I understand the importance of creating an environment that fosters meaningful connections and allows attendees to have fun and enjoy themselves. With my extensive network of over 20K connections from all of my business group memberships, including Boston Business Women, I have the ability to bring professionals from different industries together and create a thriving networking community.

I am proud to have already hosted a successful networking event at the Stockyard in Brighton and am now gearing up for my next event at Innovations at District Hall in Boston's Seaport.

As a woman entrepreneur with a passion for professional networking, I am committed to making a difference in the lives of professionals in the greater Boston area. With DZ Events, I aim to create an experience that not only meets but exceeds attendees' expectations and leaves them with lasting connections and memories.

Dayna Zola, CEO and Founder, The DZ Group and DZ Events LLC www.dzeventsllc.com

name: MetroWest Scratch Educator Meetup
description:
ScratchEd Meetups are peer-designed professional learning experiences inspired by the unconference model. This means that at any given event, you decide what your learning looks like! At a Meetup, you can share, create, and learn with other educators who are also passionate about teaching with Scratch in the classroom. Anyone who is interested in connecting with fellow educators and learning more about using Scratch in educational settings is welcome to participate.

The MetroWest group welcomes anyone from the greater Boston areas, including but not limited to Groton, Concord, Carlisle, Acton, Boxborough, Lincoln, Sudbury and beyond.

Sound intriguing? We hope to see you soon!

name: Divorce/Separation Support, South of Boston
description:
Note that we are not accepting new members at this time.

If you’re going through, or have gone through, divorce or separation you know there is a wide array of emotions and stresses.  Grief, pain, sadness, anger, remorse, regret, mourning, confusion, fear, heartbreak, depression and anxiety.   Let’s not go through it alone. 
 
Anyone who is in the process of getting divorced/separated, is about to begin that process, or has gone through it is welcome to join.
 
I created this group because I am in the midst of this emotional rollercoaster and find that talking about it with others who are in the midst of it, or have gone through it, helps me process my situation more effectively.   I know there are others out there in the same boat.  Let’s help each other through it.  This will become OUR group, not my group.
 
I have rented a conference room in Norwell for two evenings each month to provide comfortable, quiet, and confidential space for us to talk.  I am tentatively planning on every other Monday evening from 7:00--8:30pm.  We can chat there in confidence then hit a bar to grab a bite and/or a drink after the session for anyone interested in connecting socially (leaving the divorce talk behind).  We may adjust frequency depending on attendance and feedback from the group.

Note that we won’t have any professionals here.  No therapists or counselors. Just a group of people working through these challenges looking for support and a place to talk about it.  If we grow in size and decide together to bring in guest speaker(s) or a meeting facilitator or the like we can decide that together.
 
Member / Meeting rules:

1. Confidentiality is critical. What’s said in the meeting stays in the meeting.
    a.      Do not repeat who you saw or what was said in the meeting.
    b.      Do not guess what someone would mind having repeated – just don’t repeat it.
    c.      If you meet someone from the group in another situation, don’t discuss their participation in this group unless initiated by them. Let them decide if they want to mention their involvement in this new setting.
    d.      Do not share with the group anything that would be harmful to you if it were repeated.
    2)     **Respect** – We must respect each other and provide a listening ear.  Offer advice only when requested and remember to label your ideas as your opinion based on your experience versus the right or wrong way.
    3)     No one will be forced to participate in the discussion.  Some of us will be there to just listen and learn.
    4)     This will be a **judgement free zone**.  A safe space.  “Killer comments” are not appropriate in a support group. These include sarcastic comments, cutting humor, hurtful statements, and inappropriate body language and facial expressions.
    5)     Guests are welcome.  A support person (friend, family member) can be helpful to increase your comfort level.  Please make sure they follow these rules.
    6)     Pets are not allowed.  
     
    To help pay for the room I ask for a $5 donation per person, per meeting.  I’ll reduce the request if we get enough people to cover the expense. I’m not looking to make money on this.  If $2 per person covers the cost that is what I will ask for.  If $5 per person does not cover it, I will make up the difference.  Don’t let the money stop you from joining.  You will not be turned away.

name: Boston Holistic Healing Center Reiki Circle/Share, Sharon MA
description:
Calling all Reiki Practitioners. . . 

Join us as we unite in Reiki Circle - share, heal, and learn from each other! A Reiki Circle/Share consists of many healing hands on one person at a time. One person lies on a table while the participating practitioners gather around that person, laying their hands upon him/her, facilitating a massive flow of Reiki energies. Group's combine energy is often very strong and can be more than individual sessions. This type of Reiki treatment is a wonderful and can often create a profound experience! This Circle is open to all Reiki Levels. First time attendees, please e-mail/send a copy of your Reiki Practitioner Certificate prior to Reiki Circle.

About Ludmila

Ludmila is an accomplished Intuitive and Holistic Practitioner, Certified Holistic Nutrition Counselor (HNC), Certified Reiki Master/Teacher (RM/T), Certified Meditation Facilitator (CMF) and a Member of American Association of Drugless Practitioners.


For over 18 years Ludmila has helped her clients achieve physical healing, pain and stress relief as well as greater feeling of well-being. Through the sessions that may combine energy healing, intuitive counseling and naturopathy Ludmila can help you to eliminate causes of sickness, and clear mental and emotional blocks that prevent you from feeling well and living the life you really want to live. Through the unique blend of intuition, the ability to channel energy and the knowledge of naturopathy 

Ludmila removes toxins, releases blockages, rejuvenates and provides her clients with vital, healing energy. Being a Holistic Practitioner, Ludmila is very well aware of nutrition’s vital role in her client’s health. Therefore, she offers her clients, adults and children alike, a Nutrition and Wellness program.
Through her practice, Ludmila has helped numerious clients with diagnosed and undiagnosed physical pains, chronic conditions to overcome or greatly elevate issues related to Anxiety, Depression, Migraine, Thyroid Issues, Gout, Fibromyalgia, Diabetes, Sciatica, Back Pain, Sport Injuries, Irritable Bowel Syndrome, Urinary Tract Infection, Diverticular Disease, ADD and ADHD, surgical prep and recovery, support during pregnancy and childbirth and much more.

name: Beyond the Beaten Path - Boston - Adventure Travel For 40+
description:
Welcome to Beyond the Beaten Path!

My husband and I love to travel and explore new places, but he isn't interested in active adventures so I started this group to find others to share these adventures with.

We are a group of mature travelers (min age is 40) who enjoy a bit (or more!) of adventure as they explore interesting locations around the world. The majority of our trips are small groups of 8-24 and include activities such as hiking, biking, kayaking, SUP, snorkeling, diving, etc. All skill levels are welcome!

Solo travelers are welcome. If desired, we will attempt to match you with a same sex roommate. If not, solo supplements will vary depending on trip specifics.

Benefitting the communities we visit is a core value, so many of our trips will use small, locally owned businesses. Supporting local entrepreneurs and small businesses strengthens communities, raises the overall quality of life, and ensures that the places we love will continue to be loved. This doesn't mean we will be "roughing it" though - expect 3-4.5-star accommodations.

If a trip we're hosting is of interest to you, please rsvp "yes" on the Meetup page. It just means that you'd like more information -- it is not an obligation to go

Join us to explore and have fun!

Indemity Agreement: By joining our meetup group you agree to hold Beyond the Beaten Path, its organizers and its vendors free from liability or responsibility what so ever with regard to any negligent or intentional conduct of any third party including but not limited to Tour Company, Property Owners, etc. resulting in the loss of personal property, physical injury, monetary loss with regard to an event/meetup. In joining this meetup and signing up or paying or attending any of our listed events or tours you are in agreement to the above. If you rsvp adding a guest/s to an event they are also subject to the same Indemity Agreement. You also agree that your membership of this group is based on an "at will" basis.

All members agree to be respectful towards all members. Failure to do so, will be cause to be removed from the Group.

name: Lowell Mason House Music Center Meetup
description:
We are looking for people who are interested in learning about the restoration, renovation, and programming of the Lowell Mason House Music Center, the 1792 birthplace of Lowell Mason in Medfield, Massachusetts. Music educators, church musicians, and fans of American/New England history and historic preservation from around the country should consider joining as well as anyone in the local Medfield and or Greater Boston communities who will directly benefit from the programming opportunities that are created. Those who would like to help with the physical restoration and/or maintenance of the house, support the fund-raising initiatives, and those who would be like to act as docents or guides for the house, are encouraged to join as well. 

Lowell Mason (1792-1872) is best known as the founder of American school music education. His work as a pioneer music educator, first at the Boston Academy of Music which he co-founded in 1833 with George James Webb and soon after in the Boston public schools, where he taught for over twenty years, is one of his greatest historical legacies. He also also known as a pioneer composer of American sacred music as he wrote, arranged, and published many hymns and sacred music collections. The Lowell Mason House was founded in October of 2010 when a group of concerned Medfield citizens and music educators from around the country came together with the desire to preserve the house and legacy of Lowell Mason the Father of Music Education in America. Within months we generated enough support and organized to secure a new location for the house and move it before demolition by a local developer to town owned land next to Hinckley Pond.

The Mission of the Lowell Mason House is to create and program an active space for music making, music and arts education advocacy and historical preservation within the original structure of the Lowell Mason birthplace.

The Lowell Mason House will be a major cultural hub. It will serve as a museum honoring Lowell Mason, while advocating for the importance of music education, and offer a diverse selection of music instruction and performance in facilities that encourage artistic expression and strengthen the value of the arts in the community.

Conversations will remain friendly and a cordial. All points of view and opinions will be respected. The group is not a qualified professional support group for men who are experiencing recent divorce or widow situations, and it is not designated as group for men seeking liaisons for dating, etc. It is a diverse group that is inclusive and tolerant of religions, politics, age, race, straight, gay, divorce, etc., and other issues. Everyone is welcome. It exists for the personal enjoyment of its members. The group may occasionally attend special events such as music concerts, lectures, art, history or science museums, and other cultural activities. Everyone is welcome to bring a friend to our meetings and events.

name: Let's Laugh Today LAUGHTER YOGA on ZOOM is FREE!
description:
LAUGHTER YOGA on ZOOM
Learn how to add more joyful laughter to your life by attending the **Let's Laugh Today Laughter Club in Franklin or Sharon, MA, but now on ZOOM!** There are always special events in other towns or we can even come to your group! See [www.letslaughtoday.com](http://www.letslaughtoday.com)  You can sign up for a very cool monthly e-newsletter there! We are also **www.bostonlaughteryoga.com** as we are the best in Boston, MA! Anyone can do these easy, healthful breathing techniques along with simulated laughter that always seems to turn into real laughter! All ages and levels of physical ability are welcome. There are no fancy poses and no jokes or comedy is involved. There's plenty of free parking at all our venues. **Since laughing is dehydrating, please bring your water bottle.**
Linda and Bill Hamaker are Certified Laughter Yoga Master Trainers and have trained with the Indian physician, Dr. Madan Kataria, who created Laughter Yoga plus are also graduates of the American School of Laughter Yoga. You will leave the session feeling relaxed, energized and full of joy and happiness!

Contact us through this Meet-up or our e-mail is billandlinda@letslaughtoday.com and see the web site [http://www.letslaughtoday.com/](http://www.letslaughtoday.com/) for more information and other opportunities to laugh with us and special events! We have been successful with our groups for over ten years now! All ages are invite to attend. **Remember, we can also provide a FUNtastic laughter session for your own group or train you to bring the joy to your own community!**
**Meet-ups cost us $110 every 6 months, so feel free to donation via PayPal. The email is lgh324@aol.com. Please help out with any amount! Thank you in advance.**

Smiles,

Linda and Bill Hamaker
billandlinda@letslaughtoday.com

name: Happy Geeks of Greater Boston
description:
We are a collection of happy geeks! We are people who are into anime, fantasy, sci fi, video games, tabletop gaming, manga, comic books, and more. Mostly we just like to get together and have fun! We have anime nights, gaming nights, movie nights, costume parties, etc. and do public events such as conventions, Renaissance Faires, museums and picnics. If you live in the MetroWest/Greater Boston area and want to meet people with similar interests, then join our group and come to an event!

Group Rules:

Be respectful and courteous of your fellow group members. This includes using polite behavior as well as exercising proper hygiene :). 

Harassment and abuse of any kind is not tolerated and may get you removed from the group at the Organizer's discretion. All harassment and abuse should be reported to the Organizer (Emily Renauld) as soon as it happens.

Please note that we are not a singles group! Of course, it is inevitable people will meet and fall in love in this group, but we are primarily here to make friends and share activities and interests with each other. Please don't expect to meet your soul mate or "hook up" with people. Treat everyone, regardless of gender or relationship status, with respect!

You must be able to provide your own transportation. We realize that not everyone has a car, but please make sure ahead of time that you have a ride to and from all events. Event hosts and other members are not responsible for providing transportation to other members to or from events.

Only RSVP to an event if you are able to attend. Three "no shows" will get you removed from the group. Telling an event organizer or host in advance that you will not be able to make it will not count against you. For events that require planning for a specific number of people, or for events that are full, you should give at least 24 hours notice if you can no longer attend. Giving less than 24 hours notice may count as a "no show" at the event organizer's discretion. Illness or other legitimate reasons are an exception.

Please read event descriptions carefully! If an event host says to bring food, drink or cash to pitch in, you are expected to follow through. If an event gives a deadline to back out, you should adhere to that or expect to incur a "no show."

We only accept members who are 21+. The age range for our meetup members is 20's and 30's. If we discover that you are not 21, you will be removed from the group.

All members are required to have one personal photo (a picture of their face) in their profile photo file. We will turn down applications with no picture or pictures with non-visible faces.

You're expected to have a name that you go by as part of your meetup profile. This is for safety purposes as well as to help event organizers mark your attendance correctly. A first name or nickname is fine.

You're expected to remain active in the meetup group. This means you should visit the page at least once per month or so to check out what events we've got going on. We will remove any members who have been inactive for 6 months. 

A part of being in the meetup group is receiving communications from organizers. These are typically important updates and you are expected to read them. If you feel you are getting too many e-mails from Meetup itself, you may adjust your e-mail settings on the meetup page (this is not something that we can control).

You can e-mail me at any point through the e-mail on my profile page.

name: New England Real Estate Investors Unleashed
description:
REI Unleashed is a community of real estate investors looking to connect and network with like-minded investors and related professionals so that we can learn, grow, & conduct more business together!

Events are held on the first, second, third and fourth Tuesdays of each month. Alternating between Manchester NH , Greater Boston/ Waltham area, Central MA, and South Coast / Attleboro locations. 

We also host some [beginner events at Fix & Flip projects](https://www.meetup.com/New-England-Real-Estate-Fix-Flip-Wholesaler-Rehab-Meetup/) across New England. Please refer to each individual event to verify the location for the month.

All events are open to the public, there are no membership fees or dues. Local speakers will present on topics of interest, and will not be selling anything.
Attendees are welcome to stand up and introduce themselves to the group, you can bring deals to buy and sell. SEC guidelines must be followed and no open raising of capital. No multi-level marketing solicitation during or after the event.
We'd love it if you'd support the venue by purchasing dinner or drinks but it's not required. We encourage a relaxed, informal, and fun atmosphere where we can all network and learn new strategies.
Join our Facebook Group [New England REI Unleashed](https://www.facebook.com/groups/reiunleashed) to keep up with event announcements, network, ask for recommendations and feedback!

name: Meditation and Simple Silence
description:
We've been sitting in meditation circles in Boston's MetroWest for 15 years now! Fresh, alive and simple, these are touch points of peace and simple happiness for many friends.

There are drop-in groups each week on Friday mornings at 9. We sit for about 40 (the time goes quickly in a small group) and then have a cup of tea.  There is no charge and donations are welcome.  You too can support these circle and the good energy, kindness and wellbeing in our neighborhoods and community.

If you've been meditating on your own, these groups can jump-start your sittings. It's an amazing effect to sit with a group in stillness. If you're new at meditating, you can either just show up (it's easier than you might think because it's natural!) or, send a note to me and come a little early and I can give you some tips. I look forward to seeing you here!

name: Framingham LGBT Social Club
description:
This is an LGBTQ social group that is based in the Metro West suburbs of Boston. We invite anyone who lives, plays or works in this area . Of course, you don't necessarily have to reside in Metro West to participate, but you would have to be willing to come here for several of our events.

Our focus is on friendship, networking and socializing. We plan to sponsor a variety of free, low to mid-cost events and occasional splurges. 

Some of the activities include (but aren't limited to): board games, card games, hikes, walks, wine and beer tastings, day trips, potlucks, museum visits and live entertainment.

Participation in this group requires your willingness and commitment to hosting or leading at least one event per year. The cost to join will be $5 per year payable in person or via PayPal We look forward to meeting you and other locals!

We will be hosting hikes, bar nights, and any other events that we think up as a group. New ideas welcome!
